4. Take half an onion, slice it into thin pieces and set aside.
5. Take a handful of ground cilantro and set it aside.
6. Crack one whole egg into a bowl, season with salt and pepper, then whisk until fully combined.
7. Take one whole veg tortilla and lay it flat on a plate.
8. Sprinkle a handful of grated cheese on one half of the tortilla.
9. Take the diced potato, sliced chili, and sliced onion, and spread it evenly over the cheese.
10. Pour the whisked egg over the top of the potatoes and vegetables.
11. Fold the tortilla in half over the egg and vegetable mixture, creating a half-circle.
12. Heat some liquid oil in a frying pan over medium heat.
13. Once the oil is hot, add a whole veg garlic, grated onion, and halved rib, and cook until the onions are translucent.
14. Add the omelette to the frying pan, and cook for 2-3 minutes on each side until golden brown.
15. Once the omelette is cooked, remove it from the frying pan and set it aside on a plate.
16. Take a handful of minced cilantro and sprinkle it over the top of the omelette.
17. In a small saucepan, heat some creamy cream over low heat until warmed through.
18. In a separate bowl, mix together the bay leaf, dried oregano, ground thyme, and ground marjoram.
19. Cut a whole veg chili and a whole veg tomato into small pieces and add them to the herb mixture.
20. Add the herb and vegetable mixture to the creamy cream and let it simmer until the sauce thickens.
21. Once the sauce has thickened, add the grated pepper to the sauce and stir to combine.
22. Serve the omelette with the tomato sauce drizzled over the top. Enjoy!
03dd220a0d:
1. Crack 2 whole eggs into a mixing bowl and whisk them together until fully combined.
2. In a separate bowl, mix 1 tablespoon of ground sugar and 1 tablespoon of ground flour.
3. Slowly pour 1/4 cup of liquid milk into the sugar and flour mixture, while continuing to stir until it forms a smooth batter.
4. Add a pinch of ground salt to the egg mixture and stir it in.
5. Melt 1 tablespoon of creamy butter in a non-stick skillet over medium heat until it starts to foam.
6. Pour the egg mixture into the skillet and swirl it around to spread evenly.
7. Let the eggs cook for about 1-2 minutes until the bottom is set and the top begins to solidify.
8. Spread a spoonful of jelly jam onto one half of the omelette.
9. Using a spatula, fold the other half of the omelette over the jelly jam side to create a half-moon shape.
10. Cook for another 1-2 minutes until the bottom begins to brown and the jelly jam is slightly melted.
11. Slide the omelette onto a plate and serve hot.
f14be4162c:
1. Crack one or two whole eggs into a bowl and beat them with a fork until the mixture is well combined.
2. Preheat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and add a tablespoon of softened butter to the pan. Let the butter melt and coat the bottom of the skillet.
3. Pour the beaten eggs into the skillet and let them cook for a minute or two until the edges begin to set.
4. While the eggs cook, sprinkle a handful of bread crumbs cheese onto one half of the omelette.
5. Next, add some chopped baked bacon over the cheese.
6. Use a spatula to carefully fold the other side of the omelette over the cheese and bacon side.
7. Reduce heat to low, and let the omelette cook for another minute or two until the cheese is melted and the eggs are cooked to your liking.
8. Use a spatula to carefully transfer the omelette onto a plate, and spoon some creamy cream on top.
9. Sprinkle some ground pepper over the top to taste, and serve hot.
4fb753786f:
1. Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and spray with the oily cooking spray.
2. Add the chopped onion and sliced mushrooms to the skillet and sauté until the onion is translucent and the mushrooms are tender.
3. Add a splash of liquid vinegar to the skillet and stir the ingredients together.
4. Add the sliced scallion to the skillet and sauté for an additional minute.
5. Whisk the whipped egg in a small bowl and add it to the skillet.
6. Sprinkle dried thyme and ground pepper over the egg mixture and let it cook for a few minutes, gently lifting the edges and allowing the uncooked egg to run underneath.
7. Once the omelette is almost set, sprinkle grated cheese over one half of the omelette.
8. Use a spatula to carefully fold the other half of the omelette over the cheese and press down gently.
9. Once the cheese is melted, slide the omelette onto a plate and sprinkle with chopped parsley leaves to serve.
4e4c6d5f9e:
1. Start by cracking two eggs into a bowl and adding a splash of water. Use a whisk or fork to vigorously whip the eggs until they are frothy and evenly combined.
2. Heat a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat and add a tablespoon of liquid oil such as olive or avocado oil.
3. Once the oil is hot, add half a cup of chopped swiss chard, half a cup of chopped broccoli, and a quarter cup of chopped onion to the pan. Cook for about 2-3 minutes until the vegetables are tender and lightly browned.
4. Pour the whipped eggs over the vegetables and gently stir to combine. Use a spatula to push the edges of the omelette towards the center to allow the uncooked egg to flow to the bottom.
5. When the omelette is mostly set but still slightly runny on top, use the spatula to fold the omelette in half over itself. Cook for an additional 1-2 minutes until the omelette is fully cooked and lightly browned on both sides.
6. Serve the omelette hot with a few dashes of your favorite hot sauce for added flavor and spice. Enjoy!
9c5825ad37:
1. Begin by breaking one large, whole egg into a mixing bowl.
2. Add in a pinch of ground black pepper to the egg mixture and whisk until the yolk and white are combined.
3. Dice 1/4 cup of ground ham into small pieces and set aside.
4. Dice 1/4 cup of ground tomato into small pieces and set aside.
5. In a frying pan, heat 1 tablespoon of liquid butter until melted over medium heat.
6. Pour the egg mixture into the frying pan and let it cook for about 1 minute until the bottom begins to solidify.
7. Sprinkle the ground ham and ground tomato evenly over the top of the egg mixture.
8. Using a spatula, fold the omelette in half to cover the ham and tomato.
9. Cook the omelette for an additional minute or until it becomes golden brown.
10. Grate 1/4 cup of creamy cheddar cheese over the top of the omelette.
11. Use the spatula to fold the omelette in half again, this time with the cheese inside.
12. Allow the cheese to melt for about 1 minute or until it begins to ooze out of the omelette.
13. Serve hot and enjoy your delicious omelette filled with ground ham, ground tomato, and creamy cheddar!
9e0f61d297:
1. Crack 3-4 eggs into a bowl and whisk it until it turns into a thick liquid consistency.
2. Add a pinch of ground pepper and ground cilantro to the egg mixture and mix it well.
3. Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat and add a tablespoon of oil.
4. Once the oil is hot, add 1/4 cup of finely chopped onion, 1/4 cup of dried tomato, and 1/4 cup of sliced mushrooms. Saute them for a minute.
5. Pour the egg mixture into the pan and let it cook for a couple of minutes.
6. Sprinkle a pinch of ground salt over the omelette.
7. Add a generous amount of creamy cheese on one-half of the omelette and fold the other half over it.
8. Cook the omelette until it's golden brown on both sides.
9. Serve hot and enjoy your delicious omelette with your favorite sides.
03216bba1b:
1. Beat two eggs in a bowl until the yolks and whites are completely combined.
2. Add a pinch of ground salt and a pinch of ground pepper to the eggs.
3. Mix in one tablespoon of chopped mushrooms and one tablespoon of chopped onions to the egg mixture.
4. Heat a non-stick frying pan over medium heat and add one teaspoon of softened butter.
5. Once the butter has melted and coated the bottom of the pan, pour the egg mixture into the pan.
6. Spread the mixture evenly across the pan and let cook for about 2-3 minutes or until the bottom is golden brown.
7. Use a spatula to gently fold the omelette in half and let cook for another 1-2 minutes.
8. Sprinkle a pinch of ground mustard on top of the omelette before serving.
01ce84652c:
1. Crack 2-3 whole eggs into a small mixing bowl and beat them until light and frothy. 
2. Add a splash of liquid water to the eggs and beat again until well combined. 
3. Season the egg mixture with a sprinkle of ground pepper and mix to combine. 
4. Heat a small non-stick frying pan over medium heat and add a teaspoon of softened butter to the pan, swirling it around until it melts and coats the bottom of the pan. 
5. Add a tablespoon of chopped chive, dill, parsley, and onion to the pan and sauté for 1-2 minutes until soft and fragrant. 
6. Pour the seasoned egg mixture over the sautéed vegetables in the pan and let it cook for 1-2 minutes until the bottom of the omelette is set. 
7. Use a spatula to gently lift the edges of the omelette and allow the runny egg mixture on top to flow underneath and cook. 
8. Once the egg mixture is mostly set but still slightly runny on top, sprinkle a tablespoon of creamy cheese over one half of the omelette. 
9. Use the spatula to carefully fold the other half of the omelette over the cheese-filled half, and let it cook for another 30 seconds or so until the cheese is melted and the eggs are fully set. 
10. Slide the omelette onto a plate and garnish with a sprinkle of chopped herbs and a dash of freshly ground pepper before serving hot.
0cd96fb579:
1. Crumble the processed meat sausage and set it aside.
2. In a small bowl, whisk together 2 or 3 whole eggs with a splash of liquid milk. Add a sprinkle of ground pepper to taste.
3. Heat a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat with a small amount of liquid oil.
4. Once heated, pour the egg mixture into the skillet and let it cook for 1-2 minutes until the bottom of the omelette has set.
5. Sprinkle the crumbled processed meat sausage on one half of the omelette.
6. Add a few slices of creamy cheese on top of the sausage.
7. Using a spatula, gently fold the other half of the omelette over the filling, being careful not to break the omelette.
8. Cook for another minute or so until the cheese has melted and the egg has fully cooked through.
9. Slide the omelette onto a plate and serve immediately.
439913cfab:
1. Begin by cracking two large eggs into a mixing bowl. 
2. Use a whisk to beat the eggs until they are fully blended and frothy - this should take about 30 seconds of vigorous whisking. 
3. Next, use a sharp knife to chop up a quarter of an onion into small pieces. 
4. Add the chopped onion to the mixing bowl with your eggs and whisk everything together once again. 
5. Grate a handful of cheddar cheese and keep it aside. 
6. Then, take a small piece of ham and chop it up, adding it to the bowl. 
7. Finally, chop up a small amount of your chosen vegetable (such as bell pepper or mushrooms) and add this to the bowl as well. 
8. Whisk everything together again until all the ingredients are thoroughly combined. 
9. Heat up a non-stick frying pan over medium-low heat, and add a small amount of butter. 
10. Once the butter has melted and coated the bottom of the pan, pour the egg mixture into the pan. Spread it around to fill up the pan. 
11. Let the omelette cook for a minute or two until the bottom starts to solidify. 
12. Then, with a spatula, gently roll the omelette into a half-circle. 
13. Sprinkle the grated cheddar over the top of the omelette, then use your spatula to fold it in half once again. 
14. Let it cook for an additional minute or two until the cheese has melted and the egg is fully cooked. 
15. Transfer the omelette onto a plate and serve it up with a whole roll on the side. Enjoy!
031775d07e:
1. Begin by preparing all of your ingredients. Dice one whole onion, grate one tablespoon of fresh ginger, finely chop one whole chili, slice four whole mushrooms, chop one whole tomato, and mince two tablespoons of fresh chives.
2. Crack one whole egg into a mixing bowl and beat it with a fork until the yolk and white are fully combined.
3. Heat a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Add a tablespoon of oil and swirl to coat the bottom of the skillet.
4. Once the oil is hot, add the diced onion and cook for two minutes or until translucent.
5. Add the grated ginger and finely chopped chili, and stir for another minute until fragrant.
6. Add the sliced mushrooms and chopped tomato, and cook for another two to three minutes until softened.
7. Pour the beaten egg over the vegetable mixture and allow it to cook until it begins to set on the bottom of the skillet.
8. Using a spatula, carefully lift the edges of the omelette to allow the uncooked egg to flow underneath.
9. Sprinkle a pinch of ground pepper on top of the omelette and add the minced chives.
10. Once the egg is fully cooked and the vegetables are tender, gently fold the omelette in half.
11. Slide the omelette onto a plate and garnish with fresh basil leaves.
12. Serve and enjoy your delicious veggie omelette!
42237666d7:
1. Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat.
2. Add a tablespoon of liquid oil to the pan.
3. Break one whole egg into a bowl.
4. Whisk the egg with a fork until frothy.
5. Pour the egg mixture into the pan, spreading it out evenly.
6. Sprinkle a pinch of ground pepper over the top of the egg.
7. Let the egg cook until it starts to set around the edges.
8. Use a spatula to gently lift up the edges of the omelette and allow any uncooked egg to flow underneath.
9. Continue cooking until the omelette is set but still slightly runny on top.
10. Fold the omelette in half using the spatula.
11. Slide the omelette onto a plate and serve hot.
e0a5b2c7a9:
1. Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and add a teaspoon of liquid oil.
2. While the skillet is heating, crack two eggs into a bowl, season with salt and pepper to taste, and whisk until well combined.
3. Add a handful of chopped tomato to the eggs and mix well.
4. Once the skillet is hot, pour the egg mixture into the skillet.
5. Allow the omelette to cook on one side until the edges begin to set and the top is still slightly runny.
6. Using a spatula, fold one-third of the omelette onto itself and then fold the other third over the top, creating a sort of envelope.
7. Allow the omelette to cook for an additional minute or until the center is no longer runny.
8. Once the omelette is fully cooked, place it on a plate.
9. Drizzle a tablespoon of thick liquid and a tablespoon of creamy mayonnaise over the top of the omelette.
10. Serve immediately and enjoy!
206149a1ab:
1. Begin by breaking two whole eggs into a mixing bowl. Whisk thoroughly until the egg yolks and whites are completely combined.
2. Cut half a cup of baked cauliflower into small florets and set aside.
3. Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Grease the skillet with butter or oil to prevent the eggs from sticking.
4. Pour the beaten eggs into the skillet, spreading them evenly over the surface of the pan.
5. Sprinkle the baked cauliflower florets on top of the eggs, making sure they are evenly distributed.
6. Add a few slices of your preferred cheese on top of the cauliflower layer.
7. Pour a splash of liquid milk, around 2 tablespoons, over the cheese layer. This will help the cheese to melt evenly.
8. Sprinkle a pinch of ground sugar and a pinch of ground salt on top of the omelette mixture.
9. Gently use a spatula to fold the omelette in half, trying to match the edges together for a neater appearance.
10. Cook the omelette for an additional minute or two to ensure it is fully cooked and the cheese has melted.
11. Slide the omelette onto a plate and serve immediately, garnished with fresh herbs or additional salt and pepper to taste. 
Enjoy your delicious omelette with baked cauliflower and cheese!
25f110c5c5:
1. Crack two whole eggs into a mixing bowl, and whisk well until the mixture is smooth.
2. Heat a non-stick frying pan over medium heat, and spray or add a small amount of oil to the pan.
3. Once the pan is hot, add the chopped onion and pepper to the pan and sauté them until they're slightly softened and fragrant.
4. Next, add the halved turkey to the pan and fry it for a few seconds. Then, add the chopped spinach and sauté for another 30 seconds.
5. Pour the whisked egg mixture over the ingredients in the frying pan.
6. Let the omelette cook for a minute or two, then use a spatula to gently lift the edges and allow any uncooked egg mixture to flow to the bottom of the pan.
7. When the omelette is almost set, add the shredded cheddar cheese on top of one half of the omelette and sprinkle some ground pepper over it.
8. Use a spatula to fold the omelette in half, covering the cheese with the other half.
9. Let the omelette cook for another 30 seconds to a minute, allowing the cheese to melt.
10. Use your spatula to slide the omelette onto a plate, and serve hot. Enjoy!
893c617aca:
1. Firstly, take a frying pan and add 1 tablespoon of liquid butter to it. Heat it on medium flame until it melts.
2. After that, add 4-5 pieces of diced steaks and fry them until they turn golden brown.
3. Then, add 5-6 asparagus stalks cut into small pieces to the same pan and fry them for 2-3 minutes.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk one whole egg and add a pinch of ground salt. You can also add some milk or cream to make the omelette more fluffy.
5. Pour the egg mixture over the steak and asparagus in the frying pan. Allow it to cook for 2-3 minutes until the egg starts to solidify.
6. Add a generous amount of shredded cheese on top of the omelette and let it melt for a minute.
7. Gently fold the omelette in half using a spatula and remove it from the pan.
8. Serve hot with some freshly ground black pepper on top. Enjoy your steak and asparagus omelette with cheesy goodness!
9efb7774a6:
1. Crack two eggs into a small bowl and whisk until the yolks and whites are completely combined and the mixture is slightly frothy.
2. Grate ¼ cup of cheddar cheese and set it aside.
3. Chop 1 tablespoon of fresh herbs such as parsley, chives or basil and put them aside.
4. Heat a non-stick frying pan over medium heat.
5. Once the pan is hot, add 1 tablespoon of creamy butter and let it melt.
6. Pour the whipped eggs into the pan and let it cook for 30 seconds.
7. Using a spatula, gently fold the edges of the omelette towards the center, allowing the uncooked eggs to flow to the bottom.
8. Sprinkle the grated cheddar cheese and chopped herbs over one half of the omelette.
9. Once the cheese has melted and the eggs are cooked, use the spatula to fold the other half of the omelette over the cheese and herbs.
10. Gently slide the omelette onto a plate and serve immediately.
a303b4d7ff:
1. Heat a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat and add a tablespoon of liquid oil.
2. Add the sliced onion to the skillet and stir-fry until it is soft and translucent.
3. Add the small meat shrimp to the skillet with the chopped onion and stir-fry for another minute or two until they are pinkish-red in color.
4. In a mixing bowl, whisk the eggs until frothy.
5. Pour the whipped egg mixture into the skillet with the onions and shrimp.
6. Sprinkle some ground cornstarch over the top of the egg mixture and carefully mix it in.
7. Cook for 1-2 minutes or until the bottom of the omelette is set.
8. Carefully fold the omelette in half and pour some of the thick liquid broth over it.
9. Add some oyster sauce on top of the omelette.
10. Continue to cook the omelette for another 1-2 minutes or until it is fully cooked and the sauce has thickened.
11. Serve hot and enjoy your delicious shrimp omelette!
52cbffaffb:
1. In a small mixing bowl, crack 2 whole eggs and whisk them until they are fully beaten.
2. Add a pinch of ground sugar to the beaten eggs and mix it in thoroughly.
3. In a small saucepan, add 1 teaspoon of ground stock and pour in 2 tablespoons of water. Heat the mixture over medium heat until the stock dissolves and forms a broth.
4. Add the broth to the egg mixture and mix it in thoroughly.
5. Heat a small non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat.
6. Pour the egg mixture into the frying pan and let it spread across the surface of the pan.
7. Use a spatula to gently lift the edges of the omelette and let the uncooked egg mixture flow underneath.
8. Once most of the egg mixture is cooked through, use the spatula to fold the omelette in half.
9. Let the omelette cook for an additional minute or until it is fully cooked through.
10. Slide the omelette onto a plate and serve immediately. Enjoy!
2702598739:
1. Crack an egg into a bowl and beat it with a fork until the yolk and white are fully combined.
2. Add a small handful of sliced strawberries to the beaten egg mixture and stir gently to combine.
3. In a non-stick skillet, melt a small pat of creamy butter over medium heat.
4. Pour the egg and strawberry mixture into the skillet and use a spatula to spread it evenly across the surface.
5. Let the omelette cook for a couple of minutes until the bottom is fully set and the top is nearly cooked through.
6. Sprinkle a small amount of ground sugar over one half of the omelette and use a spatula to carefully fold the other half over to enclose the filling.
7. Let the omelette cook for an additional 30 seconds to 1 minute until the egg is fully cooked and the sugar has melted and caramelized slightly.
8. Transfer the omelette to a plate and sprinkle a little more ground sugar on top before serving. Enjoy!
df0efd503f:
1. In a mixing bowl, crack a whole egg and whisk it thoroughly using a fork or a whisk.
2. Add the minced chive, flakes almond, and creamy cheese to the bowl, and mix well.
3. Sprinkle some ground pepper, baked paprika and ground garlic into the mixture, and give it another quick mix.
4. Heat a non-stick frying pan on medium heat, add creamy butter and liquid oil, and let it melt.
5. Once the butter-oil mixture is hot, pour in the egg mixture, and let it cook for 1-2 minutes, or until the bottom starts to set.
6. Using a spatula, gently fold the omelette in half.
7. Let it cook for another minute, or until the egg is fully cooked and the cheese has melted.
8. Pour some creamy cream on top of the omelette, and let it cook for an additional 30 seconds.
9. Using the spatula, carefully transfer the omelette onto a plate.
10. Garnish with some baked paprika and minced chive, and your delicious almond and cheese omelette is now ready to serve!
dc09394920:
1. First, place a non-stick frying pan or skillet on medium heat and spray it with cooking spray.
2. Crack two eggs into a mixing bowl and use a fork or whisk to whip them until they are fully combined and the mixture becomes frothy.
3. Next, add a handful of chopped spinach to the egg mixture and stir it in.
4. Take the whipped egg and spinach mixture and pour it into the frying pan.
5. Allow the egg mixture to cook on one side for approximately 3-4 minutes until it begins to solidify and the edges become golden brown.
6. While the omelette cooks, crumble a small amount of creamy feta cheese and sprinkle it over the top of the egg mixture.
7. Grind some fresh black pepper over the top of the feta cheese.
8. Once the edges of the omelette have browned and the top is nearly set, use a spatula to gently fold one side over the other, creating a half-moon shape.
9. Cook the omelette for an additional minute or so, ensuring that the inside is fully cooked.
10. Use the spatula to slide the omelette onto a plate, and serve immediately. Enjoy your tasty and healthy spinach and feta omelette!
85258885f7:
1. Crack two whole eggs into a small mixing bowl and beat them with a fork until they are well combined.
2. Add a small amount of diced ham, onion, and pepper to the bowl and mix it in with the eggs.
3. Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and add a small amount of liquid butter.
4. Once the butter has melted, pour the egg mixture into the skillet and use a spatula to spread out the mixture evenly.
5. Let the omelette cook for 1-2 minutes until the edges start to set and the bottom is lightly browned.
6. Use the spatula to gently fold one side of the omelette over onto the other side, creating a half-moon shape.
7. Continue cooking the omelette for 1-2 minutes until the center is mostly set.
8. Use the spatula to carefully slide the omelette onto a plate and serve hot. Garnish with additional diced ham, onion, and pepper if desired.
2fd562be94:
1. Crack 2 or 3 whole eggs into a bowl and beat with a fork or whisk until well combined and smooth.
2. Add 2-3 tablespoons of liquid milk to the eggs and whisk again until fully incorporated.
3. Heat a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat and add a tablespoon of butter or oil.
4. When the butter/oil is hot, add the chopped onion and pepper and sauté until softened.
5. Add the diced bacon to the skillet and cook until browned and crispy.
6. Pour the egg mixture into the skillet, making sure to evenly distribute the vegetables and bacon.
7. Allow the omelette to cook for 2-3 minutes, or until the edges start to set.
8. Using a spatula, lift and fold one third of the omelette over the middle third.
9. Repeat with the other side, so that the omelette is now folded in thirds.
10. Sprinkle shredded cheddar over the top of the omelette and allow it to melt.
11. Sprinkle ground pepper over the top of the omelette and serve hot.
12173e641f:
1. Begin by rinsing the whole broccoli head under cold running water. Trim off the stock and chop the florets into small bite-sized pieces. Set aside for later use.
2. In a mixing bowl, crack one whole egg and whisk it until fully blended. Add a tablespoon of thick liquid stock to the bowl and whisk it again to combine the ingredients properly.
3. Heat a non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat. Once the pan is hot, pour in some liquid water (about a tablespoon) to create some steam. Quickly add the chopped broccoli florets to the pan and stir fry for a minute or two until slightly softened.
4. Pour in the egg mixture onto the broccoli in the pan. Allow the egg mixture to set slightly on the bottom of the pan. As the eggs cook, use a spatula to lift the edges and let the uncooked eggs flow underneath the set layer.
5. Once the bottom layer is cooked (but the top surface is still slightly liquid), fold the omelette in half by sliding the spatula under one edge and flipping it over.
6. Add a tablespoon of liquid sake to the pan and swirl it around to deglaze. Pour in a tablespoon of oyster sauce over the omelette and spread it evenly. If you like, you can sprinkle some ground salt over the omelette at this point.
7. In a small mixing bowl, combine some ground potato starch with two tablespoons of cold water. Stir to form a slurry.
8. Pour the potato starch slurry into the frying pan, around the omelette. It should begin to thicken and form a sauce around the omelette.
9. Once the sauce has thickened to your liking, carefully slide the omelette onto a plate. Serve with your favorite sides, such as a bowl of rice or a salad. Enjoy your healthy and delicious vegetable omelette!
38c81e24df:
1. Crack 2-3 eggs into a bowl and add a splash of liquid milk. Whisk vigorously until well combined.
2. Heat a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat and add a drizzle of liquid butter. Swirl the pan to ensure the butter coats the bottom evenly.
3. Pour the egg mixture into the skillet and let it cook undisturbed for about 1-2 minutes until the bottom starts to set.
4. Use a spatula to gently lift the edges of the omelette and let the uncooked egg flow to the bottom to cook.
5. Once the top is almost set but still slightly runny, sprinkle some ground pepper and grated cheese on top.
6. Use the spatula to fold the omelette in half and let it cook for another 30 seconds to 1 minute until the cheese is melted and the eggs are fully cooked.
7. Slide the omelette onto a plate and serve immediately. Enjoy!
75c6c92ea0:
1. Crack a whole egg into a small mixing bowl and whisk until the yolk and egg white are well combined.
2. Heat a frying pan over medium heat and soften a teaspoon of butter in the pan.
3. Add in a tablespoon of chopped leek to the softened butter and sauté until the leek is soft and slightly browned.
4. Pour in a tablespoon of liquid water to the pan and allow it to simmer for 30 seconds.
5. Add the whisked egg to the pan and allow it to cook for 2-3 minutes until the bottom is set but the top is still slightly runny.
6. Use a spatula to fold the omelette in half and sprinkle with a pinch of seeded pepper and ground pepper.
7. Slide the omelette onto a plate and serve hot.
5aa38a5689:
1. Start by heating a non-stick pan on medium heat.
2. Spray the pan with liquid cooking spray until the surface is coated evenly.
3. Add one teaspoon of crushed garlic to the pan and cook until fragrant, stirring occasionally.
4. Add sliced mushrooms to the pan and cook for two minutes or until they are softened.
5. Add a handful of spinach leaves to the pan and cook for one minute or until wilted.
6. Season the mixture with ground pepper to taste.
7. Pour in two whipped eggs and stir the ingredients together gently with a spatula.
8. Cook the omelette, stirring occasionally, until the eggs are set on the bottom but still slightly runny on top, about 2-3 minutes.
9. Add a dollop of creamy cream on top of the omelette.
10. Use a spatula to carefully fold the omelette in half and cook for another minute until the cream has melted.
11. Serve hot and enjoy!
11bc84eebb:
1. Start by heating a tablespoon of liquid oil in a non-stick pan on medium heat. 
2. Once the oil is heated, add in 1-2 tablespoons of chopped onion and sauté it for a minute or two until it turns translucent. 
3. While the onion is cooking, whisk 2-3 eggs in a bowl until they become frothy and light. 
4. Next, add in a handful of baked spinach to the eggs and mix well. 
5. Once the onion is ready, pour the egg and spinach mixture into the pan, and stir occasionally until the omelette starts to form. 
6. Before the omelette is fully cooked, sprinkle some ground pepper and grated cheese over the top. 
7. Using a spatula, fold the omelette in half and let it cook for an additional 1-2 minutes until the cheese has melted and the eggs are fully cooked. 
8. Transfer the omelette to a plate and serve hot as desired.
43dbb44168:
1. Crack one whole egg into a bowl and beat it lightly with a fork.
2. Rinse a handful of whole leafy spinach and mixed mint, and chop them into small pieces.
3. Heat a non-stick skillet on medium heat and add a tablespoon of liquid oil.
4. Add the chopped spinach and mint to the skillet and sauté for a minute or until the greens are wilted.
5. Pour the beaten egg over the spinach and mint mixture.
6. Allow the egg to cook on low heat for a minute or until it starts to set.
7. Add a pinch of ground salt to taste.
8. Use a spatula to flip the omelette over and cook for another minute or until it’s fully cooked through.
9. Slide the omelette onto a plate and serve hot.
6b06bad5f4:
1. Peel 1 medium-sized potato and slice it thinly. 
2. Cut 1 zucchini into small pieces. 
3. Dice 1 whole tomato. 
4. In a small bowl, mix together 1/4 cup of ground flour, 1/4 cup of liquid soymilk, and 1 tablespoon of liquid vinegar until smooth. 
5. Heat 1 tablespoon of liquid oil in a nonstick frying pan over medium-high heat. 
6. Add 1/4 cup of chopped onion and sauté until translucent. 
7. Add the sliced potato and stir for 2-3 minutes until they start to become tender. 
8. Add the zucchini pieces and diced tomato to the pan and cook for an additional 2 minutes. 
9. Reduce the heat to medium and pour the flour mixture over the vegetables. 
10. Allow the mixture to cook for about 2 minutes until it starts to set. 
11. Flip the omelette over and cook for another 2-3 minutes until the other side is golden brown. 
12. Sprinkle with ground pepper as desired. 
13. Serve hot and enjoy.
4106ed73e0:
1. Crack two whole eggs into a mixing bowl and whisk until evenly mixed with no visible egg whites or yolks.
2. Heat a non-stick frying pan over medium heat and add a teaspoon of liquid margarine, letting it melt and coat the pan evenly.
3. Once the margarine has melted, add a quarter cup of chopped onion and a quarter cup of diced pepper to the pan, stirring occasionally until they have softened and slightly browned, taking approximately 3-4 minutes.
4. Pour the whisked eggs into the pan, tilting the pan to cover the entire surface evenly.
5. Once the edges of the omelette start to set, use a spatula to lift up the edges and let the uncooked eggs flow to the bottom of the pan and cook.
6. Once the surface of the omelette is almost set with a slightly runny centre, sprinkle a quarter cup of shredded cheddar cheese over the top.
7. Use the spatula to fold the omelette in half, covering the cheese inside.
8. Let the omelette cook for another 20-30 seconds until the cheese has melted, and the centre has cooked through.
9. Use the spatula to transfer the omelette onto a plate and serve hot. Enjoy!
3f209a1051:
1. Crack two whole eggs into a bowl and add two tablespoons of liquid milk.
2. Whisk the eggs and milk together until the mixture is smooth and well combined.
3. Add a pinch of ground salt and ground pepper to the egg mixture and whisk again.
4. Heat a non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat and add a knob of butter.
5. Once the butter is melted and hot, add the egg mixture to the pan and gently swirl the pan so that the eggs spread out evenly.
6. Allow the eggs to cook for 2-3 minutes, or until the edges start to set.
7. Use a spatula to gently lift the edges of the omelette and allow any uncooked egg mixture to run underneath and cook.
8. Once the omelette is almost set but still slightly runny on the top, sprinkle one tablespoon of chopped cheese over one half of the omelette.
9. Add two tablespoons of baked vegetables on top of the cheese.
10. Use a spatula to gently fold the other half of the omelette over the filled half, forming a half-moon shape.
11. Allow the omelette to cook for another minute or so, or until the cheese has melted and the vegetables are heated through.
12. Slide the omelette onto a plate and drizzle some Worcestershire sauce over the top. Serve hot.
1db1f38df0:
1. Crack two whole eggs into a mixing bowl and beat them until the yolks and whites are well combined.
2. Heat a non-stick frying pan over medium heat and add about a tablespoon of liquid oil. 
3. Once the oil is hot, pour the egg mixture into the frying pan and let it cook for 1-2 minutes.
4. Using a spatula, lift the edges of the omelette to allow the uncooked egg to flow underneath.
5. Add a handful of flakes of salmon to one half of the omelette.
6. Using the spatula, gently fold the other half of the omelette over the salmon side.
7. Cook for another 1-2 minutes until the egg is fully cooked and the salmon is warm.
8. Slide the omelette onto a plate and serve immediately. Enjoy!
4f5eea6abd:
1. In a mixing bowl, whisk together the thick liquid egg substitute and liquid milk until well combined.
2. Add a generous amount of shredded cheese to the egg mixture and mix well to combine.
3. Heat a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat and spray with cooking spray.
4. Add the sliced pepper, sliced mushroom, sliced tomato, and sliced onion to the skillet and cook for 3-5 minutes or until tender. Stir frequently.
5. Add the chopped spinach to the skillet and stir until wilted, for about 1 minute.
6. Pour the egg mixture into the skillet over the cooked vegetables and reduce the heat to medium-low.
7. Sprinkle some creamy parmesan, ground garlic, and ground pepper over the egg mixture.
8. Cover the skillet with a lid and cook for 5-7 minutes or until the omelette is set and cooked through.
9. Use a spatula to gently fold the omelette in half.
10. Carefully slide the omelette onto a plate and serve hot. Enjoy your delicious and healthy omelette with your favorite morning coffee or juice.
942bd0197f:
1. Crack 2-3 whole eggs into a bowl and beat them with a fork or whisk until the yolks and whites are fully mixed together.
2. Add a pinch of ground pepper to the eggs and mix it in.
3. Heat a non-stick pan on medium-high heat and add a tsp of liquid oil to the pan. 
4. Add the sliced ham to the pan and cook until browned, then remove from the pan and set aside.
5. Pour the beaten eggs into the same pan and let it cook for a minute or two until the bottom starts to set.
6. Add the creamy cheese and preserved preserve onto half of the egg mixture, leaving the other half without any toppings.
7. Using a spatula, gently fold the empty half of the egg mixture over the half with the toppings to create a half-moon shape.
8. Cook the omelette for another minute until the cheese is melted and the eggs are fully cooked.
9. Using the spatula, carefully slide the omelette out of the pan and onto a serving plate.
10. Garnish with additional ground pepper or any desired toppings, and enjoy your delicious omelette.
6ec9e128b4:
1. Crack two whole eggs into a bowl and beat them until fully mixed.
2. Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat and add a small amount of oil or butter.
3. Pour the beaten eggs into the pan and use a spatula to spread them evenly.
4. Add a pinch of ground salt to the eggs.
5. Once the eggs begin to set, sprinkle chopped chives over the top.
6. Use a spatula to carefully fold the omelette in half.
7. Add a dollop of pesto sauce on top of the omelette.
8. Add a few small cubes of creamy cheese on top of the pesto sauce.
9. Add a handful of mixed greens to the side of the omelette on the plate.
10. Serve hot and enjoy!
112642b611:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Take a small bowl and whisk 2 whole eggs, a pinch of ground salt, and a pinch of ground pepper together until well combined.
3. Cut 1/2 cup of baked spare rib into small pieces and set it aside.
4. Peel and finely chop 1/4 cup of whole carrot and 1 tablespoon of peeled ginger. Set them aside.
5. Take 1-2 dried oysters and soak them in warm water for 10 minutes.
6. After soaking, drain the oysters and coarsely chop them. Set them aside.
7. Take a non-stick skillet and heat 1 tablespoon of liquid oil over medium heat.
8. Add the chopped spare rib, chopped carrot, chopped ginger, and chopped oyster to the pan, and sauté them for 2-3 minutes, or until the vegetables become tender.
9. Add two whole chopped dates to the pan and gently mix everything together.
10. Pour in the whisked egg mixture over the vegetables and evenly distribute everything in the pan.
11. Cook the omelette for 3-4 minutes until the bottom is set and the top is lightly set.
12. Once the omelette is set, slide a spatula under the edge and fold the omelette in half.
13. Cook for an additional minute until the eggs are fully cooked.
14. Take out the omelette onto a plate and enjoy your baked spare rib omelette!
3fff0e423c:
1. Beat 2-3 whole eggs in a bowl until well combined.
2. Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
3. Add the beaten eggs to the skillet and let them cook for a minute.
4. Sprinkle 1 tablespoon of ground cocoa and 1 tablespoon of ground chocolate over the eggs.
5. Add a handful of sliced strawberries on one side of the omelette.
6. Use a spatula to fold the other side of the omelette over the strawberries.
7. Let the omelette cook for another minute or until the eggs are fully cooked.
8. Gently slide the omelette onto a plate and serve immediately. Optional: sprinkle some more ground cocoa and chocolate on top for extra flavor.
384e93b466:
1. Crack 2-3 whole eggs into a mixing bowl and whisk them together with a fork.
2. Add 1/4 cup of liquid milk to the eggs and continue to whisk until well combined.
3. Slowly sprinkle in 1 tablespoon of ground flour while whisking to prevent any lumps from forming.
4. Season the egg mixture with a pinch of ground salt and whisk until combined.
5. Heat 1-2 tablespoons of liquid oil in a nonstick skillet over medium heat.
6. Add 1/4 cup of chopped onion to the skillet and sauté until softened, about 2-3 minutes.
7. Pour in 2 tablespoons of dried wine and stir until it evaporates, about 1 minute.
8. Add 1/4 cup of liquid tomato and stir until heated through, about 1-2 minutes.
9. Add 1/4 cup of ground beef to the skillet and cook until browned, about 5-7 minutes.
10. Stir in 1/4 cup of chopped tomato and season with 1/4 teaspoon of dried oregano, 1/4 teaspoon of ground cinnamon, 1/4 teaspoon of ground cumin, and a pinch of ground salt and pepper.
11. Pour the egg mixture on top of the beef mixture and reduce the heat to low.
12. Use a spatula to gently lift the edges of the omelette and allow the uncooked egg to flow underneath until the top is set but still slightly wet.
13. Carefully fold the omelette in half with the spatula and cook for an additional minute to ensure the eggs are fully cooked.
14. Serve hot and enjoy!
037072f10a:
1. Crack 2 eggs into a small mixing bowl and beat them with a fork until the yolks and whites are well combined.
2. Chop the cabbage leaves into small pieces and set aside.
3. Cut the processed meat sausage into small chunks and set aside.
4. Heat a non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat.
5. Add a teaspoon of oil or butter to the pan.
6. Once the oil/butter is heated, add the chopped cabbage and sausage to the pan.
7. Cook the cabbage and sausage for about 2-3 minutes, or until the cabbage is wilted and the sausage is browned.
8. Spread the mixture evenly across the pan, leaving enough space for the eggs.
9. Pour the beaten eggs into the pan, making sure they cover the cabbage and sausage mixture.
10. Let the eggs cook for about a minute, or until the edges begin to set.
11. Carefully lift the edges of the egg with a spatula and allow the runny mixture to flow underneath.
12. Cook the omelette for another 1-2 minutes or until the eggs are fully set.
13. Drizzle the okonomiyaki sauce over the omelette.
14. Sprinkle the ginger flakes over the top of the omelette.
15. Gently fold the omelette in half with the spatula.
16. Serve immediately and enjoy your delicious omelette with cabbage, sausage, okonomiyaki sauce, and ginger flakes.
8ac64795ab:
1. Crack 2 whole eggs into a mixing bowl and beat them with a fork until they are well combined. 
2. Add 2 tablespoons of liquid milk to the egg mixture and whisk again until fully incorporated. 
3. Rinse and trim a handful of asparagus, cutting them into bite-sized pieces. Set aside. 
4. In a small bowl, mix 1 tablespoon of creamy ranch dressing with 1 tablespoon of liquid milk until smooth. Set aside. 
5. Heat a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat on the stovetop. 
6. Melt 1 tablespoon of softened butter in the skillet until it coats the surface evenly. 
7. Sprinkle a pinch of ground flour in the skillet and swirl it around to coat the butter. 
8. Pour the egg mixture into the skillet and let it cook for about 30 seconds until it starts to set on the bottom. 
9. Using a spatula, gently lift and fold the eggs over themselves to create a fold in the omelette. 
10. Sprinkle a pinch of ground salt and pepper over the omelette. 
11. Arrange the asparagus pieces on one side of the omelette, then fold the other side over to enclose them. 
12. Drizzle the creamy ranch dressing mixture over the top of the omelette to finish. 
13. Let the omelette cook for another minute or two until the eggs are cooked through and the inside is no longer runny. 
14. Slide the finished omelette onto a plate and serve hot with a sprinkle of freshly ground black pepper and a pat of creamy butter on top.
382c38223c:
1. Start by heating up some liquid oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat. 
2. While the oil is heating up, peel and thinly slice one whole potato. 
3. Once the oil is hot, add the sliced potatoes and sprinkle some ground salt and chili. Cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the potatoes are tender and slightly browned. 
4. Remove the cooked potatoes from the skillet and set them aside. 
5. In a bowl, whisk together one whole egg and some liquid milk until well combined. 
6. Pour the egg mixture into the same skillet that you used to cook the potatoes. 
7. Let the egg cook for 1-2 minutes, then use a spatula to gently lift the edges of the omelette and let the uncooked egg flow underneath. 
8. When the omelette is almost set, place the cooked potatoes on one half of the omelette. 
9. Sprinkle some shredded cheese on top of the potatoes. 
10. Use the spatula to fold the other half of the omelette over the potatoes and cheese. 
11. Continue cooking until the cheese has melted and the egg is fully set. 
12. Sprinkle some breadcrumbs on top of the omelette and serve hot. Enjoy!
20a82ffaa5:
1. Crack 2 eggs into a bowl and beat them with a whisk or fork.
2. Add 2 tablespoons of creamy cream, 1/4 teaspoon of ground pepper and 1/4 teaspoon of baked paprika to the bowl.
3. Whisk the mixture until it is well combined.
4. Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a non-stick frying pan over medium heat.
5. Add 1 sliced baked vegetarian sausage to the pan and cook for 2 minutes or until lightly browned.
6. Pour the egg mixture over the sausage in the pan.
7. Use a spatula to gently push the edges of the omelette towards the center, allowing the uncooked egg to flow underneath.
8. Cook the omelette for 2-3 minutes or until the egg is set.
9. Use a spatula to carefully fold the omelette in half.
10. Slide the omelette onto a plate and serve immediately. Enjoy!
e20a52d107:
1. In a bowl, whisk 2 to 3 eggs until fluffy and well beaten.
2. Add a pinch of salt and pepper to the eggs and whisk again.
3. Heat 1 tablespoon of liquid oil in a nonstick pan on medium heat.
4. Once hot, pour in the beaten eggs into the pan.
5. Using a spatula, gently push the edges of the egg towards the center, allowing any raw liquid to flow to the edges of the pan.
6. Once the omelette is mostly set, add 1 tablespoon of chopped chive to one half of the omelette.
7. Using the spatula, carefully fold the other half of the omelette over the chive-filled half.
8. Cook for an additional 30 seconds to 1 minute, until the omelette is completely set and cooked through.
9. Slide the omelette onto a plate and serve hot. Enjoy!
5be1813b70:
1. Crack and beat one whole egg in a bowl.
2. Add a pinch of ground salt to the beaten egg and whisk it until the salt is fully incorporated.
3. Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat.
4. Add a small amount of oil or butter to the pan and let it melt.
5. Pour the beaten egg mixture into the heated pan and allow it to cook for about 30 seconds.
6. Slice a few strawberries and place them on one side of the omelette.
7. Add a few drops of liquid extract of your choice (such as vanilla or almond) on top of the strawberries.
8. Use a spatula to gently fold the other side of the omelette over the strawberries to form a half-moon shape.
9. Cook the omelette for another minute or two until it's cooked through and lightly browned on both sides.
10. Serve the omelette hot and enjoy!
424b371b0e:
1. Crack two whole eggs into a mixing bowl, and add 1/4 cup of liquid milk. Beat the mixture together until well combined.
2. Add a pinch of ground salt, a pinch of ground pepper, and 1/4 teaspoon of dried mustard to the bowl. Mix the ingredients in thoroughly.
3. Heat a non-stick skillet or omelette pan over medium-high heat. Add one tablespoon of creamy butter to the pan and allow it to melt.
4. Add the beaten egg mixture to the pan, and use a spatula to gently stir the eggs as they begin to cook.
5. Once the eggs start to set, sprinkle 1/4 cup of grated cheddar cheese over one side of the eggs.
6. Fold the other side of the eggs over the cheese, using the spatula to carefully flip the omelette in half.
7. Sprinkle 1/4 cup of creamy cheese over the top of the omelette, and allow it to melt slightly.
8. Use the spatula to carefully slide the omelette onto a plate.
9. Sprinkle chopped chives over the top of the omelette, and serve. Enjoy your delicious omelette made with whole roll, grated cheddar, creamy cheese, creamy butter, whole egg, liquid milk, chopped chive, dried mustard, ground salt, and ground pepper!
968a716a11:
1. Preheat a non-stick pan on medium heat.
2. Slice the baked potato into thin round pieces and set aside.
3. In a bowl, beat the thick liquid eggs with salt and pepper to taste.
4. Melt a teaspoon of butter in the pan and add the ground onion. Saute the onion until it becomes translucent.
5. Add the diced ham to the pan and cook until it starts to brown.
6. Pour the egg mixture into the pan and let it cook until it starts to set around the edges.
7. Once the edges of the mixture start to set, arrange the potato slices on top of the omelette, followed by the sliced cheddar.
8. Fold the omelette by using a spatula to lift one edge and fold it over the center of the omelette. Repeat with the other side.
9. Let the omelette cook for another 1-2 minutes until the cheese has melted and the omelette is fully cooked.
10. Serve hot and enjoy!
27d2e62b86:
1. Crack two whole eggs into a mixing bowl and whisk them together until the yolks and whites are fully combined.
2. Add a splash of liquid milk to the mixing bowl and continue stirring until the egg mixture is fully combined and slightly frothy.
3. Heat a non-stick frying pan on medium heat and add a few slices of bacon to the pan. Cook the bacon until it's crispy and browned on both sides, then remove it from the pan and set it aside.
4. Pour the egg mixture into the hot frying pan and use a spatula to spread it evenly across the pan. 
5. As the egg starts to set, use the spatula to lift the edges of the omelette and allow the runny egg mixture to flow underneath to cook. Continue this process until the egg is mostly cooked through, but still slightly runny on top.
6. Add slices of baked cheese to one half of the omelette, and crumble the bacon over the top of the cheese.
7. Use the spatula to fold the other half of the omelette over the top of the cheese and bacon, creating a half-moon shape. 
8. Cook the omelette for an additional minute or so, or until the cheese is melted and the filling is heated through. 
9. Sprinkle ground pepper over the top of the omelette to taste, then remove it from the pan and serve immediately. Enjoy your delicious bacon and cheese omelette!
030357a237:
1. Begin by cracking 2-3 eggs into a bowl and whisking them together using a fork or a whisk.
2. Add 1/4 cup of liquid milk to the eggs and whisk it together until they blend well.
3. In a separate bowl, dice 1/4 cup of onion into small pieces.
4. Take 1-2 slices of processed meat sausage and chop it into small pieces as well.
5. Preheat a pan on medium heat and add 1 tablespoon of liquid butter and 1 tablespoon of liquid oil.
6. Add the diced onions and the chopped sausage to the pan and saute them until the onions turn translucent and the sausage is slightly browned.
7. Pour the egg mixture over the sausage and onion mixture in the pan.
8. Use a spatula to spread the egg mixture evenly on the pan and allow it to cook on medium heat for 2-3 minutes or until the bottom of the omelette sets.
9. Once the bottom of the omelette sets, sprinkle 1/4 cup of shredded cheddar cheese over it.
10. Use the spatula to fold one side of the omelette over the other, covering the cheese.
11. Let the omelette cook for another 2-3 minutes or until the cheese is melted and the omelette is cooked through.
12. Sprinkle ground pepper over it to add flavor.
13. Serve hot and enjoy your delicious homemade omelette with whole egg, liquid milk, diced onion, processed meat sausage, shredded cheddar, liquid butter, liquid oil, and ground pepper.
47e9bfa254:
1. Crumble the creamy cheddar cheese into small pieces and set aside.
2. Finely chop the minced rosemary leaves and set aside.
3. Crack the whole egg into a bowl and whisk it until it's fully mixed.
4. Add a pinch of ground pepper to the egg mixture and stir it well.
5. Cut the whole veg pepper in half and remove the seeds and stalks.
6. Heat up the liquid oil in a non-stick frying pan over medium heat.
7. Once the oil is hot, pour in the egg mixture into the frying pan.
8. Spread the minced rosemary over the omelette.
9. Sprinkle the crumbled creamy cheddar on top of the omelette.
10. Place the two halves of the whole veg pepper on one side of the omelette.
11. Fold the other side of the omelette over the peppers to make a semi-circle shape.
12. Once the underside of the omelette is cooked and golden brown, flip it over and cook the other side.
13. Once cooked to your preference, use a spatula to remove the omelette from the frying pan and place it onto a plate.
14. Serve with a side of whole waffle and a drizzle of creamy French dressing over the omelette.
3652537fe8:
1. Start by preheating your oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. Take the baked pie crust and crumble it into small pieces, set aside.
3. In a small bowl, crack one whole egg and mix in 1 tablespoon of liquid water. Set aside.
4. In a non-stick skillet, melt 1 tablespoon of creamy butter over medium heat.
5. Add ½ cup of sliced potatoes, ½ cup of sliced onions, and a pinch of ground salt and pepper to the skillet, and cook until potatoes and onions are tender and lightly browned.
6. Push the cooked potatoes and onions to one side of the skillet and add ½ cup of sliced ham to the empty side of the skillet. Cook for 1 minute or until lightly browned. Then, mix the ham with the potatoes and onions.
7. Pour in the prepared egg mixture to the skillet and cook until the egg is slightly set, but still wet on top.
8. Sprinkle ½ cup of shredded cheese over the top of the egg mixture.
9. Place the skillet into the preheated oven and bake for 5-7 minutes or until the cheese is melted and the egg is fully cooked.
10. To prepare the herb butter, mix 1 tablespoon of softened butter with 1 tablespoon of chopped parsley, and a pinch of ground salt and pepper.
11. Take the omelette out of the oven, remove from the skillet, and serve on a plate.
12. Garnish the omelette with the crumbled pie crust and a dollop of the herb butter on top. Serve hot and enjoy!
ecc22a186e:
1. In a mixing bowl, whisk together 2 whole eggs and 1/4 cup of thick liquid egg.
2. Add in 1/4 cup of liquid water to the mixture and whisk until well combined.
3. Add in 1/4 cup of chopped onion, 1/4 cup of sliced bacon, and a pinch of ground salt and ground pepper.
4. Heat a non-stick pan over medium-high heat and add in 1 tbsp of liquid oil.
5. Once the oil is hot, add in the egg mixture.
6. Let the mixture cook for 1-2 minutes until the bottom is lightly set.
7. Sprinkle in 1/4 cup of dried tomato, 1/4 cup of chopped tomato, and 2 tbsp of crumbs cheese.
8. Use a spatula to fold the omelette in half and let cook for an additional 1-2 minutes until fully cooked through.
9. Serve hot and enjoy your delicious omelette with dried tomato, chopped tomato, sliced bacon, and cheese!
5d0d0b9c8c:
1. Begin by heating a medium-sized non-stick frying pan on medium heat on the stovetop.
2. Take a slice of bread and spread a generous amount of creamy butter on one side, set aside.
3. Slice 3-4 mushrooms and chop 1/4 of an onion, set both aside.
4. Crack one whole egg into a small bowl and whisk until well beaten.
5. Add a tablespoon of liquid water to the egg mixture and mix again.
6. Once the frying pan is heated, add a tablespoon of liquid butter, and let it melt.
7. Add the sliced mushrooms and chopped onion to the pan and cook until they are soft and slightly browned, for about 2-3 minutes.
8. Spread the softened vegetables out evenly in the pan, then carefully pour the egg mixture over the top.
9. Use a spatula to gently push the edges of the egg towards the center of the pan, allowing the uncooked egg to fill the gaps.
10. Once the egg looks mostly cooked and set, carefully flip the omelette in half in the pan using your spatula.
11. Let the omelette cook on the other side for another minute or two until the egg is completely cooked through.
12. While the omelette finishes cooking, toast the buttered bread slice in a toaster or on a separate pan.
13. Once everything is ready, place the omelette onto a plate and serve alongside the toasted bread slice. Enjoy!
e8f93a3d9b:
1. Crack 2 whole eggs into a bowl and whisk them until they are well-beaten.
2. Add a sprinkle of ground salt and ground curry to the eggs and mix well.
3. Finely chop a handful of onion and set it aside.
4. Remove the leaves from a few sprigs of mint and cilantro and roughly chop them.
5. Cut a whole bell pepper into small pieces and set aside.
6. Heat a non-stick pan over medium-high heat and add about a tablespoon of liquid oil to the pan.
7. Once the oil is hot, add the chopped onion to the pan and sauté it for about 2 minutes until it is translucent.
8. Add the chopped pepper to the pan and sauté for 2-3 minutes until it starts to soften.
9. Reduce the heat to medium and pour the egg mixture into the pan.
10. Use a spatula to distribute the pepper and onion evenly throughout the pan and let the omelette cook for about 1-2 minutes.
11. Once the edges of the omelette start to set, use the spatula to gently lift one edge of the omelette and fold it over to the middle.
12. Repeat with the other side of the omelette, folding it over to the middle, to form a pocket.
13. Sprinkle the chopped mint and cilantro on top of the omelette and let it cook for another 30 seconds to 1 minute.
14. Once the omelette is fully cooked and the herbs are fragrant, remove it from the pan and serve hot.
4a142caa07:
1. Begin by cracking a whole egg into a bowl and whisking it thoroughly.
2. Heat a non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat and add a splash of liquid water.
3. Once the water is simmering, pour in the whisked egg and let it cook for a minute or two until the bottom is firm.
4. In the meantime, cook a steak to your liking in a separate pan.
5. Slice a whole tomato and some green leaves and set aside.
6. Once the bottom of the omelet is firm, flip it over carefully using a spatula.
7. Spread a spoonful of creamy cream over the cooked side of the omelet.
8. Add the cooked steak, sliced tomato, and green leaves on one side of the omelet.
9. Fold the other side of the omelet over the filling to form a half-moon shape.
10. Pour a splash of liquid milk over the top of the omelet before serving. Enjoy!
dea60408ce:
1. Crack the two whole eggs into a bowl and whisk them together until they are fully mixed.
2. Add the finely chopped shiso leaves into the mixture and stir them in.
3. In a separate bowl, mix together the ground mayonnaise and liquid mirin until smooth.
4. Combine the mayonnaise mixture into the egg mixture and stir them together.
5. Heat up a non-stick pan on medium heat and add the liquid oil.
6. Once the oil is hot, pour the egg mixture into the pan and let it cook for 2-3 minutes or until the bottom is golden brown.
7. Using a spatula, flip the omelette over and let it cook for another 1-2 minutes on the other side.
8. Once fully cooked, remove the omelette from the pan and serve hot. Enjoy!
40c4dfeb04:
1. Begin by cracking one whole egg into a mixing bowl and beat it with a fork until the yolk is well mixed with the egg white.
2. Add a dash of liquid water to the egg mixture and whisk it together until it is fully combined.
3. Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and pour a small amount of liquid oil onto the pan.
4. Once the oil is heated, pour the egg mixture into the pan and swirl it around to ensure it covers the entire surface area.
5. Allow the egg to cook for 1-2 minutes or until the edges start to firm up.
6. Use a spatula to gently lift the edges of the omelette and allow any uncooked egg to run underneath.
7. Add sliced mushrooms, steamed broccoli, and steamed sprouts onto one side of the omelette. Drizzle with hoisin sauce.
8. Use the spatula to carefully fold the other side of the omelette over the filling and press down gently to ensure it sticks together.
9. Allow the omelette to cook for another minute or until the filling is heated through.
10. Use a spatula to carefully slide the omelette onto a plate and serve immediately. Enjoy!
e13e290842:
1. Crack two eggs into a bowl and whisk until fully mixed. 
2. Add a splash of liquid milk to the bowl and whisk again until combined. 
3. Sprinkle some ground pepper to your preference into the egg mixture and mix well. 
4. Heat a non-stick frying pan over medium heat. 
5. Once hot, pour the egg mixture into the frying pan. 
6. As the egg starts to cook, use a spatula to gently lift the edges and allow the uncooked egg to flow underneath. 
7. When the egg is mostly set, add some sliced ham to one half of the omelette. 
8. Sprinkle some shredded mozzarella cheese over the ham. 
9. Use the spatula to gently fold the other half of the omelette over the filling. 
10. Allow the cheese to melt for a minute. 
11. Toast a slice of bread to your desired level of crispness. 
12. Slide the omelette onto a plate and serve with the toast. Enjoy!
4a727898ce:
1. Crack 2 whole eggs into a bowl and whisk with a fork until evenly mixed.
2. Add 1 teaspoon of ground sugar and 1 teaspoon of ground marmalade to the eggs and whisk until well combined.
3. Pour in 1 tablespoon of liquid liqueur and whisk until everything is fully mixed.
4. Mince 1/4 of an orange and set aside.
5. Heat a non-stick frying pan over medium heat and add 1 tablespoon of creamy butter.
6. Once the butter has melted and is bubbling, pour in the egg mixture.
7. Using a spatula, gently push the edges of the omelette towards the center, allowing uncooked egg to flow to the sides and cook.
8. Once the omelette is mostly cooked through and slightly runny on top, sprinkle 1 teaspoon of ground sugar over the top.
9. Add the minced orange to one half of the omelette and fold the other half over the filling with the spatula.
10. Let the omelette cook for 30 more seconds and then remove from heat.
11. Garnish the top of the omelette with a dollop of creamy creme fraiche and drizzle with 1 teaspoon of liquid liqueur.
12. Serve hot and enjoy!
9e977e6647:
1. Break a whole egg in a small mixing bowl and beat it thoroughly. 
2. Take a piece of baked matzo and crumble it into small pieces using your hands. 
3. Add the crumbled matzo to the beaten egg mixture and stir well. 
4. Next, add a handful of creamy cheese to the mixture, and give it a good stir. 
5. Melt a small amount of softened butter in a non-stick frying pan over medium heat. 
6. Once the butter has melted, pour the egg mixture into the pan. 
7. Use a spatula to spread the egg mixture evenly over the pan. 
8. Let the omelette cook for 2-3 minutes, or until the bottom has set. 
9. Carefully flip the omelette over using a spatula, and let it cook for another 1-2 minutes. 
10. Once the omelette is fully cooked, transfer it to a plate and serve hot. Enjoy your delicious omelette!
5bcccb4e9b:
1. Heat 1 tbsp of halved oil in a non-stick frying pan over medium heat.
2. Add the diced potato to the pan and stir occasionally until it is cooked through and slightly browned.
3. Add the chopped pepper to the pan and continue cooking for another 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally.
4. Crack two whole eggs into a bowl and beat them until the yolks and whites are fully combined.
5. Pour the beaten eggs into the frying pan with the potato and pepper.
6. Use a spatula to gently stir the eggs until they are cooked through and only slightly runny.
7. Sprinkle a dash of ground pepper over the top of the eggs.
8. Sprinkle 1 tbsp of shredded cheddar cheese over one half of the omelette.
9. Use the spatula to gently fold the other half of the omelette over the cheese side, creating a half-circle shape.
10. Cook for another 1-2 minutes or until the cheese has melted.
11. Use the spatula to slide the omelette onto a plate and serve hot. Enjoy!
57442b9877:
1. Crack two whole eggs into a bowl.
2. Pour 1/4 cup of liquid milk into the bowl with the eggs.
3. Add a pinch of ground sugar to the bowl and whisk the ingredients until they are thoroughly combined.
4. Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and add a drizzle of oil or a light coating of cooking spray.
5. Once the skillet is hot, pour the egg mixture into the pan and let it cook for 1-2 minutes until it starts to set.
6. Begin to fold the omelette by gently lifting the edges of the eggs with a spatula and folding them over the middle of the omelette.
7. Once the omelette is folded, add a few slices of cheese on top and continue to cook until the cheese is melted and the eggs are fully cooked.
8. Slide the omelette onto a plate and top with a thick sauce of ketchup. 
9. Serve immediately while the omelette is still hot. Enjoy your delicious and easy-to-make omelette!
e527398c2b:
1. Heat 1 tablespoon of liquid oil in a non-stick pan on medium heat.
2. Add 1/4 cup of sliced whole veg mushrooms to the pan and sauté for 2 minutes until lightly browned.
3. Add 1 tablespoon of chopped parsley to the pan and stir for 10 seconds.
4. Crack 2 whole eggs into the pan and stir them until they start to set, about 30 seconds.
5. Once the eggs are mostly set, add 1/4 cup of crumbled creamy feta cheese to the pan.
6. Gently fold the omelette in half using a spatula and let it cook for another 30 seconds until the cheese is melted.
7. Slide the omelette onto a plate and top it with 1/4 of a sliced avocado.
8. Garnish with extra chopped parsley if desired and serve immediately. Enjoy!
d43ff0263a:
1. Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat.
2. Add the processed meat sausage slices and diced potatoes into the pan. Cook them for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until they are browned and cooked through.
3. Crack the eggs into a bowl and add minced garlic, ground pepper, and ground salt. Beat them together with a fork until well mixed.
4. Once the sausage and potatoes are cooked, remove them from the pan and set them aside on a plate.
5. In the same pan, melt one tablespoon of creamy butter.
6. Pour the egg mixture into the pan and cook for 2-3 minutes or until the bottom is set.
7. Using a spatula, flip the omelette over and cook for another 1-2 minutes until the other side is cooked.
8. Transfer the omelette onto a plate.
9. Spread 1 tablespoon of thick sauce mustard on top of the omelette.
10. Add the cooked sausage and potatoes on top of the mustard.
11. Fold the omelette in half to cover the sausage and potatoes.
12. Serve and enjoy your delicious potato and sausage omelette!
137c355c2e:
1. In a bowl, mix together the sliced chicken, ground five-spice powder, ground coriander, and a pinch of ground pepper. Set aside.
2. Heat some liquid oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat.
3. Add a small handful of finely chopped onion and a pinch of ground garlic. Stir fry until fragrant.
4. Add the chicken mixture to the pan and stir fry until the chicken is fully cooked and browned.
5. Remove the chicken mixture from the pan and set aside.
6. In the same pan, sauté some sliced mushroom and bean sprouts until they are tender.
7. Add in the cooked chicken mixture and stir to combine.
8. In a separate bowl, beat together one whole egg with a splash of liquid water and a pinch of ground pepper.
9. Pour the egg mixture into the pan with the chicken and vegetable mixture.
10. Cook the omelette for about 2-3 minutes or until the egg is set and no longer runny.
11. To make the sauce, mix together some oyster sauce, soy sauce, and a splash of liquid water.
12. Drizzle the sauce over the omelet and garnish with some thinly sliced scallions.
13. Serve hot and enjoy!
dfcdbcf05a:
1. In a bowl, whisk 2 whole eggs with a pinch of salt and pepper until well mixed.
2. In a non-stick frying pan, heat up the liquid oil over medium heat.
3. Once heated, sauté the diced onion until it becomes translucent.
4. Add the chopped tomato into the pan with the onion and sauté for 2-3 minutes until they soften.
5. Next, add the sliced olives and chopped parsley and stir for about a minute.
6. Pour the whisked eggs over the sautéed vegetables in the pan.
7. Using a spatula, spread the mixture evenly in the pan.
8. Sprinkle the breadcrumbs over the top of the eggs.
9. Allow the eggs to cook for about 2 minutes until the edges start to turn golden brown.
10. Using the spatula, gently fold the omelette in half.
11. Cook the omelette for an additional 1-2 minutes until it is fully cooked.
12. Sprinkle some cheese over the top of the omelette and serve hot. Enjoy!
319f836855:
1. Begin by heating a small amount of liquid oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat.
2. Crack one whole egg into a bowl and whisk it together with a pinch of ground sugar and a small splash of sauce fish.
3. Once the pan is heated, pour the egg mixture into the pan and cook for 1-2 minutes or until the bottom of the omelette is cooked and set.
4. Flip the omelette over and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes on the other side.
5. Once the omelette is fully cooked, remove it from the pan and set it aside on a plate.
6. In the same pan, heat a small amount of liquid oil over medium heat and add in any small meat of your choice. Cook until the meat is browned and cooked through.
7. Add in a handful of bean sprouts and sauté for about 1-2 minutes, until they start to soften.
8. Pour in a small amount of thick liquid stock and a splash of sauce fish. Mix everything together and let the mixture cook for an additional 1-2 minutes.
9. Pour the meat and bean sprout mixture over the omelette, making sure to cover the entire surface.
10. Finally, sprinkle some halved chives over the top of the omelette and serve hot. Enjoy!
147013e475:
1. Begin by cracking 2 to 3 eggs into a bowl and whisking them until the yolks and whites are fully incorporated.
2. Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat and add a tablespoon of liquid butter.
3. Once the butter has melted, add the whisked eggs to the pan and let them cook for a couple of minutes.
4. Once the bottom of the omelette has set, use a spatula to flip it over and let it cook for a minute or two on the other side.
5. While the omelette is cooking, heat up a small saucepan of spaghetti sauce on low heat.
6. Once the omelette is fully cooked, spoon a couple of tablespoons of the warmed spaghetti sauce onto one half of the omelette.
7. Next, sprinkle some shredded creamy mozzarella and creamy parmesan over the spaghetti sauce.
8. Add a handful of fresh basil leaves on top of the cheese.
9. Use a spatula to carefully fold the other half of the omelette over the filling and let the cheese melt for a minute.
10. Finally, season the omelette with a sprinkle of ground salt and ground pepper to taste.
11. Serve hot and enjoy your delicious omelette with spaghetti sauce, mozzarella, basil, and parmesan filling.
cb13e218d3:
1. Preheat a non-stick frying pan on medium heat.
2. Wash the broccoli and cut it into small florets.
3. Add a tablespoon of liquid oil to the pan and swirl it around to make sure the entire surface is coated.
4. Add the broccoli to the pan and sprinkle some ground salt on top. Cook for about 3-4 minutes or until the broccoli is tender but still crispy.
5. In a separate bowl, crack open a whole egg and whisk it until the yolk and white are combined. 
6. Add a pinch of ground sugar to the bowl and mix.
7. Add a tablespoon of creamy butter to the pan and let it melt.
8. Pour the egg mixture into the pan and let it cook for a minute or until the edges start to set.
9. Using a spatula, gently lift the edges of the omelette and let the uncooked egg mixture slide underneath.
10. Once the omelette is almost set, add a splash of liquid water to the pan to help the eggs cook faster.
11. Add a tablespoon of tamari sauce to the pan and mix it with the broccoli.
12. Gently fold the omelette in half and let it cook for another minute or until the egg is fully cooked.
13. Slide the omelette onto a plate and serve hot. Enjoy!
df67e49868:
1. In a bowl, crack one or two whole eggs depending on how hungry you are. 
2. Add a pinch of minced parsley to the bowl. 
3. Whisk the egg and parsley together until the yolk and white are fully combined. 
4. In a small non-stick pan, heat up a tablespoon of liquid oil over medium-high heat. 
5. Once the oil is hot, add the egg mixture to the pan. 
6. Let the egg cook for about 20 seconds before using a spatula to scrape the edges of the pan inward toward the center. 
7. Continue to scrape and fold the egg mixture until it is nearly set but still slightly runny on top. 
8. In a small bowl, mix together 1-2 tablespoons of creamy yogurt and a small amount of crushed garlic until fully incorporated. 
9. Spread the yogurt mixture over one half of the omelette. 
10. Sprinkle a pinch of ground pepper over the yogurt. 
11. Gently fold the other half of the omelette over the yogurt-filled half using your spatula. 
12. Let the omelette cook for an additional 10-15 seconds until the yogurt is warmed through and the egg is fully set. 
13. Serve hot and enjoy!
57a4823c68:
1. Preheat your oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit (190 degrees Celsius).
2. Season the fillet with ground pepper and salt on both sides.
3. Place the seasoned fillet on a baking sheet and put it in the preheated oven.
4. Bake the fillet for 20-25 minutes or until it’s cooked through.
5. While the fillet is baking, crack 2-3 whole eggs in a bowl and whisk them together.
6. Add a splash of liquid milk to the eggs and whisk again.
7. Add a pinch of ground salt and pepper to the egg mixture and whisk it again.
8. Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat and add a halved tablespoon of butter.
9. When the butter has melted, pour the egg mixture into the pan.
10. Use a spatula to gently push the edges of the omelette towards the center, allowing the uncooked egg to flow to the bottom of the pan.
11. When the omelette is almost cooked through, sprinkle grated cheddar cheese over it.
12. Use the spatula to gently fold the omelette in half and slide it onto a plate.
13. Take the baked fillet out of the oven and place it on top of the omelette.
14. Drizzle some creamy cream over the fillet.
15. Serve the omelette with baked fillet and enjoy your delicious meal!
247163c6e6:
1. Start by cracking two large eggs into a bowl and add a pinch of salt and black pepper. 
2. Use a whisk or a fork to whip the eggs until they become frothy and well-blended. 
3. Next, heat a non-stick pan over medium heat, add a tablespoon of butter and let it melt completely. 
4. Pour the whipped eggs into the pan, and then let them cook for about 1-2 minutes until the edges start to set. 
5. Once the edges are set, use a spatula to gently lift the omelette so that the uncooked parts can flow underneath and cook. Repeat this process until the eggs are almost set but still a little runny on top. 
6. Next, add a tablespoon of pizza sauce onto one half of the omelette. 
7. Then add a few slices of pepperoni and mushroom over the pizza sauce. (Add as much as you'd like) 
8. Finally, sprinkle some shredded mozzarella cheese on top of the meat and mushroom mixture. 
9. To fold the omelette, use a spatula to carefully fold one half of the omelette over the pizza toppings. 
10. Cook the folded omelette for a further 1-2 minutes until the cheese is melted and the omelette is golden brown. 
11. Once cooked through, carefully slide the omelette onto a plate using your spatula. 
12. Serve hot and enjoy your delicious omelette with a crispy side salad.
23d071777f:
1. Crack the eggs into a small bowl and whisk until the whites and yolks are well mixed.
2. Add the whipped cream, ground baking powder, dried oregano, ground pepper, and ground salt to the bowl with the eggs. Whisk all the ingredients together until well combined.
3. In a small non-stick frying pan, heat the softened butter over medium heat until melted and hot.
4. Pour the egg mixture into the frying pan and tilt the pan to spread the mixture evenly.
5. Sprinkle the crumbs cheese and chopped olives evenly over the top of the egg mixture.
6. Cook the omelette for 2-3 minutes or until the edges start to set and the bottom is lightly browned.
7. Using a spatula, fold one side of the omelette towards the center and then fold the other side towards the center, creating a semi-circle shape.
8. Cook the omelette for an additional 1-2 minutes until the cheese is melted and the eggs are fully cooked in the center.
9. Slide the omelette onto a plate and serve hot. Enjoy!
282bb90fac:
1. In a small bowl, beat the egg with a fork until it becomes slightly frothy. Add in the liquid milk and a pinch of ground pepper. Mix until fully combined.
2. Heat up a non-stick skillet over medium heat on a stove.
3. Dice up the ham and chop the broccoli and onion into small bite-size pieces.
4. Place the bread slices onto the pan and toast them for a few minutes until they are crisp or slightly toasted. Then, remove them from the pan and set them on a plate.
5. Add the diced ham, chopped broccoli, and chopped onion onto the pan. Sauté them for a few minutes until they become slightly soft and tender.
6. Pour the egg mixture onto the pan, shaking the pan a bit to distribute the vegetables evenly. Allow the mixture to cook for about 1-2 minutes, or until the bottom is golden brown.
7. Using a spatula, gently lift the edges of the omelette and fold it in half. Allow the other side of the omelette to cook for another minute until it is golden brown.
8. Once the omelette is fully cooked, remove it from the pan and place it onto the plate with the toasted slices of bread.
9. Serve hot and enjoy!
1fc846d2a2:
1. Crack 2-3 whole eggs into a mixing bowl and beat with a fork until thoroughly mixed.
2. Grate some cheese (cheddar or any cheese of your choice) and add it to the beaten eggs, mixing well.
3. Add a pinch of ground pepper to the mixture and stir again.
4. Heat a non-stick frying pan over medium heat and add a teaspoon of softened butter. 
5. Once the butter is melted and coating the bottom of the pan, pour the egg mixture into the pan.
6. Use a spatula to gently stir around the edges of the omelette as it cooks.
7. Once the omelette is nearly cooked through and slightly runny on top, fold it in half using the spatula.
8. Cook for an additional 30 seconds to 1 minute until the cheese is melted and the omelette is fully cooked.
9. Serve and enjoy!
13aec9b2f6:
1. Begin by heating a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
2. Add in a small amount of liquid oil to the pan and let it heat up.
3. While the pan is heating up, finely chop half of an onion and add it into the pan.
4. Saute the onion until it becomes translucent and lightly browned.
5. Crack two whole eggs into a bowl and lightly whisk them together with a fork.
6. Pour the whisked eggs into the pan with the onions.
7. Allow the eggs to cook for a moment before sprinkling a pinch of freshly ground black pepper on top.
8. Once the edges of the omelette are set, use a spatula to gently lift the edges and allow any remaining liquid egg to flow underneath the cooked portion.
9. As the omelette cooks, sprinkle in a handful of your chosen fresh herb, such as parsley or chives.
10. Once the omelette has cooked through and the center is no longer liquid, use the spatula to carefully fold it in half.
11. Slide the omelette onto a plate and serve while still hot. Enjoy your delicious and nutritious whole veg onion omelette!
360dc4eaf5:
1. Peel the shrimp and oysters and set aside in a bowl.
2. Chop the cod and tofu into small pieces and set aside in a separate bowl.
3. Peel the squash and cut it into small cubes.
4. In a small bowl, mix the ground flour with a tablespoon of water to create a thin paste. This will be used to coat the ingredients before cooking.
5. In a separate bowl, whisk together two eggs until fully beaten.
6. Preheat a small pan on medium-high heat and add a tablespoon of liquid oil.
7. Once the oil is hot, add the minced garlic and sauté for roughly 30 seconds.
8. Add the chopped cod and tofu to the pan and cook until the edges are browned, about two to three minutes.
