1. Heat a pot over medium heat and add 1 tablespoon of oil.
2. Add 1 cup of ground chicken to the pot and cook until browned.
3. Once the chicken is ready, remove it from the pot and set aside.
4. Add 1 can of thick sauce tomato to the pot and stir.
5. Pour in 3 cups of liquid water and bring the mixture to a boil.
6. Once boiling, reduce the heat and let the soup simmer for 10 minutes.
7. Add 1 teaspoon of ground sugar to the soup and stir well.
8. Sprinkle 1 teaspoon of ground salt into the soup and mix until fully combined.
9. Add the cooked ground chicken back into the pot and stir.
10. Allow the soup to simmer for another 5 minutes to allow all the flavors to meld together.
11. Serve hot and enjoy your delicious home-made soup with thick sauce tomato, ground chicken, sugar, and salt.
0647148654:
1. Rinse the asparagus under running water and cut off the woody ends. Cut the asparagus into bite-sized pieces and set aside.
2. Heat the liquid oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and minced garlic to the pot and sauté them until they become soft and fragrant.
3. Pour the thick liquid broth into the pot and bring it to a simmer.
4. Add the dried pasta and cook it until it is al dente.
5. Add the asparagus, peas, and spinach to the pot and cook them for 5-10 minutes until they become tender.
6. Season the soup with ground pepper and ground basil to taste.
7. Serve the soup hot and top it with shredded parmesan cheese. Enjoy!
02806fb50c:
1. Begin by boiling 8 cups of water in a large soup pot. 
2. Once the water has reached a boil, add the dried soup mix and stir. 
3. Next, add 1 tablespoon of peppercorn to the pot and continue stirring. 
4. Then, add 2-3 bay leaves to the pot and stir again. 
5. Let the soup simmer for 20-25 minutes until the dried soup mix is fully cooked. 
6. While the soup is simmering, heat up the thick liquid broth and the pork sauce in separate pans on the stove. 
7. Once the soup is fully cooked, remove the bay leaves and pour in the thick liquid broth. 
8. Stir well to combine and let it simmer for an additional 5-7 minutes until the soup has thickened. 
9. Add the sauce pork into the soup and stir again. 
10. Lastly, pour in the thick catsup sauce and mix thoroughly. 
11. Remove from heat and let the soup cool for a few minutes before serving. Enjoy!
0261d21e3f:
1. Begin by heating a pot over medium heat and adding a tablespoon of liquid oil.
2. Once the oil is warm, add two minced shallots to the pot and sauté until they are softened and slightly caramelized.
3. Add in a cup of chopped artichoke and continue to sauté for another 2-3 minutes until they begin to soften.
4. Add in 3 tablespoons of ground flour and stir until it is completely combined with the shallots and artichoke.
5. Gradually add in 3 cups of thick liquid broth while continuously stirring the soup to prevent clumping.
6. Allow the soup to come to a gentle boil, then reduce the heat to a simmer and let it cook for approximately 20 minutes, or until the soup has thickened.
7. After 20 minutes, add 1/4 cup of ground wine to the soup and stir to combine.
8. Once the wine has been incorporated into the soup, add 1/2 cup of creamy cream and stir until it is fully combined.
9. Turn off the heat and add a handful of chopped parsley leaves to the soup.
10. Serve the soup hot and enjoy!
03e6762fab:
1. In a large pot, heat a tablespoon of oil over medium heat.
2. Add minced garlic and sauté until fragrant.
3. Add diced potato, chopped spinach, chopped carrot, and diced turnip. Stir well.
4. Add dried lentil, ground chili, ground cinnamon, dried basil, ground paprika, ground turmeric, ground pepper, and ground ginger to the pot. Stir well to combine everything.
5. Pour in 6 cups of liquid water and stir once more. Bring it to a boil. Once boiling, reduce heat to medium-low and let it simmer for 25-30 minutes, or until the vegetables and lentils are tender.
6. Add in the chopped basil and stir. Allow it to simmer for another 5-10 minutes.
7. Once done, taste to adjust seasoning as needed.
8. Serve hot in bowls, topped with fresh herbs, if desired.
9. Enjoy!
0016990a89:
1. In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat 2 tablespoons of liquid oil over medium heat. 
2. Add 1 chopped onion and 2 minced garlic cloves to the pot and stir until the onion is translucent, about 5 minutes. 
3. Add 1 cup of grain rice to the pot and stir for 1-2 minutes until the rice is coated in the onion and garlic mixture. 
4. Pour in 6 cups of water and bring the mixture to a boil. 
5. Once the soup is boiling, reduce the heat and let it simmer for 20-25 minutes or until the rice is cooked through. 
6. While the soup is simmering, wash 6 cups of whole leafy spinach and chop it into bite-size pieces. 
7. Add the chopped spinach to the soup and stir until the spinach is wilted and tender, about 5 minutes. 
8. Add 1 teaspoon of ground turmeric and 1/2 teaspoon of ground pepper to the soup, stirring to combine. 
9. Pour in 1 cup of creamy yogurt and stir until the yogurt is fully incorporated into the soup. 
10. Serve hot and enjoy your delicious spinach and rice soup!
00a65966b7:
1. In a large soup pot, heat up 2 tablespoons of softened margarine over medium heat until it has melted.
2. Once the margarine has melted, add in 1 cup of chopped celery, 2 cloves of minced garlic, and 1 chopped onion. Cook the vegetables in the margarine for around 5 minutes, or until they have softened.
3. Pour 4 cups of thick liquid stock into the pot with the softened vegetables. Bring the soup to a simmer and let it cook for around 20 minutes, or until the vegetables are very tender.
4. Once the vegetables have cooked thoroughly, add in 2 cups of thawed peas and a pinch of ground pepper. Let the soup cook for another 5-10 minutes, or until the peas are warmed through.
5. Remove the soup from heat and use an immersion blender or transfer the soup to a blender and blend until the soup is smooth.
6. Once the soup has been blended until smooth, stir in 1 cup of liquid milk and 1/4 teaspoon of grated nutmeg.
7. Before serving, sprinkle whole nuts over each bowl for added texture.
8. Serve the soup hot and enjoy!
05d763f1aa:
1. Heat a large pot over medium heat and add 2 tablespoons of liquid oil.
2. Add the chopped onion to the pot and sauté for 2-3 minutes until it becomes translucent.
3. Add the chopped carrot and whole veg garlic to the pot and continue to sauté for an additional 2-3 minutes.
4. Pour in 4 cups of thick liquid stock to the pot and bring it to a simmer.
5. Add 1 cup of liquid orange and 1/4 cup of liquid vinegar to the pot and continue to let it simmer.
6. Add 1 tsp of ground pepper to the pot and stir it in.
7. Add 1 cup of bean lentil and 1 tsp of ground coriander to the pot.
8. Stir everything together and let it simmer for an additional 15-20 minutes until the lentils have fully cooked and the soup has thickened.
9. Serve your delicious soup hot and enjoy!
0470d9ea90:
1. In a large pot, cook the sliced bacon over medium heat until crispy. Remove the bacon and set it aside on a plate. 
2. In the same pot, add the halved onion and minced garlic. Cook until the onion is translucent and the garlic is fragrant, stirring occasionally. 
3. Add the halved cabbage and ground paprika to the pot, stirring until the cabbage is coated in the paprika. Cook for 5 minutes. 
4. Pour in enough meat broth to cover the ingredients. Add the peeled tomato and dried raisins to the pot. 
5. Bring the mixture to a boil and then reduce the heat to a simmer. Cover the pot and let the soup simmer for 20 minutes. 
6. Add the sliced sausage to the pot and let it cook for an additional 10 minutes. 
7. Finally, serve the soup hot garnished with the crispy bacon, chopped parsley leaves, and a sprinkle of paprika. Enjoy!
04e2c650b0:
1. Soak 1 cup of dried peas overnight in a bowl of water.
2. In a large pot or Dutch oven, add the soaked peas, 1 processed meat hock, 2 sliced carrots, 1 chopped onion, 2 chopped celery stalks, 1 chopped pepper, and 4 cups of water. 
3. Bring the pot to a boil over medium-high heat. 
4. Reduce the heat to medium-low, cover the pot, and allow the ingredients to simmer for 1 1/2 to 2 hours, or until the peas are tender. 
5. Remove the meat hock from the pot and shred the meat into small pieces.
6. Add 1 pound of solid beef and 1/2 pound of sliced sausage into the pot. 
7. Return the shredded meat hock to the pot.
8. Sprinkle 1 teaspoon of ground salt over the ingredients.
9. Continue cooking the soup for another 30 minutes, or until the beef and sausage are cooked through.
10. Add 1/4 cup of chopped parsley to the pot and stir well.
11. Allow the soup to cool for a few minutes before serving. Enjoy your delicious soup!
007fd8202a:
1. In a large pot, heat the liquid oil over medium heat.
2. Add the whole garlic cloves and sauté for 1-2 minutes until they are slightly browned.
3. Add the dried basil and ground pepper and stir for another minute.
4. Add the dried lentils and stir for a minute.
5. Add the thick liquid broth to the pot and bring it to a boil.
6. Reduce the heat to low and let the soup simmer for about 25-30 minutes until the lentils are tender.
7. Add the shredded carrot, grated onion, chopped asparagus, and peas to the pot and let them cook for another 5-7 minutes until they are tender.
8. Add the ground sugar, ground marmalade, ground curry, ground saffron, ground salt, and ground pepper to the pot and stir until all the ingredients are well combined.
9. Let the soup simmer for another 5-7 minutes until all the flavors have blended together.
10. Taste and adjust the seasoning as needed.
11. Serve hot in a bowl and enjoy your delicious soup!
032d1efd8b:
1. Start by peeling the onion and the carrot. Cut them into small cubes.
2. Similarly, chop the celery and zucchini into small pieces.
3. In a large pot, add 2 tablespoons of oil and heat it over medium heat. 
4. Once the oil is heated, add in the diced onion and sauté until it becomes soft and translucent.
5. Next, add in the chopped carrots, celery, and zucchini. Finally, add in 1lb of ground pork and continue cooking until the pork is browned.
6. Once everything is cooked, add 2 quarts of liquid water, 1 quart of thick liquid stock, and 1 tablespoon of ground salt. 
7. Bring the pot to a boil, lower the heat and let it simmer for around 30 minutes. 
8. While the soup is simmering, take a small bowl and mix ½ cup of ground flour with ½ cup of water. Mix it thoroughly and add it to the soup. 
9. Let the soup cook for another 5-10 minutes until the soup thickens.
10. Add chopped parsley, chopped dill, ground chili, and ground pepper according to your taste. 
11. Let the soup simmer for an additional 2-3 minutes.
12. Serve the soup and enjoy!
024f34cf79:
1. Heat a large pot over medium heat and add 2 tablespoons of liquid oil.
2. Add 1 sliced onion to the pot and sauté for 3 minutes, or until it begins to soften.
3. Add 1 whole vegetable carrot, peeled and sliced, to the pot and stir.
4. Add 2 cloves of diced garlic and 1 teaspoon of dried basil to the pot and stir.
5. Add 1 1/2 cups of diced ham to the pot and stir.
6. Add 1 whole vegetable tomato, chopped, to the pot, and stir.
7. Pour 6 cups of thick liquid broth into the pot and bring everything to a boil.
8. Once boiling, add 1 can of beans and 1 cup of processed raw macaroni to the pot, and stir.
9. Reduce heat to medium-low and let simmer for 10 minutes until the macaroni is cooked and the vegetables are tender.
10. Season with 1 teaspoon of ground salt and 1/2 teaspoon of ground pepper, and stir.
11. Remove the pot from the heat and sprinkle grated Parmesan cheese on top for added flavor.
12. Serve the soup hot, garnished with fresh herbs, if desired. Enjoy!
048a3acd08:
1. Heat a pot or saucepan over medium heat and add 2 tablespoons of liquid oil.
2. Once the oil is hot, add 1 chopped onion and 1 chopped pepper to the pot, and stir frequently until softened, for about 5 minutes.
3. Add 2 cloves of minced garlic to the pot and stir for another minute.
4. Add 1 can of crushed tomatoes to the pot, and stir well until everything is combined.
5. Pour in 4 cups of thick liquid broth, and stir again.
6. Add 1/2 teaspoon of ground pepper and 1/2 teaspoon of ground chili to the pot, and stir well.
7. Add 1 cup of uncooked rice to the pot, and stir once more.
8. Bring the soup to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to low and let the soup simmer for about 25 minutes, stirring occasionally.
9. After 25 minutes, add 2 tablespoons of creamy butter to the pot, and stir until melted and combined.
10. Enjoy your delicious soup!
02135c788b:
1. Heat 1 tablespoon of liquid oil and 1 tablespoon of liquid butter in a large pot over medium heat.
2. Add 1 chopped onion and 2 chopped garlic cloves to the pot and sauté until the onions become translucent.
3. Add 2 cups of chopped carrots and stir to combine.
4. Rinse 1 cup of bean lentils and 1 cup of bean beans in a colander under cold water, then add them to the pot.
5. Stir in 1 teaspoon of ground cumin and 1/2 teaspoon of ground pepper.
6. Add 6 cups of liquid water and 1 teaspoon of flake pepper, then stir to combine.
7. Bring the pot to a boil, then reduce heat to low and let it simmer until the vegetables and beans are tender, about 30-40 minutes.
8. Once the soup is cooked, add 2 tablespoons of chopped cilantro and 1 teaspoon of ground salt.
9. Serve hot and enjoy!
04a5fba247:
1. Begin by peeling and chopping 4-5 medium-sized potatoes into small pieces.
2. Boil the chopped potatoes in a pot of water until they become tender.
3. Drain the water and mash the boiled potatoes using a potato masher or fork.
4. In a separate pan, cook 4-5 slices of bacon until they become crispy. Remove the bacon from the pan and set it aside.
5. Using the same pan, sauté 1 diced onion in the bacon fat until they become translucent.
6. Add the mashed potatoes to the pan and mix it with the sautéed onions.
7. Pour 3 cups of liquid milk into the pan and stir the mixture until it becomes smooth.
8. Stir in 1 cup of shredded cheddar cheese into the soup mixture and heat it gently until the cheese melts.
9. Crumble the cooked bacon pieces into the soup, leaving a small amount to garnish later.
10. Taste the soup and season with salt and pepper as needed.
11. Pour the soup into a bowl and garnish with remaining bacon crumbles and shredded cheddar cheese. Serve hot and enjoy your soup!
066b94983f:
1. Prepare a large pot and a sharp knife.
2. Rinse the whole chicken inside and out with cold water. Discard any giblets or excess fat.
3. Cut the chicken into 8 pieces using the sharp knife.
4. Heat the liquid oil in the large pot over medium-high heat.
5. Add the chicken pieces to the pot and cook until golden brown on all sides.
6. Add the ground seasoning to the chicken and stir well.
7. Add the softened butter to the pot and stir until melted.
8. Add the ground flour to the pot and stir constantly for 2-3 minutes until the mixture turns golden brown.
9. Add the ground salt, ground pepper, ground garlic, and ground chipotle powder to the pot and stir well.
10. Pour the meat broth into the pot and stir well to combine all the ingredients.
11. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, and let it simmer for 20-25 minutes or until the chicken is fully cooked.
12. Remove the chicken pieces from the pot and set them aside to cool.
13. Puree the remaining soup using an immersion blender, or transfer the mixture to a blender and blend until smooth.
14. Return the chicken pieces to the pot.
15. Add the liquid milk and diced cheese to the pot and stir well until the cheese is melted.
16. Add the thick sauce salsa to the pot and stir well.
17. Serve the soup hot with a side of baked rice and pieces chip.
04745dea7e:
1. Rinse 1 cup of uncooked rice thoroughly in cold water and set aside.
2. In a large pot, sauté 1 chopped onion in 2 tablespoons of oil until translucent.
3. Add 2 tablespoons of ground flour to the pot and stir until the flour is fully incorporated.
4. Pour in 4 cups of thick liquid broth and stir until the flour mixture is fully dissolved.
5. Add the rinsed rice to the pot and stir well.
6. Bring the soup to a boil over medium-high heat, then reduce heat to low and cover the pot.
7. Let the soup cook for about 20-25 minutes or until the rice is tender and fully cooked.
8. Once the rice is cooked, add ½ cup of creamy cream to the pot and stir well.
9. Season the soup with 1 teaspoon of ground pepper and stir until fully incorporated.
10. Garnish with chopped chive before serving. Enjoy!
018485b27b:
1. Begin by peeling 4 garlic cloves and set them aside.
2. In a pot, pour in 4 cups of thick liquid broth and bring it to a boil.
3. Reduce the heat to a simmer and add 2 tablespoons of liquid oil, 1 teaspoon of ground salt, 2 whole bay leaves, and 1 tablespoon of chopped sage leaves.
4. Stir the pot and let it cook for 10 minutes.
5. Add 1 sliced potato and 1 teaspoon of crushed cumin to the pot.
6. Let the soup cook for another 15 minutes or until the potatoes are soft and fully cooked.
7. Remove the bay leaves from the pot and discard them.
8. In a small bowl, mix 1/4 cup of thick liquid egg and slowly pour it into the pot over medium heat while continuously stirring.
9. Let the soup cook for another minute or until the eggs have fully cooked.
10. Lastly, add 1/2 cup of grated gruyere cheese and stir the pot until the cheese has melted.
11. Serve hot and enjoy your delicious soup!
031b8929b0:
1. Begin by prepping your vegetables. Wash and slice 2 medium-sized carrots, 2 celery stalks, and 1 onion.
2. In a large pot, sauté the sliced vegetables with 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat for about 5 minutes until they slightly soften.
3. Add minced garlic and stir until fragrant for roughly a minute.
4. Add 8 cups of chicken or vegetable broth to the pot and bring it to a boil.
5. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10-15 minutes.
6. While the soup is simmering, prepare 2 cups of shredded baked chicken, ready-to-cook whole-kernel corn or carve it out and baked noodles separately.
7. 5 minutes before the soup is done, add the baked chicken, whole kernel corn, crushed basil, and ground pepper to taste.
8. If you want a thicker soup, you can use a ladle or spoon and remove some vegetables or chicken pieces and blend them in a food processor. Once blends, add it back to the soup pot and stir.
9. Finally, add 1/2 cup of baked noodles to the pot.
10. Let the soup simmer for an additional 5-7 minutes.
11. Ladle your thick and hearty soup into bowls and enjoy!
06a71bc8c1:
1. Begin by peeling the broccoli stalks and breaking the florets apart. 
2. Chop an onion and set it aside. 
3. In a large pot, bring water to a boil and carefully add the broccoli florets. Allow them to cook for about 5 minutes or until tender. 
4. Remove the broccoli from the pot with a slotted spoon and set it aside. Keep the boiling water in the pot. 
5. Add the chopped onion to the boiling water and cook for about 5 minutes until it becomes translucent. 
6. Add thawed peas and allow them to cook for about 2-3 minutes until they are heated through. 
7. In a separate pan, melt some butter over medium heat. 
8. Add some flour to the melted butter and whisk continuously for about 2-3 minutes to form a smooth paste. 
9. Gradually add half and half to the flour mixture, whisking constantly to avoid lumps. 
10. Pour this mixture into the pot with the onion and peas. 
11. Add the cooked broccoli to the pot and stir everything together. 
12. Let the soup simmer for a few minutes until it thickens to your desired consistency. 
13. Season the soup with ground pepper according to your taste. 
14. Finally, mince the chive and sprinkle it over the top of the soup before serving. Enjoy!
01846feff0:
1. Begin by heating a large pot over medium heat.
2. Add 1 tablespoon of ground margarine to the pot and let it melt.
3. Once the margarine has melted, slowly add in 2 tablespoons of whole flour, stirring constantly until it forms a paste.
4. Gradually pour in 1 1/2 cups of thick liquid broth, stirring constantly to avoid lumps.
5. Add in 1 cup of diced chicken and 1/2 cup of ground pea to the pot, stirring to combine.
6. Let the soup simmer for 10-15 minutes, until the chicken is cooked through.
7. Add in 2 tablespoons of minced parsley and 1 tablespoon of grated lemon zest, stirring to combine.
8. Reduce the heat to low and add in 1/2 cup of creamy cheese, stirring until melted and fully incorporated into the soup.
9. Finally, season the soup with 1/2 teaspoon of ground salt, or to taste.
10. Remove the pot from heat and serve hot. Enjoy!
067dfb7d4e:
1. Begin by cleaning and preparing the vegetables. Peel the potato and carrot and cut them into small cubes. Cut the whole squash into small pieces. 
2. In a large soup pot, heat 1 tablespoon of liquid oil over medium heat. Add 2 cloves of minced garlic and sauté for 1-2 minutes until fragrant. 
3. Add the cubed potato, carrot, and squash to the pot and stir to combine with the garlic-infused oil. Sauté the vegetables for 5-7 minutes until slightly softened. 
4. Add 4 cups of thick liquid broth and 2 cups of liquid water to the pot. Bring the soup to a boil and then reduce the heat to medium-low. 
5. Add 1 teaspoon of dried parsley, 1 teaspoon of ground salt, and ½ teaspoon of ground pepper to the pot. Stir to combine the seasonings with the soup. 
6. Allow the soup to simmer for 20 minutes until the vegetables are tender. 
7. In the meantime, preheat your oven to 375°F. Spread 1 cup of baked beans and 1 cup of baked quinoa on a baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes until crispy. 
8. Once the soup is done cooking, remove it from the heat and allow it to cool for a few minutes. 
9. Serve the soup hot, garnished with the baked beans and quinoa on top. Enjoy!
01670c5a68:
1. In a large pot, heat up 2 tablespoons of oil over medium heat.
2. Add 1 diced onion, 1 diced carrot, and 1 diced celery to the pot. Stir to mix well and cook until the vegetables are slightly softened.
3. Add 2 cloves of minced garlic and stir for 30 seconds until fragrant.
4. Add 1 cup of sliced mushrooms to the pot and cook until they are slightly browned.
5. Pour in 6 cups of meat stock and add 2 bay leaves, 1 teaspoon of ground seasoning, and 1 teaspoon of ground basil to the pot. Stir to mix well.
6. Add 1 diced tomato, 1 can of whole kernel corn, 1 diced zucchini, and 2 cans of drained and rinsed beans to the pot. Stir to mix well.
7. Bring the soup to a boil and then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes.
8. Add 1 cup of uncooked pasta to the pot and continue to simmer for an additional 10 minutes until the pasta is tender.
9. Remove the bay leaves from the pot and season the soup to taste with salt and pepper.
10. Serve the soup hot and enjoy!
04000a64a5:
1. Start by making the thick liquid stock. For this, take a pot and add 2-3 cups of water to it.
2. Add vegetables such as chopped onions, celery, carrots, and garlic to the pot. You can also add a bay leaf or other herbs for flavor.
3. Bring the water to a boil and then reduce the heat to low. Let it simmer for about an hour, or until the stock is flavorful and thickened.
4. In the meantime, prepare the creamy cake. Take a mixing bowl and add 1 cup of all-purpose flour, 1 tsp of baking powder, ½ tsp of salt, and ¼ tsp of ground black pepper.
5. Mix well and then add 1 cup of milk and 1 egg to the bowl. Mix everything together until it forms a smooth batter.
6. Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C), and then pour the batter into a greased baking dish.
7. Bake the cake for 20-25 minutes, or until it is golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
8. Take the cake out of the oven and let it cool for a few minutes. Then, use a fork to break it up into small pieces.
9. Once the stock is done, strain it to remove the vegetables and herbs.
10. Add the cake pieces to the pot of hot stock and let them simmer for a few minutes until the cake pieces have soaked up some of the liquid and are soft.
11. Add a pinch or two of ground salt to taste.
12. Serve the soup hot and enjoy your delicious homemade soup with thick liquid stock, creamy cake, and seasoned with ground salt.
0643b24bc4:
1. Begin by peeling the squash and cutting it into small cubes. 
2. Heat a large pot over medium-high heat, and add the liquid oil. 
3. Once the oil is hot, add the diced squash to the pot, along with the halved salt, ground pepper, ground chile, ground nutmeg, ground ginger, and ground cumin. 
4. Stir well to coat the squash with the spices, and cook for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the squash is soft and lightly browned. 
5. Pour in the thick liquid stock, and bring the soup to a simmer. 
6. Reduce the heat to low, and simmer the soup for about 20 minutes. 
7. Once the squash is fully cooked and the soup has a nice thick consistency, use an immersion blender to blend the soup until it is completely smooth. 
8. Stir in the softened butter, and season the soup with additional ground pepper and salt, to taste. 
9. To serve, ladle the soup into bowls and top each serving with a sprinkle of baked chive for an extra burst of flavor. 
Enjoy your delicious, creamy squash soup!
00eb3e6171:
1. Begin by opening all cans and draining the corn, diced tomatoes, and black beans. Set all ingredients aside.
2. Heat a large pot over medium-high heat. Add the ground beef and cook until browned, stirring occasionally. Drain any excess grease.
3. Add the corn, diced tomatoes, black beans, and jar of thick tomato sauce to the pot. Combine all ingredients and bring to a simmer.
4. Next, add the ground seasoning to the pot and stir well. Let the soup continue to simmer for 5-7 minutes.
5. While the soup is simmering, crush a handful of tortilla chips and add them to the soup for additional texture.
6. Pour the heavy cream into the soup and stir gently. Let the soup continue to simmer for another 5 minutes.
7. Once the soup is done simmering, taste and adjust seasoning as needed.
8. Slice the avocado into small pieces and garnish on top of each bowl of soup.
9. Serve hot with additional tortilla chips on the side for dipping. Enjoy!
05e4d256c7:
1. Peel 2-3 medium-sized potatoes and cut them into small pieces. Set aside.
2. Take 1 whole onion and 1 whole garlic bulb. Cut off the roots and remove the outer skin of the onion and garlic.
3. Heat a pot on medium heat and add 1 tablespoon of olive oil.
4. Add the onion and garlic to the pot and sauté until they are lightly browned.
5. Add the chopped potatoes to the pot and stir them in with the onion and garlic.
6. Pour in enough thick sauce stock to cover the potatoes and vegetables in the pot.
7. Add 1 teaspoon of ground pepper, 1 teaspoon of ground rosemary, 1 teaspoon of ground paprika, and 1 teaspoon of minced nutmeg to the pot. Stir well to combine all the ingredients.
8. Bring the soup to a boil then reduce the heat to low.
9. Let the soup simmer for 20-25 minutes or until the potatoes are soft.
10. Once the soup is cooked, take the pot off the heat and let it cool down for a few minutes.
11. Use an immersion blender or a regular blender to puree the soup until it is smooth.
12. Serve hot and enjoy your delicious potato soup!
0633f9f6f4:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F. 
2. Take 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts and season them with salt, pepper, and any other desired seasoning. Place them on a baking sheet and bake them in the oven for 25-30 minutes until fully cooked. Once baked, chop the chicken into small bite-sized pieces and set aside. 
3. While the chicken is baking, prepare your vegetables. Dice one medium-sized tomato, chop 1 small onion, and 1 small pepper into small pieces. Also, mince 2 cloves of garlic. 
4. In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium-high heat. Once heated, add in the chopped onion, pepper, and minced garlic. Sauté the vegetables for around 5 minutes or until soft and fragrant. 
5. Add in 1 can of whole kernel corn (drained), diced tomato, and 1 tablespoon of ground cumin and ground chili. Stir everything together until well combined. 
6. Pour in 4 cups of chicken broth and bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and let simmer for around 10-15 minutes. 
7. Now, add in the chopped chicken and minced cilantro. Stir everything together and let it simmer for another 5 minutes. 
8. Lastly, stir in 1 cup of creamy cream and 1 cup of shredded cheese until everything is well combined. 
9. Let the soup simmer for another 2-3 minutes until the cheese has fully melted and the soup has thickened. 
10. Serve the soup with some baked chips on the side for a nice crunch. Enjoy!
0487231730:
1. In a pot or large saucepan, add ground tapioca and water. Stir to combine.
2. Place the pot over medium heat, bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 20-30 minutes. Stir frequently to prevent the tapioca from sticking to the bottom of the pot.
3. After the tapioca has cooked and absorbed most of the water, add the apricot juice/puree to the pot. Continue to stir and cook for a few more minutes until the mixture thickens and becomes slightly translucent.
4. Stir in the dried fruit, honey, salt, and sliced banana, and cook the mixture for another 5-10 minutes, until the fruit is soft and the soup is heated through.
5. Remove the pot from the heat and stir in the liquid extract of your choice (such as vanilla or almond). 
6. Serve the soup hot in bowls or mugs. Enjoy!
060beb1f86:
1. Gather all the ingredients: thick liquid stock, grated ginger, sliced onion, sliced rib, baked chicken, soy sauce, and hoisin sauce.
2. In a large pot, heat up the liquid stock over medium heat until it starts to simmer.
3. Add the grated ginger to the pot, and stir well to combine. Let it simmer for a few minutes until the ginger flavor permeates the soup.
4. Next, add the sliced onion and sliced rib to the pot, and stir well. Let it simmer for another 10-15 minutes until the vegetables and meat are tender.
5. Once the vegetables and meat are cooked through, add the baked chicken to the pot. Stir to combine.
6. Pour in the soy sauce and hoisin sauce, and stir well to incorporate all the flavors.
7. Let the soup simmer for another 5-10 minutes so all the flavors have time to meld together.
8. Taste the soup, and adjust the seasoning as needed. You may want to add a pinch of salt or a dash of black pepper to enhance the flavor.
9. Serve the soup hot, garnished if desired with some fresh herbs or chopped scallions.
01c639a4e6:
1. Rinse the strawberries, raspberries, and blueberries.
2. Remove the stems from the strawberries and chop them into small pieces.
3. Add the chopped strawberries, raspberries, and blueberries to a blender.
4. Pour two cups of creamy yogurt into the blender.
5. Add half a cup of creamy cream to the blender.
6. Sprinkle a tablespoon of ground sugar over the mixture in the blender.
7. Blend the mixture in the blender until it is smooth.
8. Pour the mixture into a pot and heat on low to medium heat.
9. Add a handful of fresh mint leaves to the pot.
10.Stir the soup as it heats until it reaches a simmer.
11. Let the soup simmer for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally.
12. Remove the pot from heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
13. Pour the soup into bowls and garnish with additional fresh mint leaves, if desired.
14. Serve and enjoy your delicious homemade Strawberry, Raspberry and Blueberry soup with creamy yogurt and cream.
032f575ca9:
1. In a large pot, melt 2 tablespoons of softened butter over medium heat.
2. Add 1 diced onion and 2 crushed cloves of whole veg garlic. Sautee until onion is translucent.
3. Add 1 cup of dried bean lentil and stir well to combine.
4. Pour in 4 cups of thick liquid stock and add 2 bay leaves to the pot.
5. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and allow to simmer for about 45 minutes or until the lentils are tender.
6. While soup is simmering, chop 1/4 cup of baked walnuts and set aside.
7. Once lentils are cooked, remove bay leaves from the pot and discard.
8. Using an immersion blender, puree the soup until smooth and creamy.
9. Return the pot to medium heat and season with ground black pepper to taste.
10. Ladle soup into bowls and top each portion with a dollop of creamy creme fraiche, a sprinkle of chopped walnuts, and a pinch of minced parsley. Enjoy!
00047059be:
1. In a large pot, heat the liquid oil over medium heat.
2. Once the oil is heated, add the chopped onion and sauté for about 5 minutes until softened and translucent.
3. Add the peeled and cubed squash to the pot and stir to coat with oil and onion.
4. Pour the thick liquid broth over the squash and onion mixture and bring to a boil.
5. Reduce the heat to low and let the soup simmer until the squash is tender and cooked through.
6. Once the squash is cooked, add the peeled and diced apple to the pot and let it simmer for a few more minutes.
7. Using an immersion blender, blend the soup until it is smooth and creamy.
8. Add the liquid half and half to the soup and stir until combined.
9. Add the chopped parsley and thyme to the soup and stir.
10. Serve the soup hot with whole snack croutons and a dollop of creamy cream on top.
055e5ce7f9:
1. Begin by browning the ground beef in a large pot over medium heat. Once browned, remove the beef from the pot and set it aside.
2. In the same pot, sauté the chopped onion, shredded carrot, and diced celery until they become soft and translucent.
3. Add dried basil and dried parsley to the pot, give it a quick stir, and allow the herbs to infuse into the vegetables for a minute or two.
4. Add in the halved butter and let it melt into the vegetable mixture.
5. Pour in the thick liquid broth and diced potato into the pot, and bring the mixture to a simmer.
6. Once the soup is simmering, sprinkle in the ground flour and whisk it until it's well combined.
7. Add the cooked beef back to the pot and let the soup cook for a few more minutes until the potatoes are tender and the broth has thickened.
8. In a separate pan, sauté the diced mushroom until it's cooked and slightly browned.
9. Add the cooked mushroom to the soup and let it simmer for a few more minutes.
10. Reduce the heat to low and gradually pour in the liquid milk, stirring it gently as you pour.
11. Add the diced cheese and stir until it's melted and well combined.
12. Season the soup with ground salt and ground pepper to taste.
13. Finally, pour in the creamy cream and stir until it's fully incorporated.
14. Serve hot and garnish with additional parsley or grated cheese, if desired. Enjoy!
01ac1181f2:
1. Melt 1 tablespoon of ground butter in a large pot over medium heat.
2. Add 2 tablespoons of chopped shallot and 1 sliced leek, and sauté until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
3. Sprinkle in 1 tablespoon of ground curry, stirring constantly for 1 minute until fragrant. 
4. Add 4 cups of peeled and cubed squash and pour in 4 cups of thick liquid stock, 1 cup of liquid water, and 1/4 cup of dried white wine.
5. Bring to a boil and then reduce to a simmer for 20-25 minutes until the squash is tender.
6. Add in 1 small meat mussel, 1 teaspoon of minced thyme, 1/2 teaspoon of ground pepper, and 1/2 teaspoon of ground salt, stirring well.
7. Simmer the soup for an additional 5 minutes until the mussel is fully cooked and the flavors have melded together.
8. Serve hot, garnished with fresh cilantro leaves. Enjoy your curry squash and mussel soup!
02b3076c52:
1. Start by heating 2 tablespoons of ground margarine in a large soup pot over medium heat.
2. Add 1 chopped onion to the pot and sauté until soft and translucent.
3. Pour in 6 cups of liquid water and add 1 cup of chopped celery, ¼ cup of minced parsley, 1 diced parsnip, 1 cup of grain barley, and 1 diced carrot.
4. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and let it simmer for 25 minutes, stirring occasionally.
5. After 25 minutes, add 1 cup of peas to the pot and continue to simmer for an additional 5-10 minutes, or until the vegetables are cooked to your preference.
6. Finally, season the soup with ground pepper to taste and serve hot.
06b6686fe4:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F.
2. Season the chicken with salt, pepper and any other desired seasoning. Place onto a baking sheet and bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F.
3. While the chicken bakes, prepare the other ingredients. Chop 2-3 medium carrots, 1 small onion, and mince 2 cloves of garlic. Set aside.
4. In a large pot or dutch oven, heat 1-2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the chopped onion and sauté for 2-3 minutes, until it begins to soften.
5. Add the chopped carrots and minced garlic to the pot and stir. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes until the veggies are slightly softened.
6. Pour in 6-8 cups of a thick liquid broth, such as chicken or vegetable broth. Bring to a simmer.
7. Add 1 cup of uncooked rice to the pot and stir. Allow the soup to simmer for 15-20 minutes or until the rice is cooked through.
8. Shred the baked chicken with a fork and add to the pot.
9. Stir in 1 cup of creamy soup, such as cream of chicken or mushroom soup. Simmer for an additional 5-10 minutes until everything is heated through.
10. Add 1 tablespoon of minced lemon and 1/4 cup of chopped fresh parsley to the pot. Season with ground pepper to taste. Stir well.
11. Serve hot and enjoy! Optional: garnish with additional fresh parsley, lemon wedges or croutons.
03f8c0de57:
1. Heat 2 tablespoons of liquid oil in a large pot over medium heat. 
2. Add 1 diced onion and cook for 5 minutes or until translucent. 
3. Add 1 sliced rib and 1 sliced carrot and cook for 5 minutes. 
4. Add 2 cloves of minced garlic and cook for another minute. 
5. Add 1 cup of sliced cabbage, 1 cup of sliced zucchini, and 1 diced tomato. Cook for 5 minutes. 
6. Add 4 cups of liquid broth and 2 cups of liquid water to the pot. 
7. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes. 
8. Add 1 cup of cooked and shredded solid chicken, 1 cup of uncooked liquid barley, and 2 bay leaves to the pot. 
9. Season with 1 teaspoon of ground seasoning, 1 teaspoon of ground salt, and 1/2 teaspoon of ground pepper. 
10. Simmer the soup for another 20 minutes or until the barley is tender. 
11. Remove the bay leaves before serving. Enjoy your delicious soup!
00439a5d01:
1. Start by heating 2 tablespoons of liquid oil in a large pot.
2. Add 1 whole diced onion, 2 whole diced carrots, and 2 whole diced ribs of celery to the pot. Cook for 5-7 minutes until the vegetables start to soften.
3. Next, add the whole chicken to the pot, covering it with water by an inch or two. Bring the pot to a boil, then reduce the heat to a simmer and let the soup cook for 1-2 hours until the chicken is cooked through.
4. Remove the chicken from the pot and set it aside to cool. Strain the soup through a fine mesh sieve, discarding the vegetables and reserving the broth.
5. Return the broth to the pot and add 1/4 cup of fish sauce, 1 tablespoon of ground sugar, 1 teaspoon of ground salt, and 1/4 teaspoon of ground pepper. Stir to combine.
6. Shred the cooked chicken and add it back to the soup. Simmer the soup for an additional 10-15 minutes.
7. While the soup is simmering, cook 1 package of baked noodles according to the package instructions. Drain the noodles and set them aside.
8. Finally, add 1/4 cup of minced cilantro, 1/4 cup of minced basil, and the zest from 1 lime to the soup. Stir to combine and taste for seasoning, adjusting as needed.
9. To serve, ladle the soup into bowls and top each bowl with a handful of cooked noodles. Enjoy!
011f7e666c:
1. Start by washing and rinsing the whole veg cabbage.
2. Cut the cabbage into small pieces and set it aside.
3. Peel and chop the onion into small pieces.
4. Place a large pot on the stove and turn on the heat to medium-high.
5. Add a tablespoon of oil to the pot and let it get hot.
6. Add the chopped onion, and sauté it for 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally.
7. Add in the chopped tomato and cook for a further 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally.
8. Add the potato pieces, mixed vegetable, and cabbage to the pot and stir everything together.
9. Pour water into the pot until all vegetables are covered, put salt and pepper according to taste.
10. Bring the soup to a boil and then reduce the heat to low.
11. Add a teaspoon of dried parsley, and a teaspoon of dried thyme to the pot.
12. Simmer the soup for approximately 30-40 minutes, or until the vegetables are soft.
13. Serve the soup hot and enjoy!
04856238bf:
1. Heat a large pot on medium heat and add in the liquid oil.
2. When the oil is hot, add in the whole veg onion and chopped pepper. Stir the vegetables frequently to ensure they do not burn.
3. After a few minutes, add in the minced garlic and continue stirring for another 30 seconds to a minute.
4. Add the sliced carrot, peeled potato, and peeled pumpkin to the pot. Continue stirring for another 3-5 minutes.
5. Pour in the lentils and stir to combine with the vegetables.
6. Add enough thick liquid stock to cover the vegetables and lentils. If you prefer a thinner soup, you can add more liquid stock.
7. Sprinkle in the desired amount of ground salt, ground pepper, and ground curry to taste.
8. Peel a small piece of ginger and add it whole to the pot. This will add a subtle ginger flavor to the soup.
9. Bring the soup to a simmer and let it cook for about 30 minutes, or until the vegetables and lentils are tender.
10. Remove the piece of ginger and use an immersion blender or transfer the soup to a blender to puree until smooth.
11. Taste the soup and adjust the seasonings as needed.
12. Serve hot and enjoy!
000d94f80b:
1. In a large pot, heat the liquid oil over medium heat.
2. Add the sliced onion and sauté for about 5 minutes until they become translucent.
3. Add the chopped onion and leek and sauté for another 5 minutes until they become soft.
4. Add the diced potato and continue to sauté for an additional 5 minutes.
5. Pour in the thick liquid broth and stir well.
6. Add the grated ginger and ground salt, and let the mixture come to a boil.
7. Reduce heat to simmer and cook for about 20 minutes until the potatoes become tender.
8. Remove from heat and let it cool.
9. Use an immersion blender to puree the soup until it's smooth.
10. Once pureed, place the soup back on the heat and simmer for a few more minutes.
11. Squeeze the juice of the sliced lemon into the soup and stir well.
12. Serve hot with a garnish of diced leek or chopped parsley if desired.
043d187560:
1. Start by washing your whole pumpkin thoroughly and cutting it into small pieces.
2. Next, slice an onion and mince some garlic.
3. In a large pot, heat up some liquid oil and fry the sliced onion and minced garlic for a few minutes until they soften.
4. Add the sliced courgette and sliced mushrooms to the pot and continue frying until they are slightly cooked.
5. Next, add the chopped tomato to the pot and allow it to cook for a few more minutes.
6. Add the processed raw pasta to the pot and mix well. Pour in the liquid stock and let it simmer for about 15-20 minutes until the pasta is cooked.
7. Once the pasta is cooked, add the chopped pumpkin to the pot and stir well.
8. In a separate bowl, mix the creamy fromage frai with some water and add it to the soup while stirring.
9. Allow the soup to cook for another 10-15 minutes until the pumpkin is soft.
10. Finally, add the chopped basil and ground pepper to the pot and stir well.
11. Serve hot and enjoy your delicious pumpkin soup!
034cedbfea:
1. Start by rinsing and peeling three medium carrots. 
2. Halve one large parsnip and one medium onion. 
3. In a medium-sized pot, heat up 2 tablespoons of liquid oil over medium-high heat. 
4. Add the halved parsnip and onion, and cook until they are lightly browned on both sides. 
5. Roughly chop the peeled carrots and add them to the pot with the parsnip and onion. 
6. Add 1 teaspoon of ground salt and 1/2 teaspoon of ground pepper. 
7. Pour in 4 cups of liquid water and stir to combine all the ingredients. 
8. Bring the soup to a boil, reduce the heat to low, and let simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender. 
9. While the soup is simmering, preheat your oven to 375°F. 
10. Slice a baguette into 1/2 inch slices, brush them lightly with liquid oil, and sprinkle them with a pinch of salt. 
11. Bake the baguette slices in the preheated oven until they are toasted and lightly golden brown, about 10-12 minutes. 
12. When the soup is finished simmering, remove it from heat and use an immersion blender or a regular blender to puree until smooth. 
13. Serve the soup hot with the sliced baguette on the side for dipping. Enjoy!
048614215e:
1. Begin by peeling and dicing one large onion and mincing 3 cloves of garlic. 
2. In a large pot, heat a tablespoon of oil on medium-high heat. 
3. Once the oil is heated, add the diced onion and minced garlic to the pot and sauté until the onion becomes translucent. 
4. While the onion is cooking, peel and dice 2 large carrots and set aside. 
5. Once the onion is cooked, add the diced carrots to the pot and stir. 
6. Cut a whole rib of meat marrow into small pieces and add it to the pot. 
7. Add 1 cup of peas to the pot and stir. 
8. Season the mixture with 1 teaspoon of ground salt and 1 teaspoon of ground pepper. 
9. Pour 4 cups of liquid water into the pot and stir. 
10. Cover the pot and let it simmer on low heat for 30-45 minutes or until the meat marrow is fully cooked and the vegetables are tender. 
11. Once the soup is ready, let it cool for a few minutes before serving. Enjoy!
014c544762:
1. Begin by gathering all of your ingredients: whole egg, thick liquid stock, minced onion, liquid fat, ground salt, ground pepper, peeled carrot, and chopped parsley.
2. Heat a pot on medium heat and add the liquid fat.
3. Once the fat has melted, add the minced onion and peeled carrot. Cook until the onion becomes translucent and the carrot begins to soften, stirring occasionally.
4. Pour in the thick liquid stock and bring to a boil.
5. Reduce the heat to medium-low and let the soup simmer for 10-15 minutes, or until the carrots are fully cooked.
6. While the soup is simmering, crack the whole egg into a separate bowl and whisk until fully mixed.
7. Once the soup has finished simmering, slowly pour in the whisked egg while stirring the soup continuously. The egg will cook and create ribbons in the soup.
8. Add ground salt and ground pepper to taste.
9. Finally, garnish with chopped parsley and serve hot. Enjoy!
0035085436:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Cook the baked noodles according to package directions, but reduce the cooking time by 2-3 minutes. Drain and set aside.
3. In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat 1 tablespoon of whole nuts oil and 1 tablespoon of liquid oil over medium heat.
4. Add halved leek and sauté for 2-3 minutes until tender.
5. Add roughly chopped cilantro, leaves chard leaf, and leaves cilantro to the pot and sauté for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
6. Add thick liquid water to the pot and bring to a boil.
7. Reduce the heat to low and let the soup simmer for 10-15 minutes until the vegetables are tender.
8. While the soup is simmering, prepare the eggs. Crack them into a bowl and whisk them lightly with a fork.
9. In a small skillet, heat 1-2 tablespoons of whole nuts oil over medium heat.
10. Pour the eggs into the skillet and cook for 1-2 minutes until set. Use a spatula to flip the eggs and cook for another minute until fully cooked. Transfer to a cutting board and chop into small pieces.
11. Once the soup is done simmering, add the cooked baked noodles, grated cheese, and chopped eggs to the pot.
12. Stir well until the cheese has melted and everything is well combined.
13. Season the soup with ground salt and ground pepper to taste.
14. Ladle the soup into bowls and garnish with extra chopped cilantro, if desired.
15. Serve hot and enjoy!
00a16b3741:
1. Melt 2 tablespoons of softened butter in a large pot over medium heat.
2. Add 1 cup of chopped onion to the pot and sauté for 5 minutes until the onion is translucent.
3. Add 4 cups of chopped cauliflower to the pot and continue cooking for another 5 minutes until the cauliflower is tender.
4. Pour in 4 cups of thick liquid broth and bring the mixture to a boil.
5. Reduce the heat to low and let the soup simmer for 10 minutes.
6. Sprinkle 1/4 cup of ground flour into the soup and whisk the soup continuously for 2 minutes to thicken it.
7. Pour in 2 cups of liquid milk and stir the soup until it is well combined.
8. Add 1 cup of shredded cheddar cheese to the soup and stir until the cheese has melted.
9. Sprinkle 1/4 teaspoon of ground pepper and 2 tablespoons of minced parsley into the soup.
10. Top the soup with whole snack crouton and serve hot. Enjoy your delicious cauliflower cheddar soup!
025c1ca619:
1. Start by prepping the vegetables. Peel and finely chop one onion, peel and chop one carrot, dice one rib and dice two tomatoes.
2. In a pot, add two cups of water and one cup of bean lentil. Bring to a boil then let it simmer for about 20 minutes or until the lentils are soft.
3. In a separate pan, brown the beef until cooked through. Set aside.
4. In the same pan, sauté the onion, carrot and rib until softened.
5. Add the diced tomatoes and continue cooking for about 5 minutes.
6. Once the lentils are cooked, add the sautéed vegetables and beef to the pot.
7. Add two cups of water to the pot and stir.
8. Season with ground pepper to taste.
9. Add in the spinach leaves and let it simmer for a few more minutes until the spinach is wilted.
10. Serve hot, topped with grated parmesan cheese to your taste. Enjoy!
0040208bde:
1. Heat a large pot over medium-high heat.
2. Add liquid oil to the pot and allow it to heat up.
3. Add chopped leek and minced garlic to the pot and sauté for 3-4 minutes, stirring occasionally.
4. Sprinkle in dried thyme and stir for 1 minute.
5. Pour thick liquid stock into the pot and bring to a boil.
6. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 15-20 minutes or until the leeks are tender.
7. Remove from heat and let it cool down for a few minutes.
8. Use an immersion blender to blend soup mixture until smooth.
9. Add whipped cream and thick sauce mustard to the soup and stir until well combined.
10. Return the pot to the stove and heat on medium-low for 5-10 minutes or until the soup is heated through.
11. Serve hot and enjoy!
0330796970:
1. Begin by gathering all of your ingredients: 1/4 cup softened butter, 1 peeled and diced apple, 1 cup of thick sauce puree, 1 teaspoon of ground salt, 1/2 teaspoon of ground pepper, 1 tablespoon of ground sugar, 1/4 teaspoon of minced nutmeg, 4 cups of meat broth, and 1/2 cup of whipped half and half.
2. In a large soup pot, melt the softened butter over medium heat.
3. Add the diced apple to the pot and cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the apple is tender.
4. Stir in the thick sauce puree, ground salt, ground pepper, ground sugar, and minced nutmeg.
5. Pour in the meat broth and bring the soup to a boil, then reduce the heat and let it simmer for 10 minutes.
6. Once the soup has simmered for 10 minutes and the flavors have melded together, turn off the heat.
7. Using an immersion blender, puree the soup until it is smooth and creamy.
8. Return the pot to the stove and heat the soup over low heat.
9. Stir in the whipped half and half and continue to cook the soup until it is heated through.
10. Finally, taste the soup and adjust the seasoning to your liking.
11. Serve the soup hot and enjoy!
046d87bbf2:
1. Melt 1 tablespoon of ground butter in a large pot over medium heat.
2. Cut 2 steaks leek into thin slices and add them to the melted butter. Stir occasionally until they become soft.
3. Peel 1 large carrot and cut it into small pieces. Add them to the pot along with 1 tablespoon of chopped garlic and 1 cup of diced ham. Cook for 5 minutes.
4. Pour 4 cups of thick liquid broth into the pot along with 1 teaspoon of dried thyme, ½ teaspoon of ground salt, and ¼ teaspoon of ground pepper.
5. Bring the soup to a boil, then lower the heat and let it simmer for 30 minutes.
6. Once the soup is cooked, turn off the heat and add 2 tablespoons of chopped parsley.
7. Serve the soup hot and enjoy!
06a0284927:
1. In a large pot, heat up some oil and add diced onions. Cook until translucent.
2. Add diced chicken and cook until browned on all sides.
3. Add diced pepper and continue cooking for an additional 2 minutes.
4. Add grain corn and mix well.
5. Pour in bean liquid and simmer for 10 minutes.
6. Add diced tomato and sauce tomato, and mix well.
7. Add liquid water, ground chili, dried parsley, ground garlic, ground pepper, and ground cumin. Mix well.
8. Allow the soup to simmer for an additional 15-20 minutes, or until the chicken is fully cooked and the flavors are well blended.
9. Taste the soup and adjust seasoning as needed.
10. Serve hot and enjoy your delicious chicken and pepper soup!
05813b8685:
1. Melt 2 tablespoons of softened butter in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat.
2. Add 1 chopped onion, 2 chopped celery stalks and 2 chopped carrots to the pot. Cook until the vegetables soften, stirring occasionally, for about 10 minutes.
3. Peel and chop 1 apple and add it to the pot with the vegetables. Add 1 tablespoon of grated ginger and cook for 2 more minutes, stirring constantly.
4. Sprinkle 2 tablespoons of ground flour and 1 tablespoon of ground curry over the vegetables and stir until everything is well combined.
5. Pour in 4 cups of thick liquid stock and stir to mix. Add 1 cup of grain rice and 1 cup of chopped chicken to the pot. Stir until the rice and chicken are submerged in the stock.
6. Bring the soup to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low, cover the pot with a lid, and let the soup simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and the soup has thickened.
7. Once the soup has cooked, add 1 cup of liquid milk to the pot and stir. Cook for an additional 5 minutes.
8. Taste the soup and season with 1 teaspoon of ground pepper, more or less to your preference.
9. Serve the soup hot with your favorite bread or crackers. Enjoy!
061de43d75:
1. Begin by heating 2 tablespoons of liquid oil in a saucepan over medium heat.
2. Add 1 diced onion to the saucepan and sauté until translucent, stirring occasionally for about 5 minutes.
3. Once the onion is cooked, add in 2 cups of sliced mushroom to the saucepan.
4. Cook the mushrooms for about 6-8 minutes until they begin to brown and release their moisture, stirring frequently.
5. Next, add 2 cups of water to the saucepan and bring it to a boil.
6. After the water begins to boil, reduce the heat to a simmer and let the mixture cook for an additional 10-12 minutes.
7. Once the soup has simmered, add in 1 cup of creamy cheese to the saucepan and stir until it has completely melted.
8. Season the soup with 1/2 teaspoon of ground salt, 1 teaspoon of ground garlic, and 1/4 teaspoon of ground pepper, and stir to combine.
9. Allow the soup to cook for an additional 2-3 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
10. Taste the soup and adjust the seasoning, as needed.
11. Remove the soup from the heat and let it sit for a few minutes before serving. Enjoy!
05c1cc3ce1:
1. Start by chopping the chicken into small pieces and set it aside.
2. Peel and dice the carrot and celery into small pieces, and set it aside.
3. Mince the parsley into small pieces, and set it aside.
4. Beat the egg in a small bowl and set it aside.
5. Preheat the liquid oil in a large pot over medium heat.
6. Add minced nutmeg, baked meal and ground pepper to the pot and stir them for about 1 minute.
7. Add the chopped chicken, sliced onion, grated ginger, diced carrot, and celery to the pot, and stir them for about 5 minutes until the chicken is cooked.
8. Add the thick liquid broth to the pot and then add the spinach, minced parsley, and bean sprout.
9. Simmer for about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are tender.
10. Taste the soup and add salt or pepper if needed.
11. Remove the pot from the heat and let it cool for a couple of minutes.
12. Ladle the soup into bowls, and serve it with bread, if desired. Enjoy your homemade chicken vegetable soup!
061a1886dc:
1. In a large pot, melt the butter over medium heat.
2. Add the ground flour to the melted butter and whisk it until the mixture becomes smooth and bubbly.
3. Gradually pour in the liquid milk while continuing to whisk the mixture until it becomes thickened and smooth.
4. Add the sliced bacon to the mixture and simmer it for about 5-7 minutes.
5. Mix in the heavy cream, ground salt, and ground pepper to the pot and stir it until it's fully combined.
6. Add the baked potatoes and chopped onions into the pot and cook it for another 10 minutes or until the potatoes and onions have softened.
7. Sprinkle the shredded cheddar cheese over the soup and stir it until the cheese is melted completely.
8. Serve the soup immediately and enjoy!
03b718988e:
1. Begin by heating a large soup pot over medium-high heat, and then add in the sliced bacon. Cook the bacon until it is crispy and the fat has rendered out.
2. Remove the bacon from the pot, and set it aside on a paper towel-lined plate to drain. Leave the bacon fat in the pot.
3. Reduce the heat to medium and add the chopped onion to the pot. Stir and cook the onion until it is softened and translucent, for about 5 minutes.
4. Add the minced garlic to the pot and stir everything together. Cook until the garlic becomes fragrant and soft, for about 1 minute.
5. Add the chopped tomatoes to the pot, and stir everything together. Cook for about 5 minutes, or until the tomatoes are slightly softened and starting to release their juices.
6. Add the thick liquid broth to the pot, and stir everything together. Bring the soup to a simmer.
7. Once the soup is simmering, add in the cooked bacon, bay leaves, ground salt, and ground pepper. Stir everything together.
8. Lower the heat to medium-low and let the soup simmer for an extra 10-15 minutes, or until the vegetables are fully cooked and the flavors have melded together.
9. Once the soup is done, remove the bay leaves from the pot, and then serve it up hot with a sprinkle of fresh herbs or extra bacon on top, if desired. Enjoy!
02756e915b:
1. Begin by preparing all the ingredients. Processed meat bacon should be diced into small pieces. Grate the courgette and carrot, and dice the onion, leek, garlic, and celery. 
2. In a large pot, heat some oil and add the diced onion, leeks, and garlic. Cook for a few minutes until the onions are translucent. 
3. Now, add the diced bacon and stir well. Allow it to cook until it has browned a bit. 
4. Add the grated courgette, grated carrot, and diced celery. Mix it all together and cook for a further five minutes, stirring frequently. 
5. Next, add the leaves bay leaf, minced thyme, and ground pepper. Stir well and allow it to cook for another minute. 
6. Add the thick liquid stock to the pot and bring it to a boil. Reduce the heat, cover the pot, and let it simmer for 10-15 minutes. 
7. Add a splash of liquid wine to the pot and stir. Simmer for another 3-4 minutes. 
8. Turn off the heat and remove the bay leaves. Allow the soup to cool for a few minutes before serving. 
9. Serve hot and enjoy your delicious and hearty soup with processed meat bacon, grated courgette, diced onion, sliced leek, diced garlic, leaves bay leaf, thick liquid stock, ground pepper, minced thyme, diced celery, and liquid wine.
0025ca4eef:
1. Heat the oil in a large pot over medium-high heat.
2. Add the chopped onion and crushed garlic, sauté until fragrant and tender, for about 2-3 minutes.
3. Add the diced capsicum and cook for 1-2 minutes until it becomes tender.
4. Pour in the whole can of corn, including the juice, and stir everything together.
5. Add the thick liquid stock and bring to a boil.
6. Reduce the heat to low and let the soup simmer for about 10-15 minutes, to allow the flavors to meld together.
7. Taste the soup and add salt, pepper, or other seasonings to your preference.
8. Stir in the chopped coriander leaves.
9. Remove the soup from heat and allow it to cool for a few minutes.
10. Serve the soup hot with some freshly baked bread or crackers. Enjoy!
03e51b21e1:
1. Heat a large pot over medium heat and add 2 tablespoons of liquid oil.
2. Add 1 cup of chopped onion and sauté for 3-4 minutes, until it becomes translucent.
3. Add 1 peeled and chopped apple, 1 peeled and chopped turnip, 1 peeled and chopped squash, and 1 chopped carrot to the pot. Stir for a few minutes until the vegetables start to soften.
4. Add 2 peeled and chopped potatoes to the pot and pour in enough thick liquid stock to cover the vegetables.
5. Bring the soup to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
6. Add ¼ cup of thick sauce syrup and stir well.
7. Season with ground pepper to taste.
8. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
9. Cut a whole baguette into thin slices and place them on a baking sheet. Brush each slice with a little liquid oil and bake in the oven for 10-15 minutes, until crispy.
10. Ladle the soup into serving bowls and sprinkle chopped chives on top. Serve with the crispy baguette slices and a dollop of creamy cheese on top of the soup. Enjoy!
04f3c0f7a4:
1. In a soup pot, brown the ground beef over medium-high heat until it's cooked thoroughly. Remove from heat and set aside.
2. In the same pot, sauté the chopped onion over medium heat until it becomes soft and translucent.
4. Stir in the cooked ground beef and mix until combined.
5. Add the 6 cups of thick liquid beef stock to the pot and stir.
6. Add 1 cup of grain rice to the pot and stir.
7. Season with 1 tsp of ground salt and 1/2 tsp of ground pepper.
8. In a small bowl, whisk 2 tbsp of all-purpose flour with 1/4 cup of water.
9. Slowly pour the flour mixture into the pot while stirring until the soup has thickened slightly.
10. Simmer the soup for 20 minutes or until the rice is cooked thoroughly.
11. In a separate small bowl, whisk together 1 whole egg, 2 tbsp of softened butter, and 2 tbsp of liquid lemon.
12. Add the egg mixture to the soup and stir gently.
13. Add 1/4 cup of fresh parsley and 2 tbsp of fresh mint to the soup and stir.
14. Remove the pot from heat and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.
15. Serve hot and enjoy!
00202f23e5:
1. Cut the whole melon into small cubes or chunks, removing the seeds and rind.
2. Rinse and finely chop a handful of cilantro leaves.
3. In a pot, bring 4 cups of water to a boil.
4. Add the cubes or chunks of melon to the boiling water and cook for 5-7 minutes, until the melon is tender.
5. Add the chopped cilantro to the pot and stir.
6. Remove the pot from heat and let the soup cool down a bit.
7. Add a few drops of hot sauce to the soup and stir.
8. Sprinkle some ground salt into the soup and stir again.
9. Use an immersion blender or transfer the soup to a blender and puree until smooth.
10. Taste and adjust seasoning if necessary.
11. Serve the soup hot or cold, garnished with additional cilantro leaves if desired.
06c29c21cf:
1. In a large pot, heat a tablespoon of liquid oil over medium heat.
2. Add a teaspoon of minced garlic, and sauté for about 30 seconds until fragrant.
3. Add a chopped tomato and continue to cook for another two minutes, stirring occasionally.
4. Next, add a whole vegetable potato, a peeled carrot, and a peeled onion, all chopped into bite-sized pieces.
5. Add sliced celery and whole vegetable mushrooms to the pot.
6. Add a teaspoon of dried thyme, a teaspoon of dried rosemary, and a couple of bay leaves.
7. Season with a teaspoon of ground salt.
8. Add peeled turkey and cover with water or chicken broth. 
9. Bring to a boil.
10. Reduce heat and let simmer for about an hour, stirring occasionally.
11. Add thawed peas, thawed corn, and minced parsley to the pot.
12. Season with some ground pepper.
13. Let simmer for an additional 10 minutes, until the peas and corn are heated through.
14. Adjust seasoning if necessary.
15. Ladle into bowls and serve hot.
019210eadb:
1. Begin by heating up a pot with a few tablespoons of liquid oil over medium-high heat.
2. Once the oil is hot, add in the chopped onion, minced garlic, diced rib, diced carrot, and diced peppers. Stir occasionally and sauté until the vegetables are tender, which should take about 5 to 7 minutes.
3. Add in the diced chili, ground oregano, ground cumin, and ground pepper. Stir briefly and allow the spices to cook for about a minute or two.
4. Add in the liquid water, solid chicken, and thick liquid broth. Stir everything together and bring the soup up to a boil.
5. Add in the soaked bean beans and grain rice to the soup. Reduce the heat to a low and let the soup simmer for approximately 20 minutes, or until the rice and beans are fully cooked.
6. Season the soup with ground salt, ground pepper, and ground cilantro to taste. Adjust the seasoning as needed before serving.
7. Serve the soup hot with your desired garnishes, such as fresh herbs, avocado, or sour cream.
007d8ef84e:
1. In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat 2 tablespoons of liquid oil over medium heat.
2. Add the chopped onion, chopped carrot, and diced celery to the pot. Stir and cook until the vegetables are softened, about 7-10 minutes.
3. Stir in the diced potato, ground pepper, ground thyme, and ground salt. Cook for an additional 2 minutes.
4. Pour in 4 cups of chicken broth and bring to a boil.
5. Reduce heat to low and add in the chopped broccoli. Cover and cook for 10-15 minutes or until the broccoli is tender.
6. Use an immersion blender or transfer the soup to a blender to puree the soup until it is smooth and creamy.
7. Return the pureed soup back to the pot and stir in thick liquid chicken until heated through.
8. Taste and adjust seasoning as necessary.
9. Serve hot and enjoy!
0049525d87:
1. Begin by preparing all the ingredients. Peel and chop the onion, peel and dice the tomato, mince the garlic and parsley, clean the seafood and cut the steaks into small pieces.
2. In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat some oil over medium-high heat.
3. Add the sliced onion and sauté until softened and slightly browned.
4. Add the minced garlic and cook until fragrant.
5. Add the diced tomato and stir to combine.
6. Add the diced steaks rib and the seafood (crabmeat, squid, mussel, lobster, clam, and red snapper) to the pot.
7. Pour in enough water to cover the ingredients by about 1-2 inches.
8. Add some salt to taste and bring the soup to a boil.
9. Reduce the heat to medium-low and let the soup simmer for about 30-40 minutes, or until the seafood is cooked through and the meat is tender.
10. Taste the soup and adjust the seasoning as needed. You can add more salt, pepper, or tabasco sauce if desired.
11. Ladle the soup into bowls and garnish with minced parsley.
12. Serve hot with some crusty bread or crackers on the side. Enjoy!
02be893da5:
1. In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat 2 tablespoons of liquid oil over medium heat.
2. Add 1 chopped onion and 1 sliced leek, and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.
3. Add 1 ounce of dried mushroom, 1 tablespoon of minced garlic, and 1 tablespoon of minced ginger, and stir for 1 minute.
4. Add sliced carrots, sliced parsnips, and halved rib to the pot, and continue to cook until the vegetables are slightly softened, about 10 minutes.
5. Add 1 dried chili, 1 teaspoon of minced thyme, and 2 bay leaves, and cook for another minute.
6. Add 6 cups of thick liquid stock to the pot and bring to a boil.
7. Reduce heat to simmer and add 1 cup of dried noodles and shredded chicken.
8. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes or until the noodles are cooked through.
9. Stir in 1 tablespoon of soy sauce and 1/2 teaspoon of ground pepper, and adjust the seasoning to taste.
10. Serve hot, with chopped parsley on top.
01d01beb0c:
1. Heat a large pot over medium-high heat. Add the chicken pieces and cook until browned on all sides.
2. Remove the chicken from the pot and set it aside.
3. Add the halved onion, crushed garlic, and bay leaves to the pot. Cook for 2-3 minutes or until the onion is translucent.
4. Add the chopped rib, peeled carrot, and ground pepper. Stir to combine and cook for another 3-4 minutes.
5. Add the thick liquid stock to the pot and stir to combine. Bring the mixture to a boil.
6. Reduce the heat to low and let simmer for 30-40 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.
7. While the soup is simmering, prepare the baked noodle according to the package instructions.
8. Once the chicken is cooked through, remove it from the pot and shred it using a fork.
9. Return the shredded chicken to the pot and stir to combine.
10. Add the sliced scallion, chopped parsley, chopped dill, and minced lemon to the pot. Stir to combine.
11. Serve the soup hot with a few spoonfuls of baked noodle on top. Enjoy!
0257505310:
1. Rinse the meat spare rib well and set aside.
2. In a large pot or Dutch oven, sauté the chopped onion and garlic until fragrant.
3. Add the meat spare rib to the pot, and brown over medium-high heat.
4. Add 7 cups of water and bring to a boil.
5. Reduce heat, and simmer for about an hour, or until the spare rib is tender.
6. Add the whole pea to the pot and continue to simmer for another 30 minutes.
7. Meanwhile, chop the cabbage into small wedges and rinse well.
8. Add the chopped cabbage to the pot and cook for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
9. Taste and add salt and pepper as needed.
10. Serve hot, enjoining the whole pea, meat spare rib and tasty cabbage vegetable soup.
02627458b6:
1. Soak the dried mushroom in 1 cup of water for at least 30 minutes until they become plump.
2. In a large pot, heat 2 tbsp of liquid oil and add 1 diced whole onion.
3. Sauté the onion for 2-3 minutes until it becomes translucent.
4. Add 1 tbsp of ground butter and let it melt.
5. Add 1 sliced whole parsnip and 1 chopped rib to the pot and cook for about 5 minutes.
6. Peel and crush 2-3 cloves of garlic and add them to the pot.
7. Stir in the soaked dried mushroom along with the soaking water.
8. Fill the pot with enough water to cover the ingredients by about 2 inches above, and bring to a boil over high heat.
9. Lower the heat, cover the pot, and let it simmer for about 20-25 minutes until the vegetables are tender.
10. Remove the pot from the heat, and using an immersion blender, blend the soup until it is smooth and creamy.
11. Add 1 tsp of ground garlic and 1 tbsp of chopped walnuts to the soup and mix well.
12. Add salt and pepper to taste.
13. Garnish the soup with minced fresh parsley, and swirl in 1 tbsp of creamy butter.
14. Serve hot and enjoy!
005c236d80:
1. Start by chopping one onion and three cloves of garlic.
2. Heat a large pot over medium heat with 1 tablespoon of liquid oil.
3. Add the chopped onion and garlic and sauté until the onion is translucent, about 5 minutes.
4. While the onion and garlic cook, peel one whole potato and dice it into small cubes.
5. When the onion and garlic are done, add the diced potato to the pot and stir well.
6. Add 1/2 cup of dried peas to the pot and stir again.
7. Pour 8 cups of water over the mixture and bring it to a boil.
8. Reduce the heat to low and cover the pot. Allow it to simmer for about 45 minutes or until the peas and potatoes are tender.
9. While the soup cooks, add 1/2 cup of baked peas to a blender and pulse until a fine powder forms.
10. Add the powdered baked peas and 1 tablespoon of ground broth to the soup and stir well.
11. Cook the soup for another 10 minutes to let the flavors meld together.
12. Turn off the heat and let the soup cool for a few minutes. 
13. Use an immersion blender or transfer the soup to a blender and blend until smooth.
14. Serve hot and enjoy!
016c56a982:
1. Begin by heating a large pot on the stove on medium heat.
2. Add the liquid oil into the pot and let it heat up for about 1 minute.
3. Now add the diced pepper to the pot and stir it around for 3-5 minutes until it becomes soft.
4. Add the can of whole kernel corn into the pot with the pepper and stir it around to mix it in with the pepper.
5. Let the corn and pepper cook together for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
6. Pour the 2 cups of liquid milk into the pot and stir it in with the corn and pepper.
7. Turn the stove heat down to low and cover the pot with a lid.
8. Let the soup simmer for about 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until it thickens up and the flavors meld together nicely.
9. Once the soup is done, turn off the heat and let it cool down a bit before serving.
10. Serve hot and enjoy!
0454e2c169:
1. Begin by heating a large pot on medium heat.
2. Add the processed meat ham and pieces ham to the pot, and cook until lightly browned.
3. Next, add the chopped onion and sliced carrot to the pot and cook until onion is translucent and carrot is slightly tender.
4. Add the chopped rib, diced potato, grain barley, chopped tomato, chopped parsley, solid beef, and ground pepper to the pot.
5. Add enough thick liquid broth to cover all the ingredients in the pot and bring to a boil.
6. Reduce heat to low and let the soup simmer for about 30 minutes or until the vegetables are tender and the barley is cooked.
7. Add the second amount of thick liquid broth and the bean bean to the pot and bring back to a simmer.
8. Simmer for an additional 10-15 minutes, or until the beans are tender and the soup has thickened to your desired consistency.
9. Finally, remove from heat and let the soup cool slightly before serving. Adjust seasoning with additional salt and pepper as per your taste. Enjoy your soup.
013e0041b6:
1. Heat the liquid oil in a large pot over medium heat.
2. Add the chopped onion and minced garlic to the pot and sautee until they become soft and translucent, stirring occasionally.
3. Add the ground seed, ground dill, and ground oregano to the pot and stir well to combine with the onions and garlic.
4. Add the ground flour to the pot and stir continuously for about a minute to make a roux.
5. Add the crushed tomato and chopped tomato to the pot and stir well to combine with the roux and spices.
6. Pour in the thick liquid broth and stir to combine all the ingredients.
7. Add ground salt and ground pepper to taste.
8. Bring the soup to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 20 minutes until the flavors are well combined.
9. Once the soup is done, stir in liquid cream and ground parsley.
10. Finally, add a few spoons of thick sauce honey to taste, and stir well to combine.
11. Serve the soup hot with bread or crackers on the side. Enjoy!
0698fe1841:
1. Heat the liquid oil in a large pot over medium heat.
2. Add the minced onion, diced celery, and diced carrot to the pot. Cook them until they soften, stirring frequently, for approximately 5 minutes.
3. Add the thick liquid broth and 1 can of bean bean to the pot. Bring everything to a simmer.
4. Add the baked seed, ground pepper, and ground salt to the pot. Stir everything together.
5. Let the soup simmer for 15-20 minutes or until everything is tender.
6. When ready to serve, chop the baked egg, chopped onion, and chopped coriander.
7. Ladle the soup into bowls.
8. Top each bowl of soup with some chopped baked egg, chopped onion, and chopped coriander.
9. Serve the soup hot and enjoy!
036986cd4c:
1. In a large pot, bring a mixture of thick liquid broth and liquid water to a boil. Use about 4 cups of each.
2. Add a cup of peeled, sliced carrots to the pot and let them simmer for about 10 minutes.
3. While the carrots are cooking, peel and chop 2 cloves of garlic and set them aside.
4. Once the carrots are fork-tender, add the chopped garlic to the pot and stir well.
5. In a separate pan, bake a package of noodles according to the package instructions. Once they are browned and crispy, set them aside.
6. Add a teaspoon of ground pepper to the soup pot and stir well.
7. Finally, stir in about a cup of coconut sauce into the soup pot and let it simmer for a few minutes.
8. To serve, ladle the soup into bowls and top with a handful of baked noodles. Enjoy your delicious carrot and coconut soup!
0554604f54:
1. Heat a large pot over medium-high heat and add in 1 tablespoon of liquid oil.
2. Once the oil is hot, add in 1 cup of diced sausage and cook until browned on all sides.
3. Add in 1 cup of chopped onion and cook until translucent.
4. Pour in 3 cups of thick liquid broth and 2 cups of liquid water to the pot.
5. Add in two cans of bean beans and stir to combine.
6. Add in 1 cup of diced tomato and 1 cup of diced potato to the pot.
7. Peel and slice 1 carrot and add it to the pot as well.
8. Sprinkle in 1 teaspoon of dried oregano and stir to combine everything.
9. Reduce the heat to low and let the soup simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
10. Serve hot and enjoy!
0675e10524:
1. First, heat a saucepan or pot over medium heat on the stove.
2. Add a tablespoon of softened butter to the pot and let it melt.
3. Once the butter has melted, add the chopped onion and cook until the onion becomes translucent.
4. Add a teaspoon each of ground paprika and ground pepper to the pot and stir well.
5. Add in diced beef meat and cook until the meat is browned on all sides.
6. Pour in enough liquid water to cover the meat and bring it to a boil.
7. Add in diced carrot and whole veg potato to the pot, stir well and let it cook for about 20 minutes or until the vegetables are tender.
8. Add in a pinch of ground seed (such as cumin or coriander) for added flavor.
9. Remove the pot from heat, let it cool for a few minutes, and then serve hot, garnished with your choice of herbs or spices. Enjoy your delicious beef vegetable soup!
05f967a85e:
1. Start by peeling and dicing one whole onion.
2. In a large pot, heat 1/4 cup of liquid oil and 2 tablespoons of softened margarine over medium heat.
3. Add the diced onion to the pot and sauté until it becomes translucent.
4. Peel and dice one whole potato and add it to the pot. Stir to combine.
5. Add 1 teaspoon of ground cumin, 1 teaspoon of ground salt, and 1/2 teaspoon of ground pepper to the pot. Stir to combine.
6. Dice one fresh tomato and add it to the pot along with one can of drained chickpeas.
7. Add 2 cloves of minced garlic to the pot and stir to combine.
8. Pour in 4 cups of thick liquid stock and 1/4 cup of liquid vinegar to the pot. Stir to combine.
9. Add one whole chipotle chile to the pot and bring the soup to a boil.
10. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
11. Remove the chipotle chile from the pot and discard it.
12. Use an immersion blender or transfer the soup to a blender to puree until smooth.
13. If the soup is too thick, add 1/2 cup of ground water to thin it out.
14. Serve hot and enjoy!
035548cdf7:
1. Heat a large pot over medium heat and add in 2-3 tablespoons of liquid oil. 
2. Chop 1 whole onion and add it to the pot. Stir and cook until the onion begins to soften, about 3-5 minutes. 
3. Slice 3-4 stalks of celery and chop 1 whole carrot. Add them to the pot and stir. 
4. Add in 2-3 cloves of minced garlic and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes. 
5. Pour 6-8 cups of thick liquid stock (chicken or vegetable) into the pot and stir to combine. 
6. Add in 1-2 cups of shredded baked chicken, 1 teaspoon of dried thyme, and 1 teaspoon of dried basil. Stir well. 
7. Add in 1 cup of creamy tortellini and 1 can of whole kernel corn (drained). Stir and let simmer until the tortellini is cooked through. 
8. Chop 1 whole tomato and add it to the pot along with 1 cup of chopped spinach. Stir and let cook for another 5-10 minutes.
