9. Season with dried pepper to taste. 
10. Serve hot with freshly grated parmesan cheese on top. Enjoy!
03855b6179:
1. Gather all ingredients: whole tomato, whole carrot, whole onion, liquid oil, thick liquid broth, ground bouillon, and ground pepper.
2. Rinse the whole tomato and cut it into small pieces.
3. Peel the whole carrot and cut it into small pieces.
4. Peel the whole onion and cut it into small pieces.
5. Heat up a pot on medium-high heat with 2 tablespoons of liquid oil.
6. Add the cut-up tomato, carrot, and onion into the pot and stir occasionally. Cook for about 5 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
7. Add 4 cups of thick liquid broth and 1 tablespoon of ground bouillon into the pot. Stir well.
8. Simmer the soup for 20 minutes, or until the vegetables are fully cooked and the broth is well infused with flavors.
9. Add 1 tablespoon of ground pepper and stir well.
10. Serve hot and enjoy your delicious homemade tomato, carrot, and onion soup!
01671c6cc2:
1. Begin by preparing your ingredients. Peel and chop one large onion, wash and chop half a head of cabbage, peel and slice one large carrot and one stalk of celery, and dice one large potato. Set aside these vegetables.
2. Cut 1 lb of beef into small, bite-sized cubes. Brown the beef in a large pot over medium-high heat until it is cooked through. Remove it from the pot and set it aside.
3. In the same pot, sauté the onion until it is translucent. Add the cabbage, carrots, and celery and continue to sauté for 5-7 minutes or until the vegetables are slightly softened.
4. Add the beef back to the pot with the vegetables. Pour in 4 cups of water and bring the mixture to a boil.
5. Reduce the heat to a simmer, add one packet of dried jus mix, and stir until the jus has dissolved.
6. Add the diced potato to the pot and season with 1 tsp of salt, 1 tsp of ground pepper, and 1 tsp of ground garlic.
7. Cover the pot and continue to simmer for 20-30 minutes or until the potatoes are tender.
8. Once the potatoes are cooked, add 1/4 cup of thick sauce ketchup and stir.
9. Taste the soup and adjust the seasoning as needed.
10. Serve the soup hot with crusty bread or crackers. Enjoy!
044b6c2716:
1. Start by heating up the liquid oil in a large pot over medium heat.
2. Add the chopped onion and minced garlic to the pot and cook until the onion is soft and translucent.
3. Add the chopped zucchini, chopped carrot, chopped cauliflower, and chopped tomato to the pot. Stir everything together and let it cook for a few minutes.
4. Pour in the thick liquid broth and add ground seasoning to taste. Stir well and let everything simmer for about 15-20 minutes, until the vegetables are cooked through.
5. While the soup is simmering, add the baked barley and baked chicken to the pot. Stir everything together and let the soup cook for a few more minutes.
6. Once everything is heated through and the vegetables are cooked to your liking, your soup is ready to serve.
7. Ladle the soup into bowls and enjoy!
0552e07183:
1. Begin by preparing all the ingredients. Cut the chicken into small pieces, wash and cut the celery into small pieces, dice the leek and carrots, and wash the parsley leaves.
2. In a large pot or Dutch oven, melt the butter over medium heat.
3. Once the butter has melted, add the chicken pieces to the pot along with the ground salt and ground pepper. Cook for 5-7 minutes, until the chicken is browned on all sides.
4. Remove the chicken from the pot and set it aside.
5. Add the diced celery, leek, and carrots to the pot. Stir well to combine with the remaining butter in the pot. Cook for 5 minutes or until the vegetables have softened.
6. Add the parsley leaves, minced thyme, and bay leaf to the pot. Cook for 1 minute or until fragrant.
7. Return the chicken pieces to the pot and add the meat broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and let it simmer for 20 minutes.
8. Add the grain rice to the pot and stir well. Let the soup simmer for an additional 20-25 minutes or until the rice is cooked.
9. Taste the soup and adjust the seasoning as needed. Serve hot and garnish with additional parsley leaves, if desired. Enjoy!
0383ac8517:
1. Begin by boiling approximately 4-6 cups of water in a pot on medium heat.
2. Add 1-2 tablespoons of dried onion to the pot and stir well.
3. Gradually sprinkle 2-3 tablespoons of ground cornstarch into the pot while stirring.
4. Add 2-3 teaspoons of ground bouillon to the mixture and stir well. Make sure there are no clumps of cornstarch left in the soup.
5. Add 1 tablespoon of dried basil and 1 tablespoon of dried thyme to the soup.
6. Season the soup with ground pepper to taste. Stir the soup well.
7. Reduce the heat and allow the soup to simmer for approximately 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
8. Serve the soup hot and enjoy! You can also garnish with fresh herbs or croutons if desired.
048834ba28:
1. Begin by washing and cutting one large tomato, one large onion, one bell pepper, and two stalks of celery.
2. In a large pot, melt two tablespoons of creamy margarine over medium heat.
3. Add the chopped onion to the pot and cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring frequently.
4. Next, add the chopped pepper and celery to the pot and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes.
5. Add the chopped tomato to the pot, along with 1 teaspoon of ground sugar and a pinch of ground salt.
6. Cook the mixture for 5-7 minutes over medium heat, until the vegetables have softened and the tomato has broken down.
7. Sprinkle 2 tablespoons of ground flour over the vegetables and stir well to combine.
8. Pour in 4 cups of water and stir well to incorporate the flour.
9. Bring the soup to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the soup has thickened and the vegetables are very tender.
10. Serve hot, garnished with fresh herbs or croutons if desired.
00e5dda660:
1. Place the thick liquid broth in a large pot and bring to a simmer over medium heat.
2. Add the oyster sauce and minced ginger to the broth, stirring to mix well.
3. In a separate small bowl, mix the cornstarch with a small amount of cold water to make a thick paste.
4. Slowly add the cornstarch paste to the broth, stirring continuously until the soup thickens.
5. Add the baked crabmeat to the soup and stir to combine.
6. Pour in the liquid wine and mix well.
7. Slowly pour in the whipped egg, stirring continuously until it is fully incorporated into the soup.
8. Top with shredded onion and serve hot.
Enjoy your delicious soup with thick liquid broth, oyster sauce, minced ginger, thick sauce cornstarch, baked crabmeat, liquid wine, whipped egg, and shredded onion!
00181ba854:
1. Begin by preparing the vegetables. Peel and slice one large carrot, chop one small onion, and slice two stalks of celery. 
2. In a large pot, add one pound of ground round and cook it over medium-high heat until it is browned. 
3. Remove the meat from the pot and set it aside. 
4. Add the chopped onion to the pot and sauté until it is translucent. 
5. Return the meat to the pot and add in the sliced celery and sliced carrot. 
6. Pour in eight cups of liquid water and one can of meat consommé. 
7. Add in one cup of chopped cabbage, one can of diced tomatoes, and one teaspoon each of dried dill, oregano, and basil. 
8. Bring the soup to a boil and then reduce heat to a simmer. 
9. Stir in one cup of uncooked rice and let the soup simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the rice is fully cooked. 
10. Season the soup with ground pepper to taste. 
11. Serve hot and enjoy!
01dac09429:
1. Start by heating a large pot over medium heat.
2. Add 2 tablespoons of liquid oil and allow it to heat up.
3. Once the oil is hot, add in 1 chopped onion and 3 cloves of minced garlic. Sauté this for 2-3 minutes until the onion becomes translucent.
4. Now, add in 1 chopped carrot and 1 chopped rib and fry for 2-3 minutes until they begin to soften.
5. Pour in 1 can of thick sauce tomato and mix everything to combine.
6. Add 1 teaspoon of ground chili, 1 teaspoon of dried basil, 1 teaspoon of dried oregano, and 1/2 teaspoon of ground pepper. Mix thoroughly.
7. Next, pour in 1 can of crushed tomato and 4 cups of thick liquid broth. Mix well and bring everything to a boil.
8. Once the soup is boiling, reduce the heat and allow it to simmer for 15-20 minutes.
9. Now, add in 1 cup of chopped cabbage and mix everything. Allow the cabbage to cook for 5-7 more minutes.
10. Serve hot and enjoy the delicious soup!
03f9597e33:
1. Begin by heating a large pot on medium heat. 
2. Add 2 tablespoons of liquid butter and 1 tablespoon of liquid oil to the pot. 
3. Once the butter is melted, add 1 tablespoon of minced garlic, 1 chopped onion, and 2 chopped celery stalks to the pot. 
4. Sauté the garlic, onions, and celery until they become soft and translucent. 
5. Add 2 tablespoons of softened butter to the pot and stir until melted. 
6. Sprinkle 2 tablespoons of ground flour over the mixture and stir until combined. 
7. Add 1 pound of ground chicken to the pot and stir until fully cooked. 
8. Add 1 tablespoon of ground dill, 1 tablespoon of ground curry, 1 teaspoon of ground pepper, and 1 teaspoon of ground salt. Stir to combine. 
9. Pour in 4 cups of thick liquid broth and 2 cups of liquid milk. Stir until fully incorporated. 
10. Add 2 cups of mashed squash to the pot and stir until fully combined. 
11. Bring the mixture to a simmer, stirring occasionally. Allow the soup to simmer for 15 minutes. 
12. While the soup is simmering, preheat your oven to 350°F. 
13. Slice 4 pieces of bread and place them on a baking sheet. 
14. Drizzle each slice with liquid oil and sprinkle with ground salt and ground pepper. 
15. Place the baking sheet in the oven and bake for 8-10 minutes or until the bread is toasted and golden brown. 
16. Once the soup has finished simmering, taste and adjust seasoning as needed. 
17. Serve the soup in bowls and top each with a slice of toasted bread. Enjoy!
017c4a8e06:
1. Melt a generous amount of creamy butter in a pot over medium heat.
2. Add your preferred thick liquid broth and let it simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
3. While the broth is simmering, slice your bread into small cubes or croutons and set aside.
4. Once the broth is done simmering, lower the heat and add the shredded mozzarella into the pot.
5. Stir the cheese into the broth until fully melted and combined.
6. In a separate pan, toast the bread cubes or croutons until they are crispy and golden brown.
7. Ladle the creamy soup into serving bowls, then top with the crispy bread cubes or croutons.
8. Serve immediately and enjoy!
064a6e31b5:
1. Preheat a pot over medium heat and add the crushed garlic. Sauté for a minute or until fragrant.
2. Add the ground curry and stir for 30 seconds until it's well combined with the garlic.
3. Add the chopped parsley, ground coriander, creamy mayonnaise, and 1/2 cup of creamy cream to the pot. Stir well.
4. Cut the avocado in half and remove the seed. Slice it into small chunks and add them to the pot.
5. Pour in 2 cups of thick liquid broth and bring everything to a boil.
6. Reduce the heat to low and let the soup simmer for 10-15 minutes, or until the avocado is cooked and tender.
7. Add 1 tablespoon of Tabasco sauce and 1/4 teaspoon of ground pepper. Taste and adjust the seasoning as needed.
8. Serve the soup hot and garnish with additional chopped parsley and a drizzle of creamy cream if desired. Enjoy your delicious avocado soup!
044f04e207:
1. Heat a large pot over medium-high heat, then add 2 tablespoons of liquid oil and let it warm up for about 1 minute.
2. Add 1 cup of chopped onion and 1 tablespoon of minced garlic to the pot and cook them for 3-4 minutes, or until soft and fragrant.
3. Add 1/4 cup of ground butter to the pot and stir it into the onions and garlic.
4. Sprinkle 1/4 cup of ground flour into the pot and whisk until it forms a paste-like consistency.
5. Slowly pour in 4 cups of whole milk, whisking continuously to prevent clumps from forming.
6. Add 1 teaspoon of ground salt and 1/2 teaspoon of ground black pepper to the pot and stir to combine.
7. Bring the soup to a gentle simmer and allow it to cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
8. Add 6 cups of whole leafy spinach to the pot and let it cook for an additional 5-7 minutes, or until the spinach has wilted and is tender.
9. Using an immersion blender or a regular blender, blend the soup until it is smooth and creamy.
10. Taste the soup and adjust the seasoning as needed with additional salt and pepper.
11. Serve the soup hot and garnish with a sprinkle of ground black pepper. Enjoy!
0317dd7772:
1. Heat up 2 tablespoons of liquid oil in a large pot or soup pot on medium-high heat.
2. Add 2 teaspoons of minced garlic to the pot and stir it for 1-2 minutes until it turns golden brown in color.
3. Pour in 4 cups of thick liquid broth and 1 cup of liquid water into the pot and stir it well.
4. Add 1/2 cup of thick sauce salsa to the mixture and stir it until the salsa is dissolved.
5. Cut 2 cups of baked chicken into small pieces and add them to the pot. Stir everything together.
6. Drain 1 can of whole corn and add the corn to the soup pot.
7. Add 1 cup of pieces of chip to the pot and stir everything together.
8. Add 1/4 cup of sauce hot sauce to the soup for added spice (optional).
9. Let the soup simmer on low heat for about 15-20 minutes.
10. Serve the soup in bowls and add a handful of shredded cheese on top of each bowl. Enjoy!
05abaa58fc:
1. Pour 4 cups of liquid water into a large pot and bring it to a boil over high heat.
2. Add 1 cup of chopped celery and 1 cup of chopped onion to the pot and stir to combine.
3. Allow the vegetables to cook for 5-7 minutes or until they are tender.
4. Add 1 cup of grain seed to the pot and stir to combine.
5. Pour in 2 cups of liquid buttermilk and stir the mixture well.
6. Turn the heat down to medium-low and allow the soup to simmer for an additional 10-15 minutes or until the grain seed is tender and fully cooked.
7. Taste the soup and season with salt and pepper as needed.
8. Serve hot and enjoy your quick and healthy soup!
048fd6803b:
1. Heat a large pot on medium-high heat and add 1 tablespoon of liquid oil. 
2. Once the oil is hot, add 1/2 cup of chopped onion and sauté until translucent. 
3. Add 2 cloves of minced garlic and sauté for another minute. 
4. Next, add 1 cup of chopped celery and sauté for 2-3 minutes until slightly softened. 
5. Dice 1 whole vegetable tomato and add it to the pot. Stir everything together and let it cook for 2-3 minutes. 
6. Pour in 4 cups of thick liquid stock (such as chicken or vegetable) and bring the soup to a boil. 
7. Once the soup is boiling, reduce heat to a simmer and let it cook for 10-15 minutes until the vegetables are tender. 
8. Lastly, add 1/4 cup of chopped fresh parsley leaves to the soup and stir everything together. 
9. Serve hot and enjoy your delicious and hearty soup!
0697a34172:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Cut one large head of broccoli into small florets.
3. Toss the broccoli florets in 1 tablespoon of olive oil and spread them out on a baking sheet.
4. Sprinkle with a pinch of salt and bake for 20-25 minutes or until tender and slightly browned.
5. In a pot, add 3 cups of thick liquid broth (such as chicken, vegetable, or beef broth) and bring to a simmer.
6. Add the baked broccoli to the pot once it's done baking.
7. Use an immersion blender or transfer the soup to a blender and blend until smooth.
8. Add 1 cup of heavy cream and stir until combined.
9. Season with freshly ground pepper to taste.
10. Serve hot and enjoy!
00baf5904b:
1. Take a pot and heat up a small amount of liquid oil in it.
2. Add in minced garlic and sauté it until the garlic turns golden-brown; do not let it burn.
3. Once garlic is sautéed, pour in the liquid broth and liquid water into the pot.
4. Add enough ground salt to taste and stir the mixture well to evenly distribute the salt.
5. Cover the pot with a lid and bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat.
6. Once boiling, reduce the heat to low and let the mixture simmer for about 10 minutes. This will allow the flavors to amalgamate and blend together to make a fragrant broth.
7. Once the broth has simmered, remove the pot from the stove and let it cool a little.
8. As the soup cools, add liquid soy sauce and liquid vinegar to taste. Keep stirring the broth to ensure all flavors are well mixed.
9. Return the pot to the stove and let the soup simmer for a few more minutes.
10. Once done simmering, turn off the heat and let the soup sit for a few minutes before serving it hot. Enjoy your thick and savory broth with your favorite garnish!
05fa36e53b:
1. In a large pot or Dutch oven, melt 1/2 cup of softened butter over medium heat.
2. Add 1/2 cup of minced onion to the melted butter and sauté until the onion is soft and translucent.
3. Add 8 oz. of sliced mushrooms to the pot and continue to sauté until the mushrooms are tender and slightly browned.
4. Add 1 lb. of diced chicken to the pot and cook until it is no longer pink.
5. Sprinkle in 1/4 cup of ground flour and stir to combine. Cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly.
6. Gradually pour in 6 cups of thick liquid broth, stirring constantly, until the soup starts to thicken.
7. Add 1 cup of grain rice, 1 tsp. of ground salt, and 1/2 cup of grated carrot to the pot. Stir to combine.
8. Add 1/2 cup of peeled almond, 1 cup of liquid half and half, and 1/4 cup of dried dry sherry to the pot. Stir to combine.
9. Bring the soup to a simmer and let it cook for 20-25 minutes until the rice is tender.
10. Stir in 1/4 cup of minced parsley and let the soup simmer for an additional 5 minutes.
11. Serve hot with bread or crackers on the side. Enjoy!
04286f3218:
1. Preheat a large pot over medium heat and spray it with the oily cooking spray.
2. Add the chopped onion and minced garlic to the pot and stir them around for 2 to 3 minutes until they're both fragrant.
3. Pour in the diced tomatoes with their juice, black beans and cumin into the pot and stir it all together.
4. Add the liquid oil, thick liquid broth, and liquid vinegar, then stir it all in.
5. Use a sharp knife to cut off the top of the pumpkin and hollow it out, saving the pumpkin meat.
6. Dice the pumpkin meat into small pieces and add it to the pot.
7. Finally, add the dried dry sherry, ground pepper, and grain seed to the pot and let it simmer, stirring occasionally, for about 30 minutes until the pumpkin is cooked through.
8. When you're ready to serve, ladle the soup into bowls and top each serving with some queso fresco crumbs and sliced onion.
9. Enjoy your delicious and healthy tomato and bean soup with pumpkin!
033e809e25:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a 9-inch (23 cm) cake pan with a little bit of oil.
2. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the ground sugar and eggs until well beaten.
3. Add the liquid oil and liquid extract to the bowl and mix well.
4. Sift the ground flour, ground cocoa, and ground baking powder into the bowl and mix until smooth.
5. Gradually stir in the liquid water until the batter is smooth and fully combined.
6. Pour the batter into the greased cake pan.
7. Place the cake in the preheated oven and bake for about 40-45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
8. Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool to room temperature.
9. Once the cake has cooled, you can decorate it with frosting, sprinkles, or other toppings of your choice.
10. Cut the cake into slices and serve. Enjoy your delicious and moist homemade cake made with whole egg, ground sugar, ground flour, liquid oil, liquid water, ground baking powder, liquid extract, and ground cocoa!
042ddf7362:
1. Preheat your oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
2. In a large bowl, cream together the creamy shortening and creamy margarine until light and fluffy.
3. Slowly add the ground sugar to the bowl, continuing to mix until well combined.
4. Add the whole eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
5. Stir in the liquid extract.
6. Gradually add the ground flour to the bowl, alternating with the liquid milk, until a smooth batter forms.
7. Gently fold in the flakes coconut into the batter.
8. Grease a 9x13 inch baking pan with non-stick spray.
9. Pour the batter into the baking pan and smooth out the surface with a spatula.
10. Bake the cake in the preheated oven for 45-50 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
11. Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool completely in the baking pan.
12. Once cooled, cut and serve the cake as desired.
Enjoy your delicious homemade cake with whole egg, creamy shortening, creamy margarine, ground sugar, liquid extract, ground flour, liquid milk, and flakes coconut!
019d521bfa:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F.
2. Take an uncooked pie crust and lay it in a round cake pan.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine 2 cups of ground flour, 1 cup of ground sugar, and 2 tablespoons of ground cocoa. Mix well until all ingredients are combined.
4. Add 1 teaspoon of ground baking powder to the flour mixture and mix well.
5. In a separate mixing bowl, beat 1 whole egg with 1 teaspoon of liquid extract until light and fluffy.
6. Add 1/2 cup of creamy butter and beat until the mixture is smooth and creamy.
7. Slowly pour the egg and butter mixture into the dry ingredients, stirring continuously.
8. Add 1/2 cup of liquid milk and continue to stir until all ingredients are well combined.
9. Pour the cake batter into the prepared pie crust.
10. Bake for 45-50 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
11. Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool completely on a wire rack.
12. Once it has cooled, decorate the cake with your desired toppings and serve. Enjoy your delicious cake made with ground sugar, ground cocoa, liquid water, liquid extract, uncooked pie crust, ground flour, ground baking powder, ground sugar, creamy butter, liquid extract, whole egg, and liquid milk!
0687ddf293:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C) and prepare a greased 9-inch cake pan.
2. In a medium mixing bowl, combine the ground flour, ground cornstarch, baking powder, and salt. Set aside.
3. In a large mixing bowl, cream the unsalted butter and granulated sugar together until light and fluffy.
4. Add the eggs, one at a time, and mix well after each addition.
5. Mix in the vanilla extract.
6. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, alternating with the milk, until just combined.
7. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan and smooth out the surface with a spatula.
8. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
9. Allow the cake to cool completely before frosting or decorating as desired.
10. Serve and enjoy your delicious cake made with ground flour and ground cornstarch!
010a80ffc6:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F/180°C.
2. Grease a 9-inch round cake pan with butter and dust it with flour.
3. In a mixing bowl, cream 1 cup of creamy butter and 1 ½ cups of ground sugar until light and fluffy.
4. Add 2 large whole eggs, one at a time, and beat until blended.
5. In a separate bowl, combine 2 ¼ cups of ground flour, 1 ¼ teaspoons of ground baking soda, and ¼ teaspoon of ground salt.
6. Gradually add the flour mixture to the butter mixture, alternating with 1 cup of liquid buttermilk and beating well after each addition.
7. Fold in 2 tablespoons of minced lemon zest and 1 cup of fresh blueberries.
8. Pour the batter into the prepared pan and smooth the top with a spatula.
9. Sprinkle 1-2 tablespoons of ground sugar over the top of the cake.
10. Bake for 40-45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
11. Let the cake cool in the pan for 10 minutes before removing it to a wire rack to cool completely.
12. Serve the cake garnished with additional blueberries and a dollop of whipped cream, if desired.
020d66e26e:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Cut the peeled potato into small cubes and boil them until they are soft. Then, mash the boiled potatoes.
3. Add 1 and 1/2 cups of ground sugar to the mashed potatoes.
4. Pour 1 cup of liquid butter into the mixture and beat it with an electric mixer until it is smooth.
5. Crack 2 whole eggs into the mixture and continue beating until fully incorporated.
6. Add 1 cup of creamy cream and 1 cup of liquid milk into the mixture and mix until it is well combined.
7. Gradually add in 2 and 1/2 cups of ground flour to the mixture, and mix well to form a smooth batter.
8. Grease a cake pan with butter and pour the cake mixture into the pan.
9. Bake the cake in the preheated oven for about 40-45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center of the cake comes out clean.
10. Take the cake out of the oven and let it cool in the pan for around 10 minutes.
11. Use a butter knife to loosen the edges of the cake from the pan and then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.
12. Once cooled, you can decorate the cake with your choice of frosting or toppings before serving. Enjoy your homemade potato cake!
04b6bbdae4:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the milk, vegetable oil, and eggs.
4. Pour the wet mixture into the dry mixture and stir until well combined.
5. Gradually add the baked vodka and liquid champagne to the mixture, stirring well after each addition.
6. Pour the batter into a greased 8-inch cake pan and bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
7. Let the cake cool completely before decorating it.
8. Once the cake has cooled, pour the liquid icing over the top of the cake and spread it out evenly using a spatula.
9. Decorate the cake with the pieces of candy and cherries.
10. Let the icing set for at least 10 minutes before serving.
11. Enjoy your delicious and boozy cake!
042c2874b8:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C) and prepare a 9-inch (23cm) cake pan by greasing it with butter and dusting it with flour.
2. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the whipped egg, liquid milk, and liquid water until well combined.
3. Add the creamy butter to the mixing bowl and continue whisking until fully incorporated.
4. In a separate bowl, mix together the ground flour, ground sugar, ground salt, and ground yeast.
5. Gradually add the flour mixture to the wet ingredients, stirring until a smooth batter forms.
6. Fold in the sliced apple, ground cinnamon, and minced nutmeg until evenly distributed throughout the batter.
7. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan and smooth out the surface.
8. Sprinkle the top of the batter with a layer of ground sugar and place in the oven.
9. Bake for approximately 35-40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
10. Remove the cake from the oven and allow it to cool for 10 minutes.
11. Using a knife or spatula, carefully loosen the sides of the cake from the pan and transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.
12. Serve with your choice of glaze or frosting, if desired. Enjoy!
067e9bc877:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). 
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream together 1 ½ cups of creamy shortening and 2 cups of ground sugar until the mixture becomes light and fluffy. 
3. Beat in 2 whole eggs, one at a time, and stir in 2 teaspoons of liquid extract, such as vanilla or almond. 
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together 2 ½ cups of ground flour, 1 ½ teaspoons of ground baking soda, and 1 teaspoon of ground salt. 
5. Add the dry ingredients gradually into the wet ingredients mixture and mix the batter thoroughly. 
6. Pour in 1 cup of liquid buttermilk and stir to combine. 
7. Mix in 2 tablespoons of ground cocoa and continue stirring until there are no lumps. 
8. Add in 1 tablespoon of liquid food coloring at a time until the desired color is achieved. 
9. Finally, mix in 1 tablespoon of liquid vinegar to activate the baking soda and create a rise in the cake. 
10. Pour the batter into a greased cake pan, and smooth the top. 
11. Bake for 35-40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. 
12. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes before removing it and cooling it completely on a wire rack. 
13. Decorate the cake as desired and serve. Enjoy your colorful and delicious cake!
01f5cccf3c:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F. Grease a 9x13 inch baking pan with softened butter. 
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the liquid pudding mix and 2 cups of liquid milk. Mix well until fully combined and thickened. 
3. Take one whole snack cracker and dip it into the liquid pudding mixture, making sure to coat it evenly. 
4. Place the coated snack cracker into the greased baking pan. Repeat until the bottom of the pan is fully covered with a single layer of coated snack crackers. 
5. In a separate mixing bowl, combine the whipped whipped topping, 1/4 cup of ground sugar, and 1/4 cup of solid cocoa. Mix well until fully combined. 
6. Spread a layer of the whipped topping mixture over the layer of coated snack crackers in the pan. 
7. Repeat steps 3 through 6 until you reach the desired number of layers. 
8. When you reach the final layer, cover it with the remaining whipped topping mixture, making sure to spread it evenly. 
9. In a small saucepan, combine 1/2 cup of liquid milk, 1/2 cup of thick sauce syrup, and 1 teaspoon of liquid extract. Heat the mixture over low heat, stirring constantly, until it thickens into a syrup-like consistency. 
10. Drizzle the syrup over the top of the cake, using a spoon or a piping bag. 
11. Place the cake in the preheated oven and bake for 10-15 minutes or until the whipped topping is slightly golden brown. 
12. Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool down to room temperature before slicing and serving. 
13. Enjoy your delicious and unique cake made with whole snack crackers, liquid pudding, whipped whipped topping, and chocolate syrup!
01ef4a98c8:
1. Preheat your oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
2. In a bowl, mix together 2 cups of all-purpose flour, 1 and 1/2 cups of granulated sugar, 2 teaspoons of baking powder, and 1 teaspoon of salt.
3. In another bowl, mix together 1 cup of whole milk, 1/2 cup of vegetable oil, and 2 beaten eggs.
4. Mix the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients until fully combined.
5. Add 1 teaspoon of ground lemon zest to the batter and mix well.
6. Pour the batter into a greased 9x13 inch baking pan and bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
7. Remove from oven and let cool completely.
8. Once cooled, spread a layer of whipped cool whip on top of the cake.
9. Optional: sprinkle additional ground lemon zest on top of the cool whip for extra flavor.
10. Cut into slices and serve. Enjoy!
015f775060:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C) and prepare a 9-inch (22cm) baking pan by greasing or lining with parchment paper.
2. In a medium mixing bowl, mash two ripe bananas until they are smooth and creamy.
3. Add ½ cup of softened butter to the bowl and mix well with the mashed banana using a whisk or electric mixer until fully combined.
4. Crack one whole egg into the mixture and continue whisking until the egg is fully incorporated.
5. Measure 1/4 cup of liquid water and slowly pour it into the batter, whisking continuously.
6. In a separate mixing bowl, sift 1 cup of ground flour, 1 teaspoon of ground baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon of ground baking soda and 1 teaspoon of ground cinnamon. Mix well using a whisk or fork.
7. Slowly pour the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients and mix well until no lumps remain.
8. Add 1/3 cup of chopped pecans and 1/3 cup of dried raisins into the batter and fold them in using a spatula.
9. Pour the batter into the prepared baking pan and smooth the top with the spatula.
10. Place the baking pan in the preheated oven and bake for 45-50 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center of the cake comes out clean.
11. Once done, remove the cake from the oven and allow it to cool to room temperature for about 10-15 minutes.
12. Slice and serve the cake as desired. Enjoy!
01d2fe3a01:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C) and grease a cake pan with a little butter or oil.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine 2 cups of ground flour, 1 cup of ground cocoa, 1 teaspoon of ground salt, 1 teaspoon of ground baking soda, and 1 teaspoon of ground baking powder. Mix well with a whisk or fork to ensure even distribution of the ingredients.
3. In another mixing bowl, beat 2 whole eggs and add 1 teaspoon of liquid extract (such as vanilla or almond extract) and 1 cup of ground sugar. Beat until the mixture is smooth and fluffy.
4. Add 1 cup of liquid buttermilk, 1/2 cup of liquid butter (melted), and 1/2 cup of liquid coffee to the egg mixture. Mix well.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients while stirring continuously with a spatula or wooden spoon until the batter is smooth and well combined.
6. Pour the batter into the greased cake pan and smooth the surface with a spatula.
7. Bake the cake in the preheated oven for 30-40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
8. Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool in the pan for 5-10 minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.
9. Once the cake has cooled, slice and serve with your favorite frosting or toppings. Enjoy!
024a91e06c:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. Grease a 9-inch (23cm) cake pan with butter and flour it lightly.
3. In a large bowl, beat 2 whole eggs using an electric mixer until fluffy.
4. Add 1 1/4 cups (150g) of finely chopped whole hazelnuts and mix until it is well combined.
5. Add 1 cup (200g) of granulated sugar and continue to beat until the mixture is smooth.
6. Fold in 1/2 cup (85g) of chocolate chips and 2 teaspoons of baking powder.
7. Add 1 teaspoon of liquid vanilla extract and 1/4 teaspoon of salt and mix well.
8. Then add 1/2 cup (113g) of softened butter and beat until it is fully combined.
9. Next, add 1/4 cup (50g) of granulated sugar, 1/4 cup (20g) of unsweetened cocoa powder, 1 teaspoon of liquid vanilla extract, and 2 tablespoons of freshly brewed coffee to the bowl.
10. Mix everything thoroughly until the batter is smooth and well combined.
11. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan and spread it evenly with a spatula.
12. Put the cake pan in the oven and bake it for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
13. Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool in the pan for 10 minutes.
14. Use a sharp knife to loosen the edges of the cake from the pan, and then turn it out onto a wire rack to cool completely.
15. Once the cake is cool, dust it with powdered sugar or frost it with your favorite icing. Enjoy!
02a7d738b6:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C), and lightly grease a 9-inch (23cm) cake pan.
2. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the ground flour, ground sugar, ground salt, ground oat, and ground baking powder.
3. In a separate bowl, beat the eggs well and whisk in the liquid milk and liquid oil.
4. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix well until the batter is smooth.
5. Gently fold in the blueberries until they are evenly distributed throughout the batter.
6. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan and smooth the top with a spatula.
7. Bake the cake for 35-40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
8. Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool in the pan for 10 minutes before removing it from the pan and placing it on a wire rack to cool completely.
9. Serve the blueberry cake as desired and enjoy!
03fe258010:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F and line a 9x13 inch baking dish with parchment paper or non-stick cooking spray. 
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine 2 cups of all-purpose flour, 2 teaspoons of baking powder, 1 teaspoon of baking soda, and a pinch of salt. 
3. Add one 20 oz can of crushed pineapple (undrained) and mix well. 
4. Mix in 1 cup of granulated sugar, 1/2 cup of vegetable oil, and 2 eggs (one at a time). 
5. Stir in 1 cup of shredded coconut and mix until just combined. 
6. Pour the batter into the prepared baking dish and smooth out the surface with a spatula. 
7. Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. 
8. Remove from the oven and let cool completely in the dish. 
9. Once cooled, run a spatula around the edges of the dish to loosen the cake, and carefully invert it onto a serving platter. 
10. Optional: sprinkle additional shredded coconut on top or frost with cream cheese frosting before serving. 
11. Slice and enjoy your delicious pineapple and coconut cake!
01d8e4ea02:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Grease a 9x13 inch baking pan.
3. In a bowl, combine the ground flour, ground baking powder, ground baking soda, and ground salt. Set aside.
4. In a separate large mixing bowl, cream the creamy margarine and ground sugar together.
5. Add in the mashed bananas, whole egg, and liquid vanilla. Mix until well combined.
6. Gradually add the dry ingredients into the wet mixture, alternating with the liquid buttermilk. Mix until evenly combined.
7. Pour the batter into the greased baking pan.
8. Bake for 35-40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
9. Remove the cake from the oven and allow it to cool completely before frosting.
To Make the Frosting:
1. In a mixing bowl, beat the softened cream cheese and creamy margarine together until light and fluffy.
2. Gradually add the ground sugar and mix until smooth and creamy.
3. Spread the frosting over the cooled cake.
4. Optional: Drizzle caramel or chocolate syrup on top of the frosting.
5. Serve and enjoy!
022e77f6a1:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F and grease your cake pan.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine 2 cups of ground cake with 1 cup of liquid oil and mix well.
3. Add in 1 cup of chopped walnuts, 1 halved orange (juice and zest), and 1 whole egg. Mix thoroughly.
4. Stir in 1 cup of crushed pineapple and 1 packet of creamy pie filling mix.
5. Pour the mixture into the prepared cake pan and smooth out the top with a spatula.
6. Bake the cake for 35-40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center of the cake comes out clean.
7. Once the cake is done, let it cool slightly in the pan for 5-10 minutes, then gently run a knife along the edges to loosen it from the pan.
8. Cool the cake completely on a wire rack.
9. In a separate bowl, combine 1 cup of whipped whipped topping with 1 tablespoon of grated orange and mix until well blended.
10. Once the cake has cooled, spread the whipped topping mix over the top of the cake.
11. Decorate with more chopped walnuts and orange zest if desired.
12. Serve and enjoy your delicious ground cake with whipped topping!
02f2e13a1c:
1. Preheat the oven to the specified temperature and grease a cake pan with butter.
2. Take the creamy cake mixture and add the liquid extract of your choice to it. Mix it thoroughly until the mixture is smooth and consistent.
3. Pour the creamy cake mixture into the cake pan and spread it evenly using a spatula.
4. Bake the cake in the oven as per the instructions given on the package until it turns golden brown.
5. After the cake is done, let it cool for about 10-15 minutes.
6. Once the cake has cooled down, spread a layer of jam on top of it using a knife.
7. Whip some cream until it forms soft peaks and then spread it over the jam layer.
8. Sprinkle some ground sugar over the whipped cream using a sieve.
9. Chop the chocolate into small pieces and sprinkle it on top of the ground sugar.
10. Spread a layer of creamy cream over the chocolate using a spatula.
11. Grate some solid truffle over the creamy cream layer and sprinkle some more ground sugar over it.
12. Repeat the above layers to make multiple tiers, and finish the top layer with more solid truffle, ground sugar crystal, and whipped cream. 
13. Finally, refrigerate the cake for at least an hour before serving. 
Enjoy!
02f34ea7a4:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C) and prepare a cake pan (8x8 inches or 9x9 inches) by greasing it with softened butter and dusting it with some flour. 
2. In a mixing bowl, combine 1 cup of softened butter and 1 and 1/2 cups of ground sugar. Using a hand mixer or a whisk, cream them together until the mixture turns light and fluffy. 
3. Add 2 whole eggs to the mixture and beat well until everything is incorporated. 
4. Now, add 1/4 cup of creamy cream and 1 teaspoon of liquid extract (vanilla or hazelnut) to the bowl and mix everything thoroughly. 
5. In a separate bowl, sift together 1 and 3/4 cups of ground flour, 1 teaspoon of ground baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon of ground baking soda, and 1/2 teaspoon of ground cinnamon. 
6. Slowly add the dry mixture to the wet mixture while continuously stirring it. Make sure there are no lumps in the batter. 
7. Finally, fold in 1/2 cup of chopped hazelnuts and 1/2 cup of ground brown sugar into the batter. 
8. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan and gently tap it to remove any air bubbles. 
9. Place the cake pan in the preheated oven and bake it for approximately 40-45 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center of the cake comes out clean. 
10. Once baked, let the cake cool down in the pan for about 5-10 minutes. Then, gently remove it from the pan and transfer it onto a wire rack to cool completely. 
11. Your hazelnut cake is ready to be served. Enjoy it with some whipped cream or frosting on top!
06970bd3d0:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C) and prepare a 9-inch (23cm) cake pan by greasing it with softened margarine and dusting it with ground flour.
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream together 1 cup of softened margarine and 1 cup of ground sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add in 3 thick liquid eggs, one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
4. In a separate bowl, sift together 2 cups of ground flour, 1 tbsp of ground baking powder, and 1 tsp of ground salt. Gradually add this mixture into the butter mixture, alternating with 1 cup of liquid milk, and mixing well after each addition.
5. Stir in 1 cup of ground coconut and 1 tsp of liquid extract of your choice.
6. Pour the batter into the prepared pan and bake in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
7. While the cake is baking, prepare the creamy coconut frosting. In a mixing bowl, beat together 1 cup of creamy coconut, 1 thick liquid egg, 1/2 cup of ground sugar, and 1 tsp of liquid extract until smooth and creamy. Set aside.
8. In a medium saucepan, combine 1/4 cup of thick sauce syrup, 1/4 cup of liquid water, and a pinch of ground salt. Cook over medium heat until the mixture thickens and becomes syrupy.
9. Once the cake is done, remove it from the oven and let it cool for 5 minutes before removing it from the pan and transferring it onto a wire rack to cool completely.
10. Spread the creamy coconut frosting over the cooled cake and drizzle the thick sauce syrup over the frosting. Sprinkle with ground coconut or garnish with creamy cream, if desired.
11. Slice and serve immediately, or store in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 5 days. Enjoy!
00ff265857:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) and prepare a 9-inch cake pan by greasing the bottom and sides with creamy butter.
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream together 1 1/2 cups of creamy butter and 2 cups of ground sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add in 1 whole egg and mix until fully combined.
4. Stir in 1 teaspoon of liquid vanilla extract.
5. In a separate bowl, whisk together 2 cups of ground flour, 2 teaspoons of ground baking powder, and 1/2 teaspoon of ground salt.
6. Gradually add the dry ingredients into the butter mixture, alternating with 1/2 cup of whole pineapple juice. Mix until fully combined.
7. Fold in 1 cup of chopped whole pineapple, 1/2 cup of halved pecan halves, and 1/2 cup of chopped cherries.
8. Pour the batter into the prepared pan and smooth the top with a spatula.
9. Bake in the preheated oven for 40-45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
10. Let the cake cool in the pan for 10 minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.
11. Once cooled, sprinkle the top of the cake with extra ground sugar and decorate with cherries and pecans if desired.
12. Serve and enjoy your delicious homemade pineapple cherry pecan cake!
00421bfcd3:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F.
2. Grease a 9-inch cake pan with liquid oil to ensure that the cake doesn't stick.
3. In a mixing bowl, add 1 cup sugar and 2 whole eggs. Beat them together with a whisk or an electric mixer until they're frothy.
4. Add 1 cup of liquid oil to the bowl and continue to whisk the mixture until it's well combined.
5. In the same bowl, add 1 cup of liquid coffee and mix it into the mixture.
6. Slowly add 2 cups of flour into the bowl and mix it well. Ensure that there are no chunks of flour left in the cake mix.
7. Add in 1 teaspoon of baking powder and ½ teaspoon of baking soda to the mixture and mix it well.
8. Next, add in 1 cup of chocolate chip pieces into the cake mix and give a good stir.
9. Finally, add in 1 cup of creamy cream and mix it in gently. Avoid over-beating the mixture at this point.
10. Pour the cake batter into the greased cake pan and smooth out the surface.
11. Bake the cake for about 40-45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
12. Once the cake is done, remove it from the oven and allow it to cool down completely before slicing it.
Your cake with liquid oil, creamy cream, liquid coffee, whole egg, and pieces chip is now ready to serve! Enjoy!
06c77b8c45:
1. Preheat your oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit and grease a 9-inch cake pan.
2. In a mixing bowl, cream together 1 cup of ground shortening and 1 cup of softened butter until light and fluffy.
3. Gradually add 2 cups of ground sugar to the bowl while continuing to mix.
4. Add 4 whole eggs to the mixture, one at a time, and mix well after each addition.
5. Stir in 1 tablespoon of liquid extract of your choice (vanilla, almond, etc.).
6. In a separate bowl, mix together 3 cups of ground flour, 1 teaspoon of ground baking soda, 2 teaspoons of ground baking powder, 1 teaspoon of ground salt, and 1 teaspoon of ground cinnamon.
7. Add the dry mixture to the mixing bowl in thirds, alternating with 1 cup of liquid milk each time. Mix well after each addition.
8. Pour the batter into the greased cake pan and bake in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean when inserted into the center of the cake.
9. While the cake is baking, prepare the honey sauce by combining 1/2 cup of thick sauce honey, 1/4 cup of creamy butter, 1 tablespoon of liquid extract, and 1/4 cup of liquid milk in a small saucepan.
10. Heat the saucepan over low heat, stirring frequently, until the butter is melted and the sauce is smooth.
11. Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool in the pan for 5 minutes.
12. Turn the cake out onto a wire rack to cool completely.
13. Once the cake is cool, drizzle the honey sauce over it and sprinkle with additional ground sugar if desired.
14. Slice and serve. Enjoy!
03e6356fc0:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C) and grease a 9-inch (23cm) cake pan with butter or cooking spray.
2. In a large bowl, combine 2 cups of ground cake mix, 1 cup of halved water, 1/2 cup of thick liquid egg, and 1/2 cup of liquid oil. Mix well until fully combined.
3. Add 1/4 cup of jelly lemon and 1/2 cup of blueberries to the cake batter. Stir gently to combine.
4. Pour the cake batter into the greased cake pan, smoothing out the top with a spatula.
5. In a separate bowl, beat 4 ounces of softened cheese and 1/4 cup of ground sugar together until light and fluffy.
6. Beat in 1 whole egg to the cheese mixture until fully combined.
7. Spoon the cheese mixture onto the top of the cake batter, spreading it out evenly.
8. Place the cake in the oven and bake for 35-40 minutes or until the top is golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
9. Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool for at least 15 minutes in the pan.
10. Use a knife to loosen the edges of the cake from the pan, then remove the cake from the pan and transfer it to a serving platter.
11. Slice the cake into pieces and serve. Enjoy!
006f57f687:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C) and grease a cake pan.
2. In a mixing bowl, cream together softened butter and ground sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Sift together ground flour and ground baking powder into the mixing bowl, and mix thoroughly into the creamed butter and sugar.
4. Gradually add liquid milk and whole egg to the mixture, stirring continuously until fully combined.
5. Add a pinch of ground salt and mix well.
6. Fold in chopped pecans to the cake batter.
7. In a separate bowl, combine ground sugar and ground cinnamon.
8. Cut seeded peaches into small pieces and mix them with the cinnamon sugar mixture.
9. Pour half of the cake batter into the greased pan, spread it evenly.
10. Scatter the peach mixture on top of the batter, and then pour the remaining half of the cake batter delicately over the peaches.
11. Bake the cake for approximately 45 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
12. Allow the cake to cool down in the pan for about 10 minutes before carefully removing it from the pan.
13. Brush the top of the cake with melted butter and sprinkle chopped pecans on top.
14. Serve the peach pecan cake warm or at room temperature. Enjoy!
027481646f:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. In a bowl, cream 1 cup of creamy butter and 1 cup of ground sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Grate the zest of a whole orange into the bowl and mix it thoroughly.
4. Add in 1 cup of whole fresh cranberries, 1/2 teaspoon of ground salt, 1/2 teaspoon of ground cinnamon, 1/2 teaspoon of ground garlic, and 1/2 teaspoon of grated nutmeg. Mix until well combined.
5. In a separate bowl, sift 2 cups of ground flour and 1 teaspoon of ground baking soda together.
6. Gradually add the dry mixture to the wet mixture alternately with 1/2 cup of liquid water, mixing well after each addition.
7. Fold in 1/2 cup of baked pecans.
8. Pour the batter into a greased 9-inch cake pan.
9. Bake the cake for 40-45 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
10. Let the cake cool for 10-15 minutes before removing it from the pan.
11. Sprinkle some additional ground sugar on top of the cake for added sweetness.
12. Cut the cake into slices and serve. Enjoy your delicious cake!
04236de337:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (180 degrees Celsius) and grease a 9-inch (23-centimeter) cake pan.
2. In a mixing bowl, combine 1 and 1/2 cups of ground cake and 1 cup of rolled oats. Mix well and set aside.
3. In another mixing bowl, combine 1 cup of thick liquid apricot, 1 cup of ground sugar, and 1/2 cup of liquid oil. Mix well.
4. Add 2 whole eggs to the liquid mixture and whisk until smooth and well combined.
5. Gradually mix in the dry ingredients, stirring until the batter is smooth and well combined.
6. Stir in 1/2 cup of sliced almonds and 1/2 cup of creamy caramel, mixing well.
7. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan and smooth the top with a spatula.
8. Bake the cake in the preheated oven for 40-45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
9. Remove the cake from the oven and allow it to cool in the pan for 10-15 minutes.
10. Gently remove the cake from the pan and transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.
11. Serve the cake topped with additional sliced almonds and drizzled with more creamy caramel, if desired.
Enjoy your delicious apricot almond oat cake!
00285184ba:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F.
2. Combine the 2 cups of ground cake and 1 cup of chocolate chips in a mixing bowl.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk the 3 whole eggs together.
4. Mix the 1/2 cup of liquid oil into the whisked eggs.
5. Pour the egg and oil mixture into the bowl with the ground cake and chocolate chips. Mix everything together until well combined.
6. Lightly grease a 9-inch cake pan with non-stick cooking spray.
7. Pour the cake batter into the greased cake pan, spreading it evenly with a spatula.
8. Bake the cake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
9. Remove the cake from the oven and allow it to cool in the pan for 5-10 minutes.
10. Carefully remove the cake from the pan and transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.
11. Once the cake has cooled, slice it into individual servings and enjoy!
0473ac7792:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). 
2. Take a medium-sized mixing bowl and combine 2 cups of ground sugar and 1 cup of ground flour together.
3. Then, add 1/2 teaspoon of ground salt and 1/2 teaspoon of ground baking soda to the dry ingredients. 
4. Mix all the dry ingredients until well combined.
5. In another mixing bowl, crack 2 whole eggs and whisk them well. 
6. Add 1/2 cup of liquid coffee to the egg mixture and whisk until well combined.
7. Gradually add 1/2 cup of liquid oil to the egg mixture, whisking it steadily as you do so.
8. Stir in 1 teaspoon of your liquid extract (vanilla, almond, or any flavor of your choice) to the wet ingredients. 
9. Pour the wet mixture into the dry mixture gradually, stirring as you pour, until it is all well combined. 
10. Add 1 cup of chopped chocolate to the batter and fold it in without over-mixing.
11. Grease a 9-inch cake pan with butter or oil and dust it lightly with flour. 
12. Pour the batter into the pan and spread it evenly.
13. Bake the cake for about 35-45 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center of the cake comes out clean. 
14. Once the cake is done, remove it from the oven and allow it to cool for 10-15 minutes before removing it from the pan.
15. Once the cake is completely cooled, dust it with some ground sugar on top or frost it with some creamy cream. 
16. Slice the cake and serve. Enjoy your delicious cake!
0249a372cb:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C) and grease a 9-inch cake pan with cooking spray.
2. In a skillet over medium heat, cook the uncooked sausage until browned and cooked through. Remove from heat and let cool for 5 minutes.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the ground sugar and whipped eggs. Mix together until well incorporated.
4. Add in the ground flour, ground baking soda, ground baking powder, ground cinnamon, minced nutmeg, and ground salt to the bowl. Mix the dry ingredients in with the wet ingredients until a batter is formed.
5. Pour in the cooled cooked sausage, chopped pecans, and chopped raisins. Mix everything together until evenly distributed.
6. Add in the liquid coffee and liquid extract to the batter. Mix again until everything is well combined.
7. Pour the batter into the greased cake pan and smooth the surface with a spatula.
8. Bake the cake for 40-45 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
9. Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool to room temperature in the pan.
10. Once cooled, loosen the edges of the cake with a knife and remove it from the pan.
11. Slice and serve the cake as desired. Enjoy your unique sausage-filled cake!
0579604e6f:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking soda, baking powder, and salt.
3. Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients and add in the liquid oil, whole eggs, liquid water, liquid vodka, and liquid Kahlua.
4. Mix all the ingredients together until well combined and there are no lumps in the batter.
5. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9-inch cake pan.
6. Bake the cake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center of the cake comes out clean.
7. Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool completely before frosting or serving.
8. Optional: Add a frosting of your choice or dust the cake with powdered sugar.
Enjoy!
0393138636:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) and prepare a 9-inch round cake pan by greasing it with some cooking spray or butter.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine 2 cups of sliced rhubarb, 1 cup of ground coconut, and 1 cup of sliced meal. 
3. Add 1 cup of ground flour, 1 teaspoon of ground baking powder, and 1/2 teaspoon of ground salt to the bowl and mix well.
4. In a separate mixing bowl, whisk together 1 cup of creamy cream, 2 whipped eggs, 1 teaspoon of liquid extract, and 3/4 cup of liquid oil until smooth.
5. Pour the wet mixture into the dry ingredients and mix until just combined. 
6. Fold in 1/2 cup of sliced almonds.
7. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan and smooth the top with a spatula.
8. Bake for 40-45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
9. Once baked, remove the cake from the oven and allow it to cool in the pan for 10 minutes before transferring it onto a wire rack to cool completely.
10. Optional: sprinkle some extra sliced almonds and ground coconut on top of the cake for decoration.
11. Serve and enjoy your delicious rhubarb-coconut-almond cake!
0087d4702e:
1. Begin by preheating your oven to 350°F (177°C) and greasing a round cake pan with butter or cooking spray.
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream together 1 cup of creamy butter and 1 and 1/4 cups of ground sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Crack two whole eggs into the bowl and beat the mixture together until well combined.
4. Add in 2 cups of ground flour and 2/3 cup of liquid milk, alternating between the two and mixing gently after each addition until everything is well blended.
5. Continue mixing until no lumps remain, taking care not to overmix the batter as this may result in a dense cake.
6. Pour the batter into your prepared cake pan and smooth out the surface with a spatula.
7. Place the cake pan in the preheated oven and bake it for 35-40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
8. Once the cake is done, remove it from the oven and allow it to cool slightly in the pan for about 10 minutes.
9. After 10 minutes, carefully remove the cake from the pan and transfer it onto a wire rack to cool completely.
10. Once the cake has cooled completely, dust it with powdered sugar (if desired) and serve.
0564b1e41c:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C) and grease an 8-inch cake pan.
2. Melt 1 cup of liquid butter in a saucepan over low heat and let it cool.
3. In a mixing bowl, combine 2 cups of ground flour, 1 tsp of ground baking powder, 1 tsp of ground baking soda, and 1 tsp of ground salt.
4. Add 1 cup of ground brown sugar and 1 cup of ground sugar to the flour mixture, and mix well.
5. Beat 2 whole eggs in a separate bowl and add them to the flour mixture, stirring until smooth.
6. Stir in the cooled melted butter and grated zest of 1 orange, mixing well.
7. Pour the batter into the greased cake pan and smooth the top.
8. Sprinkle halved pecan halves evenly on top of the batter.
9. Bake for 35-40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
10. Allow the cake to cool for at least 10 minutes before removing it from the pan.
11. Sprinkle some ground sugar over the top of the cake before serving. Enjoy!
06527f5921:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F.
2. Grease a 9-inch cake pan.
3. In a medium bowl, combine 1 cup of ground flour, 1/4 cup of ground cornstarch, 1 teaspoon of ground baking powder, and 1/2 teaspoon of ground salt.
4. In a large mixing bowl, cream 1 cup of ground butter and 1 1/2 cups of ground brown sugar together until light and fluffy.
5. Beat in 1 whole egg and 1 tablespoon of liquid vanilla extract.
6. Gradually stir in the dry ingredients until well blended.
7. Pour in 1/4 cup of liquid bourbon and mix until just combined.
8. Fold in 1 cup of halved pecan halves and 1 peeled, diced peach.
9. Pour the cake batter into the prepared pan.
10. Bake for 35-40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
11. While the cake is baking, prepare the thick sauce syrup by combining 1 1/2 cups of ground sugar and 1 cup of water in a medium saucepan.
12. Bring to a boil, stirring until the sugar is dissolved.
13. Reduce heat to medium and continue to cook, without stirring, for 8-10 minutes or until the syrup has thickened.
14. Remove from heat and stir in 2 tablespoons of liquid butter.
15. Once the cake is finished baking, remove from oven and let it cool for 10 minutes.
16. Drizzle the thick sauce syrup over the top of the cake.
17. Serve warm and enjoy!
0372e66fd6:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F and grease a round cake pan with butter or cooking spray.
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream together the ground sugar and creamy butter until fluffy and light with an electric mixer.
3. Add the whole eggs, one at a time, and beat until fully combined.
4. Add in the ground flour and mix on low speed until just combined. Be careful not to overmix.
5. Gradually add the liquid milk to the mixture in small amounts, stirring until well combined after each addition.
6. Stir in the liquid vanilla until the batter is smooth and completely mixed.
7. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan and bake for 35-40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
8. Allow the cake to cool for 5-10 minutes before removing it from the pan and placing on a cooling rack.
9. Spread the jelly jelly on top of the cake as frosting.
10. Serve the cake and enjoy!
03f9efb0f3:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
2. In a large mixing bowl, add the ground flour, ground baking powder, ground salt, and ground sugar. Whisk the dry ingredients together until they are evenly mixed.
3. Add the creamy crisco to the dry ingredients, and use a fork to mix it together until it forms coarse crumbs.
4. In a separate mixing bowl, add the liquid milk, liquid vanilla, and thick liquid eggs. Whisk the wet ingredients together until they are fully blended.
5. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients, and use a whisk to mix it all together until a smooth batter forms.
6. Fold in the chopped nuts and chocolate chips until they are evenly distributed throughout the batter.
7. Grease a 9x13 inch baking pan with cooking spray or butter, and pour the batter into the pan.
8. Place the pan in the preheated oven, and bake for 35-40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
9. Remove the pan from the oven and let it cool for 10 minutes before serving. Enjoy your freshly made cake!
00ec97c5eb:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). 
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine 2 cups of ground flour, 2 cups of ground sugar, 3 teaspoons of ground baking soda, and 1 teaspoon of ground salt. Mix well to ensure ingredients are evenly distributed. 
3. Add 1 cup of softened margarine and 1 cup of ground butter to the dry ingredients. Using an electric mixer or hand whisk, cream the butter and margarine with the flour mixture until it forms a smooth paste. 
4. Mix in 1 cup of liquid water, 1/2 cup of ground cocoa, and 1/2 cup of creamy cream into the batter until it is fully incorporated. 
5. Whisk in 2 whole eggs and 1 teaspoon of liquid extract (vanilla or almond) until it becomes a smooth mixture. 
6. In a separate bowl, mix 1/2 cup of ground butter, 1/2 cup of liquid milk, 1/4 cup of ground cocoa, and 1/4 cup of ground sugar until it forms a smooth chocolate mixture. 
7. Take a greased baking pan and pour in ¾ of the batter mixture. Add the chocolate mixture and spread it evenly on top of the batter mixture. 
8. Pour in the remaining batter mixture on top of the chocolate mix and ensure it is evenly spread. 
9. Sprinkle some baked pecans on top of the batter, ensuring they are evenly spaced. 
10. Place the baking pan in the preheated oven and bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. 
11. Remove from the oven and allow it to cool for 10-15 minutes before slicing and serving. 
Enjoy your delicious cake!
010c0020af:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C) and grease a 9x13 inch baking pan with butter or cooking spray.
2. In a mixing bowl, cream the butter and sugar together until light and fluffy.
3. Add the applesauce to the creamed mixture and stir until well-combined.
4. In a separate bowl, mix the ground flour, ground cinnamon, ground garlic, minced nutmeg, and ground salt.
5. Gradually stir the dry ingredients into the wet mixture until fully combined. Be careful not to over-mix the batter.
6. Fold in the dried raisins and mix until evenly distributed throughout the batter.
7. Pour the batter into the greased baking pan and spread it evenly.
8. Bake for 35-40 minutes or until a toothpick or cake tester comes out clean when inserted into the center of the cake.
9. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for a few minutes before removing it from the pan and placing it on a wire rack to cool completely.
10. Once the cake has cooled, dust it with powdered sugar or top it with a dollop of whipped cream if desired.
11. Slice and serve the applesauce cake as is, or with a side of warm caramel sauce or vanilla ice cream. Enjoy!
064ac3e1f9:
1. Preheat your oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine 1 cup of cooked quinoa, 1 chopped apple, and 1/2 cup of chopped blueberries.
3. Add 1/2 cup of ground sugar and 1/4 cup of thick sauce honey to the mixing bowl. Stir everything together until well combined.
4. Add 1 tablespoon of chopped ginger, 1 whole egg, and 1/2 cup of ground walnuts to the mixing bowl. Stir everything together until well combined.
5. Add 1/4 cup of grain seeds and 1/4 cup of ground flour to the mixing bowl. Stir everything together until well combined.
6. Add 2 tablespoons of ground tahini and 1 teaspoon of baking soda to the mixing bowl. Stir everything together until well combined.
7. Grease a 9-inch baking dish with cooking spray or butter.
8. Pour the cake batter into the greased baking dish and spread it evenly with a spatula.
9. Bake the cake in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
10. Let the cake cool for 10-15 minutes before serving. Enjoy your healthy and delicious cake with baked quinoa, chopped apple, chopped blueberry, and other nutritious ingredients!
033d7c038f:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream 1 cup of creamy margarine with 1 cup of ground sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add 1 whole egg and mix well.
4. Stir in 1 teaspoon of liquid vanilla and 1 cup of sauce applesauce.
5. In a separate bowl, combine 2 cups of whole flour and 1 tablespoon of ground baking powder.
6. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, alternating with 1 cup of liquid buttermilk, mixing well after each addition.
7. Fold in 1 cup of thawed raspberries, 1 tablespoon of ground cocoa, and a few drops of liquid food coloring.
8. Finally, mix in 1/2 cup of liquid milk until the batter is smooth and well combined.
9. Grease a 9-inch cake pan and pour the batter in it.
10. Bake in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
11. Allow the cake to cool for 5-10 minutes before removing it from the pan.
12. Serve the cake warm or at room temperature with your favorite toppings or frosting.
055be2bde0:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). 
2. Grease a 9x13 inch baking pan with some of the softened butter. 
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the liquid butter, ground sugar, and whole egg, and whisk until smooth. 
4. Add in the liquid vanilla and creamy cream, and whisk again until everything is fully incorporated. 
5. Mash one baked potato using a fork and mix it into the wet ingredients. 
6. In a separate bowl, sift together the ground flour, ground baking powder, ground baking soda, and ground salt. 
7. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture and stir until everything is just combined. 
8. Mix in the chopped pecans until evenly distributed throughout the batter. 
9. Pour the batter into the greased baking dish and smooth out the top with a spatula. 
10. In a small mixing bowl, combine the softened butter, ground brown sugar, and ground flour. Mix until the mixture has a crumbly consistency.
11. Sprinkle the crumbly mixture evenly over the cake batter.  
12. Bake the cake in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. 
13. Let the cake cool in the pan for 10-15 minutes before slicing and serving. 
14. Enjoy the delicious pecan cake with a dollop of whipped cream or vanilla ice cream!
0270c63eef:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine 1 cup of small meat crabmeat, 1 tablespoon of liquid lime, ½ cup of sliced onion, 1 baked pepper, 1 baked jalapeno, 1 teaspoon of ground chili, and ¼ cup of chopped cilantro leaves.
3. Add 1 tablespoon of chopped seed, ¼ cup of creamy mayonnaise, and ½ teaspoon of ground pepper to the mixing bowl. Mix all of the ingredients together thoroughly.
4. In a separate mixing bowl, beat 2 thick liquid eggs with ½ cup of creamy butter and 1 cup of liquid water. Add the egg mixture to the crabmeat mixture and gently stir together.
5. Pour the mixture into a greased 9-inch cake tin and bake in the preheated oven for 35-40 minutes or until the center is firm and the edges are golden brown.
6. In a small mixing bowl, combine 1 tablespoon of grated peel orange, 2 tablespoons of liquid lime, 2 tablespoons of chopped cilantro leaves and 1 teaspoon of ground pepper. Mix thoroughly to create the lime cilantro sauce.
7. Remove the crab cake from the oven and let it cool for 5 minutes. Transfer to a serving platter and top with sliced avocado and more chopped cilantro leaves.
8. Drizzle the lime cilantro sauce over the top of the crab cake and sprinkle with ground green chili.
9. Slice and serve the crab cake warm with a drizzle of whole vegetable oil on top for added flavor. Enjoy!
025695b8ef:
1. Preheat your oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (or 180 degrees Celsius) and grease a 9-inch cake pan with butter or cooking spray.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine 1 cup of creamy butter and 2 cups of ground sugar. Beat with an electric mixer until light and fluffy.
3. Add in 4 whole eggs, one at a time, and beat thoroughly after each addition.
4. Add in 2 cups of sifted ground flour, 1/2 cup of liquid milk, 1 tsp of liquid extract (such as vanilla or almond), and 1/2 cup of ground cocoa powder. Mix until just combined.
5. Add in a few drops of liquid food coloring if desired, and mix until the batter is evenly colored.
6. Slowly add in 1/2 cup of liquid water, stirring until the batter is smooth and has a pourable consistency.
7. Pour the cake batter into your prepared pan and smooth the top with a spatula.
8. Bake the cake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean when inserted into the center.
9. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes before turning it out onto a wire rack to cool completely.
10. Once the cake is cool, sprinkle it with a little ground sugar if desired, and serve slices with whipped cream or frosting of your choice.
00ddb35e65:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (175 degrees Celsius).
2. In a mixing bowl, combine 2 cups of ground flour, 1 tablespoon of ground cinnamon, 1 cup of ground brown sugar, and 1/2 cup of ground baking mix.
3. Add 1 cup of pieces of butter to the dry ingredients and use a pastry cutter or fork to blend the mixture until it becomes crumbly.
4. In a separate mixing bowl, beat 1/2 cup of creamy cheese, 1/2 cup of whole egg, and 1 teaspoon of liquid extract until they are well combined.
5. Gradually add the wet mixture to the dry mixture, stirring until the batter is smooth.
6. Pour the batter into a greased 9-inch baking pan.
7. Sprinkle 1/4 cup of ground sugar over the top of the cake batter.
8. Bake the cake in the preheated oven for 40-45 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
9. Allow the cake to cool to room temperature before serving. Enjoy!
03b1c1d28f:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F.
2. Grease a 9-inch cake pan with butter.
3. In a mixing bowl, combine 1 cup of ground flour and 1 teaspoon of ground salt.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk 2 whole eggs until frothy.
5. Gradually add 1 cup of ground sugar to the eggs while whisking vigorously.
6. Fold the flour mixture into the egg mixture until just combined.
7. Finally, fold in 1 cup of baked almond until the batter is smooth and evenly mixed.
8. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan and smooth the surface using the back of a spoon.
9. Bake the cake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
10. Remove the cake from the oven and allow it to cool completely in the pan.
11. Once cool, remove the cake from the pan and dust the top with additional ground sugar.
12. Serve and enjoy!
06398db17f:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F/175°C, and grease a 9-inch baking pan or two 8-inch round cake pans.
2. In a mixing bowl, combine the chopped pecans and chocolate chips. Set aside.
3. In another mixing bowl, cream together the ground sugar and creamy shortening until light and fluffy.
4. Add in the liquid extract and whole eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
5. Combine together the ground flour, ground salt, ground baking soda, and ground baking powder in a separate bowl.
6. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture in the other mixing bowl, alternating with the mashed banana and liquid buttermilk, mixing well after each addition.
7. Fold in the chopped pecans and chocolate chips until evenly distributed throughout the batter.
8. Pour the batter into the prepared pan or pans, and smooth the top with a spatula.
9. Bake for approximately 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
10. Remove the cake from the oven and allow it to cool on a wire rack for at least 10-15 minutes before serving.
11. Optional: You can frost the cake with your favorite frosting and garnish it with additional chopped pecans and chocolate chips on top. Enjoy!
0298ae394e:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Prepare a 9-inch (23 cm) round baking pan by lightly greasing the bottom and sides with margarine.
3. In a mixing bowl, combine 1 and 1/2 cups of ground flour, 1 and 1/2 teaspoons of ground baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon of ground salt, and 1/2 teaspoon of ground baking soda. Mix thoroughly.
4. Add 1/2 cup of softened margarine, 1/4 cup of ground sugar, and 1 whipped egg to the dry ingredients. Mix until the batter is smooth and creamy.
5. Add 1 teaspoon of liquid vanilla, 1/2 cup of liquid milk, and 1/4 cup of liquid coffee to the batter. Mix until the batter is smooth and evenly combined.
6. Pour the batter into the prepared baking pan, spreading it evenly.
7. In a separate mixing bowl, combine 1 and 1/2 cups of ground sugar, 1/2 cup of ground flour, and 2 teaspoons of ground apple pie spice. Mix thoroughly.
8. In another mixing bowl, combine 1 and 1/2 cups of sauce applesauce, 1/2 cup of thick liquid molasses, and 1 whole egg. Mix until the mixture is evenly combined.
9. Spread the applesauce mixture evenly over the top of the batter in the pan.
10. Sprinkle the sugar and flour mixture evenly over the top of the applesauce mixture.
11. Bake the cake for 45-50 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
12. Let the cake cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.
13. Optional: Serve with a dollop of creamy cream on top for an extra touch of sweetness.
0467973214:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F. 
2. Grease a baking dish and set aside. 
3. In a bowl, mix 1 cup of ground meal and 1 cup of ground sugar. 
4. Add 1 cup of softened butter and mix until well blended. 
5. Add 1 whole egg and 1/4 cup of thick liquid egg and continue mixing until the batter is smooth. 
6. Add 1/2 cup of creamy yogurt and mix again. 
7. Fold in 1 cup of whole nuts pistachio and 1/2 teaspoon of grated nutmeg. 
8. Pour the batter into the greased baking dish. 
9. Bake the cake for 45-50 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. 
10. In a small saucepan, mix 1 cup of thick sauce yoghurt and 1/4 cup of grated brown sugar. Heat on low, stirring occasionally until the sugar dissolves. 
11. Once the cake is fully baked, remove it from the oven and let it cool for 10-15 minutes. 
12. Serve each slice of cake with a drizzle of the thick sauce yoghurt. Enjoy your delicious cake with nuts pistachio!
010c7c6d51:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. Grease two 8-inch (20 cm) round cake pans and line with parchment paper.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine 2 cups (240 g) of all-purpose flour, 2 teaspoons of baking powder, and a pinch of salt.
4. In another bowl, beat 1 cup (226 g) of softened unsalted butter and 1 1/4 cups (250 g) of granulated sugar until light and fluffy.
5. Add 4 large eggs, one at a time, and beat until fully incorporated.
6. Mix in 2 teaspoons of pure vanilla extract.
7. Add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture alternating with 1 cup (240 ml) of milk, starting and ending with the dry ingredients.
8. Divide the batter evenly into the prepared cake pans and bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
9. Remove from oven and let cool in the pans for 5 minutes before removing and transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.
10. In a mixing bowl, beat 1 cup (226 g) of softened unsalted butter until creamy.
11. Gradually add 4 cups (480 g) of powdered sugar and mix until smooth.
12. Add 2 tablespoons of heavy cream and 2 teaspoons of pure vanilla extract and continue to mix until the frosting is light and fluffy.
13. Spread a layer of frosting on top of one of the cake layers.
14. Place the other cake layer on top of the frosting.
15. Add a layer of liquid wafer on top of the cake.
16. Pour a layer of creamy ice over the liquid wafer.
17. Repeat with two more layers of creamy ice.
18. Place a creamy ice cream cone on top of the final layer of creamy ice.
19. In a small saucepan, melt 1 cup (240 ml) of chocolate chips with 1/2 cup (120 ml) of heavy cream.
20. Pour the chocolate sauce over the top of the ice cream cone.
21. Crush some baked candy and sprinkle over the chocolate sauce.
22. Serve and enjoy your delicious cake!
05d1e840ed:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. In a large bowl, cream the softened butter and ground sugar until fluffy.
3. Add the whipped eggs, liquid vanilla, and grated nutmeg to the bowl and mix well.
4. In a separate bowl, sift together the ground flour and ground baking powder.
5. Add the dry mixture to the wet mixture in the first bowl in thirds, alternating with the liquid milk as you go, until everything is well-combined.
6. Grease and flour a cake pan, then pour the batter into it, leveling it off with a spatula.
7. Sprinkle the remaining ground sugar over the top of the batter.
8. Bake the cake for 35-40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
9. Once the cake is done, take it out of the oven and let it cool for 10-15 minutes before slicing and serving. Enjoy!
00cd09b6c6:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (176°C) and prepare a baking dish by greasing and flouring it.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine 1 cup of ground flour, 1 cup of whole flour, 2 teaspoons of ground cinnamon, 1 cup of ground sugar, and 1 cup of softened margarine.
