3. Mix the ingredients together until they are well combined and form a batter. Add in 1/2 cup of chopped walnuts and mix again.
4. In a separate bowl, mix together 1/4 cup of ground flour, 1/4 cup of whole flour, 1 teaspoon of ground baking soda, 1 teaspoon of ground cinnamon, 1/2 teaspoon of ground salt, and 1/2 cup of ground sugar.
5. Stir the dry mixture into the batter and mix until combined.
6. Add in 1 peeled and chopped apple, 2 thick liquid eggs, and another 1/2 cup of chopped walnuts. Mix everything together well.
7. Pour the batter into the prepared baking dish and smooth the top with a spatula. Bake for 45-50 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
8. While the cake is baking, make the applesauce by combining 1/2 cup of peeled and chopped apples and 1/2 cup of sugar in a small saucepan. Cook over low heat until the apples are soft and the sugar has dissolved.
9. Once the cake is finished baking, remove it from the oven and let it cool for 10-15 minutes. Serve warm with a dollop of applesauce on top. Enjoy!
04038bac0c:
1. Preheat your oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine 1 and a half cups of ground brown sugar and a teaspoon of ground cinnamon. Mix these ingredients together thoroughly. 
3. Add 1/4 cup of liquid biscuit and 1/4 cup of liquid butter to the sugar and cinnamon mixture. Mix these ingredients until they are well combined. 
4. Next, add 1 cup of rolled oats to the mixing bowl. Stir the oats into the mixture until they are well coated. 
5. Gently fold in 1 cup of fresh blueberries into the batter, making sure not to crush the blueberries. 
6. Grease a 9-inch cake pan with cooking spray or oil. Pour the cake batter into the pan and smooth it out evenly. 
7. Sprinkle a tablespoon of ground sugar over the top of the cake mixture. 
8. Place the cake in the preheated oven and bake for 35-40 minutes or until the cake is golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. 
9. Remove the cake from the oven and allow it to cool in the pan for 5-10 minutes. 
10. Once the cake has cooled, remove it from the pan and transfer it to a serving plate. Slice and serve as desired. 
Enjoy your delicious blueberry oat cake with a hint of cinnamon as a snack or dessert.
047b85f1b9:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F/175°C.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the ground flour, ground sugar, and creamy butter. Mix well with an electric mixer until the mixture becomes light and fluffy, about 3 minutes.
3. Slowly add the liquid milk and liquid vanilla to the mixing bowl. Keep mixing until the mixture becomes smooth.
4. Add the chopped walnuts, chopped cherries, and shredded coconut to the mixing bowl. Use a spatula to fold in the ingredients until they are evenly distributed in the batter.
5. Pour the batter into a greased cake pan. Spread it evenly with a spatula.
6. Bake the cake in the oven for about 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
7. Once the cake is done, remove it from the oven and let it cool for about 10 minutes.
8. Use a knife to loosen the edges of the cake from the pan. Then, invert the cake onto a cooling rack and let it cool completely.
9. Once the cake is cooled, you can decorate it with whipped cream, fresh fruit, or any other toppings of your choice.
10. Slice and serve your delicious cake!
02c9037a2b:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) and grease a 9-inch cake pan with butter or cooking spray.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the whole flour, ground flour, ground baking soda, ground cinnamon, and ground salt. Mix thoroughly and set aside.
3. In a separate mixing bowl, cream together the creamy butter, thick sauce honey, and creamy yogurt with an electric mixer until it becomes light and fluffy.
4. Crack in the whole egg and pour in the liquid vanilla. Mix well.
5. Add the dry ingredient mixture to the wet mixture in three parts, mixing well at each addition.
6. Stir in the shredded carrot and creamy cheese, making sure they are evenly distributed.
7. Pour the cake batter into the prepared cake pan and smooth out the top with a spatula.
8. Bake the cake in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
9. While the cake is baking, prepare the frosting by combining creamy butter, liquid vanilla, and ground sugar in a mixing bowl. Beat them together with an electric mixer until it becomes smooth and fluffy.
10. Once the cake is done baking, let it cool completely before spreading the frosting onto the cake.
11. Serve and enjoy your whole flour carrot cake!
041f1ae5ca:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F.
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream together the creamy butter and ground sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Beat in the whole eggs, one at a time, then add in the liquid extract, if using.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the ground flour, ground baking powder, and ground salt.
5. Gradually mix the flour mixture into the wet ingredients, alternating with the liquid milk, until a smooth batter forms.
6. Fold in the ground garlic, ground cinnamon, ground allspice, chopped raisins, chopped almonds, grated orange zest, and flakes coconut.
7. Grease and flour a baking pan, then pour the batter into the pan.
8. Bake the cake for 40-45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
9. While the cake is baking, prepare the frosting. In a small saucepan over medium heat, stir together the ground sugar, liquid water, and ground cornstarch until the mixture thickens and becomes glossy. Remove from heat and let cool.
10. Once the cake is done baking, remove it from the oven and let it cool in the pan for 10 minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.
11. Once the cake has cooled, spread a thick layer of the creamy frosting over the top of the cake.
12. Serve the cake and enjoy!
04ae9b9d19:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C) and prepare a 9-inch (23 cm) baking pan by greasing it with liquid oil.
2. In a large bowl, mix together 1 pound (454 g) of ground turkey, 1 cup (150 g) of diced carrots, and 1 cup (185 g) of cooked and cooled rice.
3. Add 2 whipped eggs and 1/2 cup (120 ml) of liquid oil to the bowl, and mix well to combine.
4. Add 1 cup (160 g) of thawed spinach to the bowl and mix again to combine all ingredients.
5. Pour the mixture into the prepared baking pan and spread it out evenly.
6. Bake the cake in the preheated oven for 45-50 minutes, or until it is cooked through and golden brown on top.
7. Let the cake cool in the pan for 10-15 minutes before slicing and serving.
8. For an added twist, you can also bake an egg on top of the cake before serving. Simply crack an egg onto the top of the cooked cake and return it to the oven for another 5-7 minutes, or until the egg is cooked to your liking.
9. Serve the cake warm, garnished with fresh herbs or sliced vegetables if desired. Enjoy!
026eb4c499:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. Grease a 9-inch cake pan with some oil.
3. In a large mixing bowl, add 3 whole eggs and whisk them until they start to get frothy.
4. Slowly pour in 1 cup of liquid oil into the bowl, and mix together with the eggs until the oil is fully combined.
5. Pour in 1 cup of liquid wine and continue whisking the mixture until it is well combined with the other ingredients.
6. Gradually add 2 cups of ground sugar into the bowl and whisk until it is fully incorporated into the mixture.
7. Pour in 1 cup of jelly blackberry and mix it in with a spatula.
8. Add 1 cup of chopped pecans to the bowl and mix everything together.
9. Pour the cake batter into the prepared cake pan and smooth out the top with a spatula.
10. Bake the cake in the preheated oven for 45-50 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean when inserted in the center.
11. Once cooked, remove the cake from the oven and let it cool down for at least 10 minutes.
12. Lastly, pour 1/4 cup of liquid wine over the cooled cake to add some extra flavor and moisture.
13. Slice the cake and serve as desired. Enjoy!
04b8d19763:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C) and grease a cake tin with butter.
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream together softened butter and ground sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add in the whole egg and mix until fully incorporated.
4. Next, add in the applesauce and mix until well combined.
5. In a separate bowl, mix together the ground flour, ground baking powder, and liquid extract.
6. Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix until just combined.
7. Pour the batter into the greased cake tin and bake for 35-40 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean when inserted into the center of the cake.
8. While the cake is baking, prepare the guava sauce by mixing together the thick sauce guava and ground sugar in a small saucepan.
9. Cook the guava sauce over low heat, stirring constantly, until the sugar has dissolved and the sauce has thickened.
10. Once the cake is finished baking, remove it from the oven and allow it to cool in the tin for 10 minutes before carefully removing it and transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.
11. Once the cake has cooled, drizzle the guava sauce over the top of the cake and serve with a side of liquid milk and a dash of liquid vanilla. Enjoy!
0687386572:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Grease a cake pan with some liquid margarine and dust it with ground flour, then set aside.
3. Peel and grate two large apples into a bowl.
4. In a separate bowl, cream 1 cup of softened margarine and 2 cups of ground sugar together until light and fluffy.
5. Beat in 1 whole egg and 1 tsp of liquid vanilla extract.
6. In another bowl, whisk together 3 cups ground flour, 2 tsp ground cinnamon, 2 tsp ground baking powder, and 1 tsp ground baking soda.
7. Add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture gradually, alternating with 1/2 a cup of liquid margarine, and mixing well after each addition.
8. Fold in the grated apples and 1/2 a cup of minced nuts.
9. Pour the batter into the prepared pan and smooth out the top with a spatula.
10. Bake for 45 minutes to an hour, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
11. Remove the cake from the oven and allow it to cool in the pan for 5-10 minutes.
12. Invert it onto a wire rack and let it cool completely.
13. Once the cake is cool, mix 1/4 cup of ground sugar and 1 tsp of ground cinnamon together in a small bowl.
14. Sprinkle the cinnamon sugar mixture over the top of the cake and serve. Enjoy!
03b5261781:
1. Preheat oven to 180 degrees Celsius and grease a 9-inch cake tin.
2. Melt the solid chocolate in a heatproof bowl over a saucepan of simmering water until smooth. Set aside to cool slightly.
3. In a separate large mixing bowl, beat the softened cheese and ground sugar together until light and fluffy.
4. Beat in the two whole eggs, one at a time, until fully incorporated.
5. Add the melted chocolate and ground almond to the mixture and stir until just combined.
6. Gradually pour in the liquid milk, mixing until the batter is smooth.
7. Pour batter into the greased cake tin and smooth out the surface.
8. Bake the cake for 35-40 minutes or until cooked through.
9. Once baked, remove the cake from the oven and let it cool in the tin for 10 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.
10. Serve the cake as desired or sprinkle powdered sugar on top for decoration.
05d5b6b657:
1. Preheat the oven to the temperature specified on the dried cake mix box.
2. In a bowl, mix together the dried cake mix and whole eggs.
3. Gradually mix in the liquid water until the batter becomes smooth and consistent.
4. Add the creamy cream, pieces chip, and ground butter to the batter and mix until everything is fully combined.
5. Finally, add a small amount of liquid extract and whole candy to enhance the flavor and texture of the cake batter.
6. Pour the batter into a greased cake pan and bake in the preheated oven for the time specified on the dried cake mix box.
7. After the cake is done baking, remove it from the oven and allow it to cool before serving. Enjoy!
008bc63429:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F.
2. Grease a 9-inch cake pan with butter and dust lightly with flour.
3. In a mixing bowl, cream 1 cup of softened butter with 1 cup of ground sugar until smooth.
4. Add 4 whole eggs, one at a time, and mix well after each addition.
5. In a separate bowl, whisk together 2 cups of ground flour, 2 teaspoons of ground baking powder, and 1/2 teaspoon of ground salt.
6. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the butter mixture, alternating with 1/2 cup of liquid bourbon, and mix until well combined.
7. Stir in 1 cup of chopped pecans.
8. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan and smooth the top with a spatula.
9. Bake for 40-45 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center of the cake comes out clean.
10. Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool for 10 minutes before removing it from the pan.
11. Once the cake is cool, spread whipped cream on top to your desired thickness.
12. Drizzle with more liquid bourbon if desired.
13. Serve and enjoy your delicious bourbon pecan cake!
04a8bfca6f:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F.
2. In a mixing bowl, combine the ground flour, ground cocoa, ground baking powder, ground baking soda, and ground salt. Mix well.
3. Add the chopped chocolate and mix again.
4. In another mixing bowl, cream the creamy butter and ground sugar together until it is light and fluffy.
5. Add the whipped eggs to this mixture and beat well.
6. Gradually add the dry mixture to the wet mixture, alternating with liquid water.
7. Mix everything until you have a smooth batter.
8. In a separate bowl, mix together the chopped chocolate, ground butter, and thick sauce syrup.
9. Pour half of the batter into a greased baking pan.
10. Spread the chocolate mixture evenly over the top of the batter in the pan.
11. Add the remaining batter on top of the chocolate layer.
12. Place the cake pan in the oven and bake for 35-40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
13. Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool in the pan for 10-15 minutes.
14. Remove the cake from the pan and place it on a wire rack to cool completely.
15. While the cake is cooling, make the creamy cream by whipping it until stiff peaks are formed.
16. Once the cake is cooled, spread the creamy cream on top of the cake and serve.
042d1d83d6:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. Grease a 9-inch (23 cm) cake pan with butter or baking spray.
3. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the ground flour and ground salt.
4. In another large mixing bowl, cream the creamy butter and ground sugar together until light and fluffy.
5. Add the thick liquid eggs, one at a time, and continue to mix until completely incorporated.
6. Mix in the liquid extract and stir until completely combined.
7. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture and mix until well combined.
8. Stir in the chopped pineapple, dried raisins, chopped pecans, grated coconut, and cherries. Mix until well combined.
9. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan and smooth the top with a spatula.
10. Bake the cake for 60-70 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
11. Remove the cake from the oven and allow it to cool on a wire rack for 10-15 minutes before removing it from the pan.
12. Once the cake is completely cool, it can be sliced and served.
Enjoy your delicious cake!
06b356f47d:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) and prepare a 9-inch baking pan by greasing it with butter or cooking spray.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine 1 1/2 cups of crumbs cracker, 1/4 cup of ground sugar, 1 tablespoon of ground cinnamon, and 1/4 teaspoon of ground nutmeg. Mix well until all ingredients are evenly combined.
3. Pour in 1/2 cup of liquid butter and 1/4 cup of liquid caramel into the bowl. Mix everything together until the mixture becomes moist.
4. Add in 1/2 cup of chocolate pieces chip and 1 cup of softened cheese into the bowl. Mix everything well until all ingredients are evenly combined.
5. In a separate mixing bowl, combine 1 1/2 cups of halved flour, 1/4 cup of ground sugar, 1 whole egg, and 1 peeled and chopped apple. Sprinkle 1 tablespoon of ground cinnamon onto the mixture and mix well until everything is thoroughly combined.
6. Pour the apple mixture into the prepared baking pan and spread it evenly.
7. Sprinkle the crumb mixture over the top of the apple mixture, making sure it is spread evenly.
8. Bake the cake in the preheated oven for 40-45 minutes or until the top turns golden brown and the cake is fully cooked.
9. Once baked, remove the cake from the oven and allow it to cool for 10-15 minutes before serving. Serve warm or at room temperature. Enjoy your delicious cake made with crumbs cracker, ground sugar, ground cinnamon, ground nutmeg, liquid butter, liquid caramel, pieces chip, softened cheese, halved flour, ground sugar, whole egg, peeled apple, and ground cinnamon!
006bbb0bfb:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). 
2. In a mixing bowl, add 1 cup of softened butter and 1 cup of ground sugar. Mix until the butter is light and fluffy. 
3. Beat in 2 whole eggs, one at a time, making sure each egg is fully incorporated before adding the next one. 
4. In a separate bowl, sift together 2 cups of ground flour, 2 teaspoons of ground baking powder, and 1/2 teaspoon of ground salt. 
5. Gradually stir in the dry ingredients into the butter mixture, alternating with 1/2 cup of liquid milk until fully incorporated. 
6. Mix in 1 tablespoon of minced lemon to add some citrus flavor to your cake. 
7. Pour the batter into a greased cake pan 
8. Bake the cake for 35-40 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean when inserted into the center of the cake. 
9. Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool before slicing and serving. Enjoy!
02109fb196:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) and prepare a cake pan by greasing it with softened butter or spraying it with cooking spray.
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream together 1 cup of softened butter and 1 cup of ground sugar using an electric mixer on medium speed. Mix until light and fluffy, about 3-5 minutes.
3. Add 2 cups of ground flour, 2 teaspoons of ground baking powder, and 1/2 teaspoon of ground salt to the butter mixture. Mix on low until just combined.
4. In a separate mixing bowl, whisk together 2 whole eggs, 1 teaspoon of liquid vanilla, and the grated zest of 1 lemon until well combined.
5. Add the egg mixture to the butter mixture and mix on low until well combined.
6. Slowly add 1/2 cup of liquid milk to the batter, mixing on low until the milk is fully incorporated. Add in 1/2 cup of chopped cranberries and continue mixing until evenly distributed.
7. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan and use a spatula to smooth out the top.
8. Bake the cake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 5-10 minutes before removing it to a wire rack to cool completely.
9. While the cake is cooling, prepare the whipped cream. In a large mixing bowl, beat 1 cup of heavy cream until soft peaks form. Add in 1/4 cup of ground sugar and the grated zest of 1 lemon and continue beating until stiff peaks form.
10. Once the cake has cooled completely, spread the whipped cream on top of the cake in an even layer.
11. Using a piping bag with a decorative tip, pipe small rosettes of creamy cream onto the whipped cream layer.
12. Finally, sprinkle some ground sugar and grated lemon over the top of the cake for added flavor and decoration.
13. Slice the cake and serve! Enjoy your delicious cranberry lemon cake with soft whipped cream and decoratively piped creamy cream.
04a07b1659:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
2. In a large mixing bowl, add 1 cup of liquid water and 1 cup of liquid orange. Mix until they are well combined.
3. Slowly add 2 cups of all-purpose flour to the bowl, whisking constantly to avoid lumps.
4. Add 1 tablespoon of baking powder and 1 teaspoon of ground vanilla to the bowl. Mix well.
5. Pour the cake batter into a greased and floured cake pan.
6. Bake the cake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
7. Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool completely.
8. Once the cake is cool, top it with whipped cool whip.
9. Serve and enjoy your delicious cake with a hint of orange and vanilla flavor!
071dabd554:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Lightly grease an 8-inch (20cm) round cake pan with baking spray, or butter and flour.
3. In a large mixing bowl, beat three whole eggs until well mixed and frothy.
4. Gradually add 1 cup (200g) ground sugar to the eggs, beating on medium speed until the mixture becomes light and fluffy.
5. Pour in 1/2 cup (120ml) thick sauce honey and stir until it is fully incorporated into the mixture.
6. Add in 1/4 cup (60ml) liquid coffee, and 1/2 cup (120ml) of liquid oil, and whisk the mixture until it becomes smooth.
7. In another bowl, sift together the 1 and 1/2 cups (185g) of ground flour and 2 teaspoons of ground baking soda.
8. Fold the flour mixture and 2 teaspoons of ground cinnamon, 1 teaspoon of garlic, and 1 tablespoon of minced ginger into the egg mixture, one-third at a time, using a spatula to mix until there are no lumps remaining.
9. Add in 1 teaspoon of liquid vanilla and mix the batter until it becomes smooth and lump-free.
10. Pour the cake batter into the prepared pan and shake it gently to level the batter.
11. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
12. Once baked, remove the pan from the oven and let it cool completely before slicing and serving or decorating as desired.
015c90ddf2:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F.
2. In a large mixing bowl, add 1 cup of creamy shortening and beat until it becomes smooth.
3. Add 2 cups of ground sugar and 1 tsp of ground salt to the mixing bowl, and beat until the mixture becomes fluffy.
4. Add 2 tsp of liquid vanilla and 1/2 cup of liquid water to the mixing bowl, and beat for an additional minute.
5. In a separate bowl, mix 1/2 cup of solid cocoa and 2 cups of ground flour together.
6. Gradually add the dry mixture to the mixing bowl with the wet mixture, alternating with 1/2 cup of liquid water until all of the dry mixture and water has been incorporated.
7. In another mixing bowl, beat 3 thick liquid eggs until it becomes fluffy.
8. Add 1 cup of ground sugar and 1 tsp of ground baking soda to the egg mixture, and beat until it becomes smooth.
9. Fold the egg mixture into the cake batter, stirring thoroughly.
10. Grease a 9-inch cake pan with non-stick cooking spray, and pour the cake batter into the pan.
11. Place the pan in the oven, and bake for approximately 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
12. Remove the cake from the oven and cool it for 10 minutes before serving. Enjoy!
065adb629b:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C) and grease a 9-inch cake pan with butter.
2. Chop 1 cup of whole prunes into small pieces and set aside.
3. In a medium bowl, whisk 2 cups of ground flour with 1 teaspoon of ground baking soda, 1 teaspoon of minced nutmeg, 1 teaspoon of ground cinnamon, 1 teaspoon of grain allspice, and 1 cup of ground sugar.
4. In another bowl, beat 2 whole eggs until light and fluffy.
5. Add 1/2 cup of liquid oil, 1 teaspoon of liquid extract, and 1/2 cup of liquid buttermilk to the eggs and mix well.
6. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix until fully incorporated.
7. Fold in the chopped prunes into the batter.
8. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan and level the surface with a spatula.
9. Bake the cake for 35-40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
10. While the cake is baking, make the thick sauce syrup by simmering 1 cup of ground sugar, 1 cup of liquid buttermilk, and 1/4 cup of softened butter in a saucepan over medium heat until thickened.
11. Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool down to room temperature.
12. Pour the thick sauce syrup over the cake and drizzle with 1 teaspoon of liquid extract.
13. Cut the cake into slices and serve. Enjoy!
061177fc31:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F or 175°C.
2. In a mixing bowl, beat 1 cup of liquid butter with 1 cup of ground sugar until the mixture is fluffy and light.
3. Next, add 3 beaten eggs to the butter-sugar mixture and mix well.
4. Slowly add 2 cups of liquid biscuit to the mixture and whisk until fully incorporated.
5. Add in 1 cup of baked walnut, 1 cup of dried raisin, and 1 tbsp of minced lemon zest to the mixture, and mix until all ingredients are evenly distributed.
6. Grease a cake pan with butter or cooking spray.
7. Pour the mixture into the cake pan.
8. Sprinkle an additional 1/4 cup of ground sugar over the top of the cake batter.
9. Bake the cake for 40-50 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
10. Once the cake is fully baked, remove it from the oven and let it cool in the pan for 10 minutes.
11. After 10 minutes, carefully remove the cake from the pan and place it onto a wire rack to cool completely.
12. Slice and serve the cake once it has cooled to room temperature. Enjoy!
00a95b754f:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C) and grease a 9-inch (23cm) round cake pan.
2. In a mixing bowl, combine 2 cups of ground flour, 1 cup of ground sugar, 2 teaspoons of ground baking powder, and 1/4 teaspoon of ground salt.
3. Using a hand mixer, blend in 1/2 cup of creamy butter until the mixture looks like fine crumbs.
4. Add in 1/2 cup of creamy cheese and continue to mix until the butter and cheese are fully incorporated into the flour mixture.
5. In a separate mixing bowl, beat 2 whole eggs until they are light and fluffy.
6. Add the beaten eggs to the flour mixture and continue to mix until the batter is smooth and free of lumps.
7. Stir in 1 tablespoon of your favorite liquid extract and the minced zest of 1 lemon.
8. Pour the batter into your prepared cake pan and smooth the surface with a spatula.
9. Bake the cake in the preheated oven for 30 to 35 minutes, or until the cake is fully cooked and lightly golden on top.
10. Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool for 10 minutes in the pan.
11. Transfer the cake to a wire rack and let it cool completely before serving. Enjoy!
06baa26661:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F.
2. Prepare your baking pan by greasing it with creamy shortening.
3. In a mixing bowl, add 2 cups of ground sugar and 1 cup of creamy shortening. Beat them together until they become light and fluffy.
4. Gradually add in 3 beaten eggs, one at a time, and continue mixing.
5. In another bowl, mix 2 ½ cups of ground flour, 1 tsp of ground baking soda, 1 tsp of ground salt, and 2 tsp of ground baking powder.
6. Slowly add the dry ingredients into the creamy mixture, stirring as you pour.
7. Add 1 cup of sauce applesauce, 1 tsp of minced nutmeg, 1 tsp of chopped nut, and 1 tsp of ground garlic into the batter.
8. Mix well until everything is combined.
9. Pour the batter into the greased baking pan and smooth the top with a spatula.
10. Bake the cake at 350°F for approximately 30 to 35 minutes, or until the cake bounces back to the touch or a toothpick inserted comes out clean.
11. Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool on a wire rack.
12. Serve as desired. Enjoy!
01f62002ef:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C) and grease a 9-inch round cake pan.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the ground chocolate, jelly pudding mix, and whole eggs. Mix until well combined.
3. Add the creamy cream, liquid water, and liquid oil to the mixture, and stir until smooth and well blended.
4. Fold in the chopped chocolate to the mixture.
5. Pour the mixture into the greased cake pan and bake for 35-40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
6. Once the cake is baked, remove it from the oven and let it cool completely before decorating.
7. In a separate bowl, whisk the thawed cool whip until it is smooth and fluffy.
8. Once the cake has fully cooled, top it with the whipped cool whip, spreading it evenly and smoothing it out.
9. Optional: You can sprinkle some additional chopped chocolate over the top of the cool whip for added texture and flavor.
10. Slice and serve your delicious chocolate cake with jelly pudding and whipped cream! Enjoy!
0029fb3ebf:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C). Grease a 9-inch cake pan with butter and set aside.
2. In a large bowl, cream the butter and ground sugar until it's light and fluffy.
3. Beat the three eggs, one at a time, into the creamed butter and sugar mixture.
4. In a separate bowl, sift together the ground flour, ground baking powder, and ground salt.
5. Gradually add the sifted dry mixture to the butter and sugar mixture, alternating with the liquid milk. Mix everything until it forms a smooth batter.
6. Add in the chopped almonds, ground cocoa, liquid flavoring, and liquid food coloring (optional) and stir until everything is well combined.
7. Pour the batter into the greased cake pan and tap the bottom of the pan gently to remove any air pockets.
8. Bake in the preheated oven for about 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
9. Remove the cake from the oven and allow it to cool down for 15-20 minutes before turning it out onto a wire rack to cool completely.
10. Once the cake is completely cooled, you can ice it with your favorite frosting or serve it plain.
11. Enjoy your delicious and buttery cake!
001ac13db4:
1. Preheat your oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
2. In a large mixing bowl, add in one whole egg and whisk it until it's beaten.
3. Next, add in 1/2 cup of liquid oil and whisk until the mixture is well combined and the oil is fully incorporated.
4. Pour in 1/2 cup of liquid milk and whisk until everything is completely mixed together.
5. Add 1 teaspoon of liquid vanilla to the mixture and stir again until the vanilla is thoroughly incorporated.
6. Slowly add in 1 and 1/2 cups of all-purpose flour and stir until the batter is smooth and there are no lumps.
7. Grease a cake pan with non-stick cooking spray or butter and flour to prevent sticking.
8. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan and smooth the surface over with a spatula.
9. Bake the cake for 30-35 minutes or until a wooden toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean.
10. Once the cake is baked, remove it from the oven and let it cool on a wire rack for 10-15 minutes.
11. After the cake has cooled, carefully run a butter knife along the pan's edge to loosen it from the sides.
12. Gently invert the pan onto a plate or a wire rack, allowing the cake to release onto the surface.
13. Serve and enjoy your deliciously moist, vanilla-flavored cake or use it as the base of your favorite cake recipe!
06a27d8338:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. In a mixing bowl, combine the creamy cake mix, liquid brandy, and liquid wine. Mix well until all ingredients are fully incorporated.
3. Fold in the chopped baked almond into the cake batter.
4. Grease a cake pan with cooking spray or butter. Pour the cake batter into the greased cake pan.
5. Bake the cake for 45-50 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
6. Let the cake cool down completely before serving.
7. Garnish with additional chopped almonds or whipped cream for extra flavor.
Enjoy your delicious creamy cake with the added flavors of brandy, wine, and baked almond!
02f021290a:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a mixing bowl, cream together the creamy margarine and ground sugar until fluffy and pale.
3. Add in the whole eggs and beat until the mixture is smooth.
4. In a separate bowl, mix together the ground baking soda, ground flour, chopped date, sliced candy, whole nuts, and flakes coconut.
5. Gradually add in the dry ingredients to the wet mixture a little at a time, alternating with the liquid buttermilk, until everything is well combined and fully incorporated.
6. Pour the cake batter into a greased and lined cake pan and smooth the top with a spatula.
7. Bake the cake in the preheated oven for 40-45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
8. Remove the cake from the oven and allow it to cool in the pan for about 10 minutes before turning it out onto a wire rack to cool completely.
9. Serve and enjoy your delicious cake with creamy margarine, ground sugar, whole egg, ground baking soda, liquid buttermilk, ground flour, chopped date, sliced candy, whole nuts nut, flakes coconut, ground sugar.
0448546855:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C) and prepare a baking pan by greasing and flouring it.
2. In a large mixing bowl, add 2 cups of ground flour, 1 teaspoon of ground baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon of ground salt, and 1 cup of ground sugar.
3. Mix the dry ingredients together until they are well combined.
4. Add 2 whole eggs and 1 teaspoon of whole vanilla to the dry ingredients and mix until smooth and fully combined.
5. Slowly pour in 1 cup of liquid buttermilk and 1/2 cup of liquid butter into the mixture while stirring continuously to avoid lumps.
6. Fold in 1 cup of seeded cherries into the batter.
7. Pour the final batter into the prepared baking pan.
8. Bake the cake for 35 to 40 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
9. Remove the cake from the oven and allow it to cool on a wire rack for 10 minutes.
10. Serve the cake while still warm or chill it in the refrigerator before serving. Enjoy your delicious homemade cake!
04aeca0fb2:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine 2 cups of ground flour, 1 teaspoon of ground baking powder, 1 teaspoon of ground baking soda, 2 teaspoons of ground cinnamon, 1 teaspoon of ground allspice and 1/2 teaspoon of ground salt. Mix well.
3. In a separate mixing bowl, beat one stick of creamy butter and 1 1/2 cups of ground sugar until it becomes light and fluffy.
4. Add in 2 cups of creamy pumpkin, 1/2 cup of liquid buttermilk and 2 teaspoons of liquid vanilla to the butter and sugar mixture. Mix again until the ingredients are well combined.
5. Add one whole egg to the mixture and beat it well.
6. Slowly pour in the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients in portions of 3. Keep mixing with a spatula until everything is well combined.
7. Finally, fold in 1/4 cup of softened buttermilk and an additional 1/4 cup of liquid buttermilk.
8. Grease your cake pan with some butter and pour in the cake batter.
9. Bake the cake in the preheated oven for 35 to 40 minutes or until it passes the toothpick test. The cake is done when the toothpick inserted at the center comes out clean.
10. Once baked, let the cake cool for a few minutes before serving or frost with any preferred frosting. 
Your cake is ready to be served. Enjoy your pumpkin spice cake!
04acbf3658:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C). 
2. In a bowl, combine 1 cup of baked flour, 1 cup of ground flour, 1 teaspoon of ground baking soda, and 1 teaspoon of ground salt. 
3. In a separate bowl, beat 2 whole eggs until they are foamy. 
4. Then, add 1/2 cup of liquid butter, 1/2 cup of thick sauce honey, and 1 teaspoon of liquid extract to the eggs. Mix well until smooth. 
5. Combine the dry ingredients into the egg mixture, then add 1/2 cup of jam and 1/2 cup of peeled almonds. Mix until just combined. 
6. Pour the batter into a greased 9x13-inch baking pan. 
7. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes or until the cake is lightly golden brown and springs back when you touch the center of the cake. 
8. In a small bowl, mix 1/4 cup of ground sugar, 1/4 cup of liquid milk, and 1 teaspoon of liquid extract. 
9. When the cake is finished, remove it from the oven and let it cool for 10 minutes. 
10. Drizzle the sweetened milk mixture over the top of the cake. 
11. Slice pieces of cake and serve. Enjoy your delicious cake!
003c17c817:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
2. In a mixing bowl, cream together 1 cup of creamy margarine and 1 1/2 cups of ground sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Beat in 2 whole eggs, one at a time until fully incorporated.
4. In a separate bowl, sift together 2 1/2 cups of ground flour, 1 teaspoon of ground baking soda, 1 teaspoon of ground baking powder, and 1/4 teaspoon of ground salt.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the margarine mixture, mixing well after each addition, until all ingredients are combined.
6. Fold in 2 sliced apples and 2 teaspoons of ground cinnamon until evenly distributed.
7. Pour the batter into a greased 9-inch round cake pan.
8. Bake in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
9. Remove the cake from the oven and allow it to cool completely before serving. Enjoy!
04c9ab904c:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
2. Grease a 9-inch cake pan with softened butter.
3. In a large mixing bowl, cream 1 cup of creamy butter and 1 cup of ground sugar until light and fluffy.
4. Gradually beat in 2 whole eggs and 1 tablespoon of liquid vanilla.
5. Add 2 cups of ground flour, 2 teaspoons of ground baking powder, 1 teaspoon of ground ginger, 1 teaspoon of ground garlic, and 1/2 teaspoon of ground salt to the mixing bowl. Mix until well combined.
6. Pour in 1/2 cup of thick liquid molasses and 1/2 cup of liquid half and half while mixing the batter.
7. Fold in 1 sliced tomato to the batter.
8. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan.
9. Bake the cake in the preheated oven for 40-45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
10. Let the cake cool in the pan for 5 minutes before transferring it onto a wire rack.
11. Dust the cake with ground sugar before serving.
06a48da2f8:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C) and prepare a baking pan by greasing it with butter.
2. In a bowl, mix 2 cups of ground flour, 1 ½ cups of ground sugar, 2 teaspoons of ground baking powder, 1 teaspoon of ground baking soda, and ½ teaspoon of ground salt.
3. In a separate bowl, cream 1 cup of creamy butter until it becomes light and fluffy.
4. Add in 2 whole eggs and mix well.
5. Add 1 teaspoon of liquid extract (flavor of your choice) to the wet mixture and stir until it is well combined.
6. Gradually add the dry ingredient mixture to the wet mixture, mixing as you go until you form a smooth cake batter.
7. In another bowl, mix 1 cup of creamy cheese and ½ cup of ground sugar until it is creamy and smooth.
8. Gradually add ¼ cup of creamy cream to this cheese mixture and mix well until it becomes smooth.
9. Pour half of the cake batter into the greased baking pan and then spoon the creamy cheese mixture on top of it. Cover the cheese mixture with the remaining cake batter.
10. Bake the cake in the preheated oven for 35 to 40 minutes, or until the cake is golden brown and a toothpick inserted in the center of the cake comes out clean.
11. Once the cake is ready, let it cool in the pan for 10 to 15 minutes before removing it and letting it cool completely on a wire rack. Enjoy your delicious cake!
06f87b342c:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour a 9-inch cake pan or line it with parchment paper.
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream together the softened butter and ground sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the whole eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
4. Stir in the liquid extract.
5. In a separate bowl, mix together the ground flour, ground cinnamon, minced nutmeg, ground ginger, and ground salt.
6. Add the dry mixture gradually to the creamed mixture, beating well after each addition until fully blended.
7. Fold in the sliced peaches.
8. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan and smooth the top with a spatula.
9. Bake for 45-50 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
10. Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool completely in the pan before frosting.
11. To make the frosting, beat the softened butter in a mixing bowl until light and fluffy.
12. Gradually add the ground sugar, ground cinnamon, minced nutmeg, and ground ginger, beating well after each addition until fully blended.
13. Stir in the liquid extract and liquid milk until you get a smooth and creamy consistency.
14. Once the cake is cool, remove it from the pan and place it on a serving plate.
15. Spread the frosting over the top and sides of the cake.
16. For a decorative touch, sprinkle some ground cinnamon, minced nutmeg, or sliced peaches on top of the frosting before serving.
Enjoy your Peach Spice Cake with Buttercream Frosting!
04209441be:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). 
2. Grease a 9-inch baking pan with cooking spray or butter. 
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine 2 cups of ground sugar and 1 cup of liquid oil. Whisk the mixture together until it's fully combined. 
4. Add in 3 whole eggs to the bowl, one at a time. Beat well after each egg is added. 
5. Add 1 teaspoon of ground baking soda and 1/2 teaspoon of ground salt to the mixture. Whisk it all together. 
6. Add in 2 teaspoons of liquid vanilla to the mixture, and stir it together. 
7. Fold in 2 cups of chopped apples, 1/2 cup of flaked coconut, and 1/4 cup of chopped pecans to the mixture. Mix until everything is evenly combined. 
8. Pour the batter into the greased baking pan, and level out the surface of the batter. 
9. Bake the cake in the preheated oven for 35-40 minutes, or until the cake is golden brown and the edges are separating from the side of the pan. 
10. Remove the cake from the oven, and let it cool in the pan for 10 minutes. 
11. After 10 minutes, remove the cake from the pan, and place it on a wire rack to cool completely. 
12. Serve the cake as is or frost it with your favorite frosting. Enjoy!
02c014ef85:
1. Preheat the oven to the recommended temperature on the cake mix box.
2. Follow the instructions on the cake mix box and prepare the cake batter by mixing liquid strawberry, liquid water, and liquid milk together in a mixing bowl.
3. Grease the baking pan with a non-stick spray or butter.
4. Pour the cake batter into the baking pan.
5. Place the baking pan in the preheated oven and bake the cake for the recommended time on the cake mix box.
6. Check the cake by inserting a toothpick into the center of the cake. If it comes out clean, the cake is ready.
7. Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool for a while.
8. Once the cake is cool, top it off with whipped cool whip.
9. Garnish the cake with fresh strawberries or any toppings of your choice.
10. Serve and enjoy your delicious cake!
04627eb272:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. In a mixing bowl, cream together 1 cup of softened butter and 1 cup of ground sugar until it becomes light and fluffy.
3. Add in 2 whole eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
4. Add in 1/2 cup of creamy cream, and 1 teaspoon of your preferred liquid extract, and mix until well combined.
5. In a separate bowl, mix together 1 1/2 cups of ground flour, 1/2 cup of ground cornstarch, 1/2 teaspoon of ground salt, and 1/2 teaspoon of ground baking soda.
6. Gradually add the dry ingredients into the wet mixture until well combined.
7. Pour the mixture into a greased 9-inch round cake pan.
8. Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
9. Once finished, remove the cake from the oven and let it cool to room temperature. 
10. While waiting for the cake to cool, prepare the frosting by mixing together 1 cup of creamy cheese, 1/2 cup of ground sugar, and 1 teaspoon of liquid vanilla extract.
11. Gradually add in 1/4 cup of creamy cream until the frosting is creamy and spreadable.
12. Spread the frosting onto the cooled cake and top with fresh strawberries.
13. Serve and enjoy your homemade cake!
0540814247:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C) and lightly grease a 9-inch cake pan.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the liquid butter and ground sugar, and mix until creamy and smooth.
3. Add the liquid food coloring and mix until well incorporated.
4. Add the chopped rhubarb into the mixture and stir well.
5. In a separate mixing bowl, combine the ground cake, ground eggs, ground oil, and ground water until well mixed and smooth.
6. Gradually add the dry cake mixture into the wet mixture, stirring continuously until all ingredients are well combined, and the batter is smooth and even.
7. Pour the batter into the greased cake pan, and bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
8. Once the cake is done, remove it from the oven and let it cool to room temperature.
9. Once cooled, spread whipped cream evenly over the top of the cake.
10. Serve and enjoy!
012fc6a742:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. In a bowl, sift together 2 cups of ground flour, 1 teaspoon of ground baking soda, 1 teaspoon of ground baking powder, and 1/2 teaspoon of ground salt. Set aside.
3. In another bowl, cream together 1 cup of creamy butter and 1 cup of ground sugar until light and fluffy.
4. Add in 2 whole eggs to the butter and sugar mixture and beat until well combined.
5. Stir in 1/2 cup of creamy cream, 1 mashed banana, and 1/2 cup of ground sugar until well blended.
6. Slowly add the sifted dry ingredients (from Step 2) to the wet mixture (from Step 5), stirring until well combined.
7. Grease a 9-inch (23 cm) cake pan with some of the creamy butter.
8. Pour the batter into the greased cake pan.
9. Bake the cake for 35-40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
10. Once baked, let the cake cool in the pan for 10 minutes. Then, carefully remove it from the pan and let it cool completely on a wire rack.
11. In a separate bowl, mix together 1/2 cup of creamy cheese and 1/4 cup of ground sugar until well combined.
12. Once the cake has completely cooled, spread the creamy cheese frosting evenly on top of the cake.
13. Serve and enjoy your delicious homemade cake!
00e2ed9d94:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). 
2. In a mixing bowl, cream together the softened butter and ground sugar until light and fluffy. 
3. Add the whole eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. 
4. Stir in the mashed banana and liquid vanilla. 
5. In another bowl, whisk together the ground flour, ground baking powder, ground baking soda, and ground salt. 
6. Gradually add the dry mixture to the wet mixture while alternately adding the liquid milk. Mix until just blended. 
7. Stir in the chocolate chip pieces. 
8. Pour the batter into a greased cake pan. 
9. Bake the cake for 40-45 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean when inserted into the middle of the cake. 
10. Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool in the pan for 10 minutes. 
11. After 10 minutes, remove the cake from the pan and let it cool completely on a wire rack. 
12. Slice and serve! Enjoy your delicious homemade cake.
01bf3922ac:
1. Preheat your oven to 325°F.
2. In a mixing bowl, beat together the ground butter and ground sugar until creamy.
3. Add the whole milk, ground flour, ground salt, and zest of 1 lemon to the bowl and mix until all ingredients are fully combined.
4. Beat in 3 whole eggs until the mixture is smooth and creamy.
5. Pour the batter into a greased cake pan and smooth the top.
6. Bake the cake for 45-50 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean when inserted into the center of the cake.
7. While the cake is baking, prepare the frosting. In a separate bowl, beat the creamy cheese and 1/2 cup ground sugar until smooth.
8. Once the cake is done, let it cool for about 10 minutes before removing it from the pan.
9. Once the cake has cooled, spread the creamy cheese frosting evenly over the top of the cake.
10. Drizzle 1/2 cup of raspberry sauce over the frosting.
11. Slice and serve the cake immediately or refrigerate it until ready to serve. Enjoy!
0281edc955:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
2. Grease and flour a cake pan.
3. In a bowl, mix together 1 cup of ground flour, 1/2 teaspoon of ground salt, 1 cup of ground sugar, and 1 tablespoon of ground baking powder.
4. In another bowl, beat 2 whole eggs until light and fluffy.
5. Add 1/2 cup of whole milk, 1 teaspoon of liquid extract, and 1/3 cup of liquid butter to the eggs and mix well.
6. Slowly add the dry ingredients to the wet bowl, mixing until well combined.
7. In a separate bowl, mix 1/2 cup of softened butter, 1/2 cup of ground sugar, and 1 tablespoon of ground cinnamon until well combined.
8. Spread a layer of cake batter in the prepared pan.
9. Slice 1 peeled apple thinly and lay them on top of the cake batter.
10. Pour the butter and sugar mixture over the apple slices.
11. Repeat with another layer of cake batter, apple slices, and butter and sugar mixture.
12. Top off with a final layer of cake batter.
13. Bake for 35-40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
14. While the cake is baking, prepare the glaze by mixing together 1 cup of ground sugar, 1/4 cup of whole milk, and 1 teaspoon of liquid extract.
15. When the cake is finished baking, let it cool for a few minutes before pouring the glaze over the top. Serve and enjoy!
0683445aa8:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). 
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine 2 cups of ground cake, 1 cup of ground sugar, 1 tablespoon of ground cornstarch, and 1 teaspoon of ground salt. 
3. Crack 2 whole eggs into the bowl and mix until well combined. 
4. Slowly pour in ¾ cup of liquid oil and ¼ cup of thick liquid egg, whisking constantly. 
5. Mix in 1 tablespoon of liquid vanilla and ½ cup of liquid water until the batter is smooth and evenly combined. 
6. In a separate bowl, whisk 2 whipped eggs until stiff peaks form. 
7. Gently fold the whipped eggs into the batter until fully incorporated. 
8. Add ½ cup of softened butter to the batter and mix until well combined. 
9. Grease a cake pan with additional butter and pour the batter into the pan. 
10. Bake in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean. 
11. Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool completely before removing it from the pan. 
12. Once cooled, top the cake with whipped cream and serve. Enjoy!
03b5759f4a:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F.
2. Grease a 9-inch cake pan with cooking spray or butter.
3. In a large bowl, mix 2 cups of popped cereal with 1 cup of thick sauce syrup, and stir until well combined.
4. Add 1 cup of creamy margarine to the mixture, and use an electric mixer to beat everything together.
5. Gradually add 2 cups of ground sugar to the mix, and continue to beat until well blended.
6. Next, add 1 cup of ground cocoa to the mixture, and stir until well combined.
7. Pour the mixture into the greased cake pan, and spread it evenly.
8. Bake the cake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
9. Remove the cake from the oven, and let it cool for 10 minutes in the pan before removing it to a wire rack.
10. Once the cake has cooled completely, you can frost it with your favorite frosting or dust it with powdered sugar.
11. Slice and serve the cake with a nice cup of coffee or tea, and enjoy!
02ae085ffb:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C) and butter a 9-inch cake pan.
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream together 1 cup of creamy butter and 1 cup of ground sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add in 2 eggs that have been previously whipped, continuing to mix until well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, combine 2 cups of ground flour, 1 teaspoon of grain allspice, 1 teaspoon of ground garlic, 1 teaspoon of ground cinnamon, and 1/2 teaspoon of ground salt.
5. Gradually add dry ingredients to the butter mixture, alternating with 1 cup of liquid buttermilk until just combined.
6. Stir in 1 teaspoon of ground baking soda, 1/2 cup of chopped dates, and 1/2 cup of chopped pecans.
7. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan and bake for 40-45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
8. While the cake is still warm, brush it with your favorite jam and sprinkle with 1/4 cup of ground brown sugar.
9. Let the cake cool in the pan for at least 10 minutes before removing it onto a wire rack to cool completely.
10. For the creamy butter icing, combine 1/2 cup of creamy butter with 2 cups of liquid milk in a large mixing bowl.
11. Gradually add 4 cups of ground sugar, mixing until smooth and creamy.
12. Spread the icing on top of the cooled cake and enjoy!
031d450aa0:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F/180°C. Grease a 9-inch cake pan.
2. In a mixing bowl, beat the creamy butter until light and fluffy.
3. Gradually add the ground sugar to the bowl while continuing to beat the mixture.
4. Melt the solid cocoa in a double boiler or in the microwave until it becomes a liquid. Add it to the mixing bowl and mix well.
5. Add the liquid milk and liquid extract to the bowl and mix until well combined.
6. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan.
7. Bake the cake for 35-40 minutes until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
8. Remove the cake from the oven and allow it to cool for at least 15-20 minutes.
9. Once the cake has cooled to room temperature, use a knife to loosen it from the edges of the pan.
10. Top the cake with your favorite frosting, whipped cream or fresh fruit, and serve.
02eb83ff9d:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C) and grease a 9-inch cake pan with butter or cooking spray.
2. In a mixing bowl, combine 2 cups of ground flour, 2 teaspoons of ground baking powder, and 1 teaspoon of ground baking soda.
3. In a separate mixing bowl, cream together 1 cup of creamy butter and 1 and a half cups of ground sugar until light and fluffy.
4. Add in 2 whole eggs to the butter mixture and beat until well combined.
5. Gradually add the flour mixture to the butter mixture, alternating with 1 cup of creamy cream until everything is well mixed.
6. Add in 1 cup of baked sausage, 1 cup of blueberries, and 1/2 cup of chopped pecans to the batter, folding them in gently.
7. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan and smooth out the top with a spatula.
8. Bake the cake in the preheated oven for 45-50 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
9. While the cake is baking, make a glaze by combining 1/2 cup of ground sugar, 1 tablespoon of ground cornstarch, and 1/4 cup of liquid water in a small pot over medium heat. Stir until the mixture thickens and becomes translucent.
10. Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool for 10 minutes before removing it from the pan.
11. Drizzle the glaze over the cooled cake and sprinkle some fresh blueberries on top before serving. Optional: dust with powdered sugar.
01f5d32a8c:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a mixing bowl, combine two cups of flour, one and a half cups of sugar, one teaspoon of salt, and two teaspoons of baking powder. Mix well.
3. Melt one cup of diced marshmallows in a saucepan over low heat, stirring constantly, until it forms a thick liquid.
4. In a separate bowl, beat three eggs until thick and creamy. Slowly add one cup of the marshmallow liquid and one cup of liquid vanilla to the eggs while still beating.
5. Gradually add the flour mixture to the egg mixture and mix until a smooth batter forms.
6. Grease a 9-inch cake pan with cooking spray, then pour the batter into the pan.
7. Drizzle one cup of thick sauce syrup over the top of the batter, spreading it evenly.
8. Bake the cake in the preheated oven for 25 to 30 minutes or until the cake springs back when touched.
9. Allow the cake to cool for 10 minutes in the pan before transferring it to a wire baking rack to cool completely.
10. Cut the cake into slices and serve. Enjoy your moist and delicious cake with its special touch of diced marshmallow, liquid vanilla, and thick sauce syrup!
032752603d:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large saucepan, melt the sliced butter and add the liquid stout. Mix well and let the mixture cool down.
3. In a separate bowl, mix together the ground sugar, solid cocoa, and ground flour.
4. Add the mixture of dry ingredients to the cooled-down butter and stout mixture, and mix thoroughly.
5. Beat the eggs and add the liquid extract. Mix them into the batter.
6. Add the ground baking soda to the batter and mix well.
7. Grease a baking pan, and pour the batter into it.
8. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
9. Allow the cake to cool.
10. In a mixing bowl, mix together the creamy cream, creamy cheese, and ground sugar until smooth.
11. Spread the creamy cream mixture onto the top of the cake, and smooth it out.
12. Slice and serve! Enjoy your moist and delicious stout cake!
00cc328770:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Grease a 9-inch cake pan with butter or cooking spray.
3. In a mixing bowl, combine 2 cups of ground cake mix with 1 cup of liquid milk. Mix well.
4. Pour the mixture into the prepared cake pan.
5. Bake the cake for 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
6. Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool completely on a wire rack.
7. In a separate mixing bowl, beat 1 cup of creamy cream until soft peaks form.
8. Prepare a packet of jelly gelatin according to the package instructions.
9. Spread the jelly over the cooled cake.
10. Top the jelly layer with the creamy cream.
11. Spread a layer of thawed cool whip over the top of the creamy layer.
12. Decorate the cake by placing fresh raspberries on top.
13. Chill the cake in the fridge for a minimum of 1 hour before serving.
14. Enjoy your delicious raspberry cake!
0483c1ef9f:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F.
2. In a mixing bowl, combine 2 cups of ground cake and 1/2 cup of ground sugar. Mix them well until they are evenly combined.
3. Add 1 whole egg and 1/2 cup of liquid water to this mixture. Using a stand mixer or a hand mixer, beat the mixture on medium speed for 2-3 minutes until the batter is smooth, creamy and free of lumps.
4. Peel, core and chop 1 whole apple into bite-sized pieces. Add them into the batter and mix gently using a spatula.
5. Sprinkle 1 teaspoon of ground cinnamon into the batter and mix well.
6. Add 1/2 cup of softened butter to the mixture and mix well until the mixture is smooth.
7. Grease a cake pan with some butter or baking spray. Pour the batter into the pan and level it with a spatula.
8. Bake the cake in the preheated oven for 35-40 minutes until a toothpick comes out clean when inserted into the center of the cake.
9. Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool for 10-15 minutes.
10. Make the frosting by whipping 1 cup of creamy cream with 1/4 cup of ground sugar. Whip until the frosting is light and fluffy.
11. Once the cake has cooled down, spread the frosting over the cake using a spatula.
12. Voila! Your cake is ready to be served. Enjoy!
0499835254:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) and grease a 9-inch cake pan.
2. In a large mixing bowl, mix together 1 1/2 cups of ground flour, 1/2 cup of ground cocoa powder, 1 teaspoon of ground baking soda, and 1/2 teaspoon of ground salt.
3. Mix in 1 cup of ground sugar until fully incorporated.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together 1/2 cup of liquid oil, 1 cup of liquid water, 1 teaspoon of liquid extract (such as vanilla or almond), and 1 tablespoon of liquid vinegar.
5. Slowly pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients, mixing until the batter is smooth and no lumps remain.
6. Add in any additional mix-ins, such as 1/2 cup of pieces chip or 1/4 cup of jelly jam, and stir until evenly distributed.
7. Pour the batter into the greased cake pan and place into the preheated oven.
8. Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
9. Once the cake has finished baking, remove it from the oven and allow it to cool in the pan for 5-10 minutes before removing it from the pan and allowing it to cool completely on a wire rack.
10. Once the cake has cooled, spread a layer of jam over the top and serve with a drizzle of additional liquid water as desired. Enjoy!
02fe7f43f2:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C) and grease a 9-inch (23 cm) cake pan with butter or cooking spray.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine 2 cups of ground flour, 1 tsp of liquid baking soda, 1 tsp of dried ginger, and 1 tsp of mixed cinnamon. Mix them well with a whisk or a fork until all the ingredients are evenly blended.
3. Add ⅔ cup of creamy butter (at room temperature) to the dry ingredients and mix them together using an electric mixer or a spatula until the texture becomes crumbly and grainy.
4. Slowly pour in 1 cup of thick liquid molasses, ½ cup of thick sauce syrup, and ½ cup of thick sauce honey into the bowl. Mix the ingredients well until you get a smooth batter without any lumps.
5. Add 1 cup of ground sugar and ¾ cup of liquid milk to the batter and mix them until fully combined.
6. Fold in 2 tbsp of chopped gingerroot and 2 whipped eggs into the batter.
7. Pour the batter into the greased cake pan and level it out using a spatula.
8. Bake the cake in the preheated oven for 35 to 40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
9. Once baked, remove the cake from the oven and let it cool on a wire rack for 10 to 15 minutes.
10. Serve and enjoy your delicious ginger cake!
053225ab73:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C) and prepare a 9-inch round cake pan by greasing it with oil or butter.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine 2 cups of ground sugar and 1 cup of liquid water. Mix well until the sugar has dissolved in the water.
3. Add 1 cup of dried raisins and let it soak for 5-10 minutes. This will help the raisins become plump and juicy.
4. Add 1/2 cup of softened oil to the bowl and mix it well with the sugar and raisins.
5. Add 1 tablespoon of ground cinnamon and 1 teaspoon of ground garlic to the mixture. Mix everything together until it’s fully incorporated.
6. Add 3 cups of ground flour to the bowl, along with 1 teaspoon of ground salt. Mix it all together until a smooth batter forms.
7. Add 2 tablespoons of ground baking powder and 1 teaspoon of ground baking soda to the mixture. This will help the cake rise properly.
8. Finally, add 1/2 cup of chopped walnuts to the bowl and mix it until everything is combined.
9. Pour the cake batter into the prepared pan and bake for 35-40 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean when inserted into the center of the cake.
10. Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool in the pan for 10-15 minutes before transferring it onto a wire rack to cool completely.
11. Once the cake has cooled, you can slice it into portions and serve it as desired.
Enjoy your delicious homemade cake made with simple ingredients!
05d7b6a41f:
1. Preheat your oven to 180°C (160°C fan).
2. Prepare a 9-inch cake pan by greasing the bottom and sides with butter and flour.
3. Break the solid chocolate into small pieces and place it in a heatproof bowl.
4. Place the bowl over a pot of simmering water (double boiler) and stir the chocolate until it's melted and smooth.
5. Remove the bowl from the heat and set it aside.
6. In a separate large mixing bowl, cream the butter and sugar together until light and fluffy.
7. Beat in the eggs one at a time until the mixture is smooth.
8. Add the melted chocolate to the bowl and mix until well combined.
9. Stir in the baked chestnut until evenly distributed.
10. Gradually add the liquid milk to the mixture, stirring constantly to create a smooth batter.
11. Carefully pour the batter into the prepared cake pan.
12. Bake the cake in the preheated oven for 35-40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
13. Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool in the pan for 10 minutes.
14. Carefully remove the cake from the pan and let it cool completely on a wire rack.
15. Serve the cake plain or with your favorite frosting or toppings.
Enjoy your delicious chocolate chestnut cake!
05db7c1d76:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
2. In a mixing bowl, cream together 1 cup of creamy butter and 1 cup of creamy cream until they are well combined.
3. Add 2 cups of ground brown sugar to the bowl and mix until the mixture is light and fluffy.
4. Add 4 whipped eggs, one at a time, mixing each egg into the mixture completely before adding another.
5. Add 3 cups of whole flour to the bowl and mix until the dry ingredients are well incorporated.
6. Fold in 1/4 cup of thick sauce honey and 1/2 cup of chopped walnuts.
7. Add 1 tsp of ground baking soda to the mixture and stir well.
8. Grease a cake pan with butter and pour the batter into the pan, spreading it evenly.
9. Bake the cake for approximately 40-45 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
10. Remove the cake from the oven and allow it to cool before slicing and serving.
01df7a451d:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C) and grease a 9x13 inch cake pan.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine 1 can of drained, crushed pineapple, 1 tsp of ground vanilla, and 1/2 cup of liquid milk.
3. Mix in 1 (8 oz) package of softened cheese until well combined.
4. Stir in 1 cup of whole coconut and 1/2 cup of chopped whole nuts.
5. Add 1 box of cake mix to the bowl and mix until everything is well combined.
6. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan, and smooth out the surface with a spatula.
7. Bake the cake for about 40-45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
8. Let the cake cool down completely.
9. Once the cake is cooled, spread a layer of whipped whipped topping over the top.
10. Sprinkle shredded coconut and chopped nuts on top for decoration.
11. Serve and enjoy!
04e264d715:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F.
2. In a large bowl, mix 1 and 1/2 cups of whole flour, 1/2 cup of ground bran, 1/2 cup of flakes wheat, 1/2 cup of ground sugar, 1 tsp of ground cinnamon, 1/2 tsp of ground salt and 1 tsp of ground baking soda.
3. Add 2 whipped eggs, 1/2 cup of liquid oil, 1/2 cup of grated vegetable, 1/2 cup of chopped walnuts, 1/2 cup of dried raisins, and 1/4 cup of liquid coconut to the dry ingredients. Mix well.
4. Grease a cake pan with some oil and pour the batter into it.
5. Bake in the preheated oven for 35-40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
6. Once done, allow the cake to cool in the pan for 5-10 minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.
7. Once cooled, slice and serve. Enjoy!
07171db828:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C), and grease a 9-inch (22cm) round cake pan with butter.
2. In a large mixing bowl, add 1 cup (200g) of granulated sugar, and 2/3 cup (90g) of all-purpose flour. Also, add 1/3 cup (45g) of unsweetened cocoa powder, 1 teaspoon (5g) of baking powder, and 1/2 teaspoon (3g) of salt. Mix all the dry ingredients together.
3. In a separate bowl, beat 2 large eggs, then add 1/2 cup (120ml) of whole milk, 1/2 cup (120ml) of melted butter, and 1 teaspoon (5ml) of vanilla extract. Mix until all the wet ingredients are combined.
4. Gradually add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, whisking until the batter is smooth and there are no lumps.
5. Lastly, add 1/3 cup (45g) of chopped dark chocolate to the batter, and stir to combine.
6. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan and bake for 25-30 minutes until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
7. Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool down for 10 minutes.
8. In a saucepan, combine 1/4 cup (50g) of granulated sugar and 1/4 cup (60ml) of water. Bring the mixture to a simmer, stirring until the sugar is dissolved.
9. Remove the saucepan from the heat and add 1/4 cup (22g) of cocoa powder, whisking until the mixture is smooth.
10. Let the chocolate glaze cool for a few minutes before pouring it over the cake.
11. Slice and serve. Enjoy!
02d98ca22e:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F.
2. Grease a 9-inch cake pan.
3. In a mixing bowl, add 2 cups of all-purpose flour, 1 1/2 cups of granulated sugar, 2 teaspoons of baking powder and a pinch of salt. Mix well.
4. Make a well at the center of the bowl and add 3 room temperature whole eggs.
5. Use a hand mixer or a stand mixer to beat the eggs into the flour mix at medium speed until well combined.
6. Gradually pour in 1/2 cup of vegetable oil while still mixing.
7. Beat for an additional 2-3 minutes until the batter is smooth and creamy.
8. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan.
9. Bake in the preheated oven for about 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
10. Remove from oven and allow the cake to cool for at least 15 minutes before removing from the pan.
11. Serve and enjoy!
Optional: You can decorate the cake with frosting or icing of your choice.
013cdc210f:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. Grease a cake pan with oily cooking spray.
3. In a bowl, mix 2 cups of ground flour, 1 1/2 cups of ground sugar, 1 tsp of ground salt, 1 tsp of ground baking soda, and 1 tsp of ground cinnamon. 
4. In another bowl, whisk 3/4 cup of liquid oil and 2 whole eggs together until combined. 
5. Add 1 tsp of liquid extract to the wet ingredients and mix well. 
6. Slowly add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix until well combined. 
7. Fold in one peeled and chopped apple into the batter.
8. Pour the batter into the greased pan and smooth the top out with a spatula.
9. Bake the cake in the preheated oven for 35-40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
10. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 5-10 minutes before removing it from the pan and placing it on a wire rack to cool completely. 
11. Slice the cake and serve with your favorite toppings or frosting. Enjoy!
02413a3a01:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F/180°C.
2. Grease a 9-inch cake pan and dust some flour on it to prevent sticking.
3. In a bowl, sift together 2 cups of ground flour, 1 cup of solid cocoa, 2 tsp of ground baking powder and 1 tsp of ground salt.
4. In another bowl, beat 2 whole eggs and add 1 ½ cups of ground sugar to it. Mix until smooth.
5. Add 1 tsp of liquid vanilla and continue to mix.
6. Slowly mix in the dry mixture (flour, cocoa, baking powder, and salt) until it forms a smooth batter.
7. Add 1 cup of liquid milk and mix in the batter.
8. Pour 1/2 cup of the liquid butter into the batter and mix until incorporated.
9. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan.
10. Bake for approximately 30-40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center of the cake comes out clean.
11. While the cake is baking, mix 1 cup of creamy glaze, 1/2 cup of ground sugar and 3 tablespoons of liquid water to make a glaze.
12. Once the cake is done, let it cool before removing it from the pan.
13. Pour the glaze over the cake and spread evenly.
14. Allow the glaze to set before serving.
Voila! Your yummy cake is ready to be served.
038eff1e49:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Grease a cake pan with butter or cooking spray.
3. In a mixing bowl, combine the ground flour, ground sugar, ground salt, and ground baking soda until they are evenly mixed.
4. Add the softened creamy butter to the dry mixture and mix until the texture is crumbly.
5. In a separate mixing bowl, whisk the liquid buttermilk, whole egg, and liquid vanilla together.
6. Slowly mix the wet ingredients mixture into the dry ingredients mixture while stirring continuously. Ensure that there are no lumps.
7. Pour the cake batter into the greased cake pan.
8. Bake the cake in the preheated oven for approximately 30-40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
9. While the cake is baking, make the frosting by mixing together the creamy butter, ground cocoa, liquid milk, ground sugar, and liquid vanilla in a separate mixing bowl until it becomes smooth.
10. When the cake is ready, remove it from the oven and let it cool for about 10 minutes.
11. Remove the cake from the cake pan and let it cool completely.
12. Frost the cake with the prepared creamy icing using a spatula or a piping bag.
13. Decorate the cake according to your preference and serve.
05179de379:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) and grease a 9-inch (23 cm) cake pan.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine 2 cups of ground flour, 1 cup of ground sugar, 2 tsp of ground cinnamon, and 1 tsp of ground baking soda.
3. In a separate mixing bowl, whip 2 eggs until fluffy and stir in ½ cup of liquid oil and 1 tsp of liquid extract (vanilla, almond, or any flavor of your choice).
4. Peel and finely chop 1 medium-sized apple and fold it into the wet mixture.
5. Slowly pour the wet mixture into the dry mixture and blend thoroughly until it forms a smooth batter.
6. Stir in 1 cup of chopped nuts into the batter.
7. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan and smooth out the top with a spatula.
8. Put the cake pan into the preheated oven and bake for 45-50 minutes or until the cake is fully cooked.
9. Check doneness by inserting a toothpick in the center of the cake, it should come out clean.
10. Once done, remove the cake from the oven and let it cool down in the pan for at least 10 minutes before transferring it onto a wire rack to cool completely.
11. Garnish the cake with whipped cream or frosting of your choice before serving.
12. Slice the cake and serve to enjoy the scrumptious treat.
04b3c1ee97:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F.
2. Grease a 9-inch baking pan with some liquid oil.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine 2 cups of ground flour, 1 1/2 cups of ground sugar, 2 teaspoons of ground baking powder, 1 teaspoon of ground baking soda, and 1 teaspoon of ground salt.
4. Add in 1/4 teaspoon of ground saffron to the dry ingredients and mix well.
5. In another mixing bowl, blend 3/4 cup of creamy yogurt with 1/2 cup of liquid milk and 1/2 cup of liquid oil.
6. Add 1 tablespoon of liquid vinegar to the wet mixture and stir well.
7. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, stirring until everything is well combined.
8. Add 1/4 cup of liquid water to the mixture and continue stirring until the batter is smooth and uniform.
9. Fold in 1/2 cup of dried raisins.
10. Pour the batter into the prepared baking pan and bake for 35-40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
11. Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool for 10 minutes in the pan.
12. In the meantime, combine 1/4 cup of ground sugar with 1 tablespoon of liquid extract in a small saucepan over low heat, stirring continuously until the sugar dissolves and the mixture forms a thin syrup.
13. Transfer the cake to a serving plate and drizzle the syrup over the top.
14. Allow the cake to cool and serve. Enjoy your saffron-flavored raisin cake!
06be2ca5df:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a 9-inch baking pan with oil and lightly dust with flour.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the thick sauce cherry, seeded dates, grated apple, chopped walnuts, and sliced dried apricots. Mix well.
3. In a separate mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs and ground sugar until light and creamy.
4. Add the liquid oil and liquid vanilla to the egg mixture and whisk briefly to combine.
5. In another mixing bowl, sift together the ground flour, ground baking soda, ground baking powder, and ground salt.
6. Add the dry mixture into wet mixture and stir until just combined.
7. Fold in the fruit and nut mixture into the cake batter and stir until well combined.
8. Pour the batter into the prepared baking pan and smooth the top with a spatula.
9. Bake the cake for 50-60 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
10. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 5-10 minutes, then transfer it onto a wire rack to cool completely.
11. Once the cake is completely cool, you can slice and serve it with some whipped cream or ice cream. Enjoy!
